addon.text: And these were they which went up also from Telmelah, Telharesha, Cherub, Addon, and Immer: but they could not shew their father's house, nor their seed, whether they were of Israel.

ader.text: And Zebadiah, and Arad, and Ader,

adiel.text: And Elioenai, and Jaakobah, and Jeshohaiah, and Asaiah, and Adiel, and Jesimiel, and Benaiah,

adin.text: The children of Adin, four hundred fifty and four.

adina.text: Adina the son of Shiza the Reubenite, a captain of the Reubenites, and thirty with him,

adino.text: These be the names of the mighty men whom David had: The Tachmonite that sat in the seat, chief among the captains; the same was Adino the Eznite: he lift up his spear against eight hundred, whom he slew at one time.

adithaim.text: And Sharaim, and Adithaim, and Gederah, and Gederothaim; fourteen cities with their villages:

adjure.text: And the king said unto him, How many times shall I adjure thee that thou tell me nothing but that which is true in the name of the LORD?

adjured.text: And Joshua adjured them at that time, saying, Cursed be the man before the LORD, that riseth up and buildeth this city Jericho: he shall lay the foundation thereof in his firstborn, and in his youngest son shall he set up the gates of it.

adlai.text: And over the herds that fed in Sharon was Shitrai the Sharonite: and over the herds that were in the valleys was Shaphat the son of Adlai:

admatha.text: And the next unto him was Carshena, Shethar, Admatha, Tarshish, Meres, Marsena, and Memucan, the seven princes of Persia and Media, which saw the king's face, and which sat the first in the kingdom;)

administered.text: And not that only, but who was also chosen of the churches to travel with us with this grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the same Lord, and declaration of your ready mind:

administration.text: For the administration of this service not only supplieth the want of the saints, but is abundant also by many thanksgivings unto God;

administrations.text: And there are differences of administrations, but the same Lord.

admiration.text: These are murmurers, complainers, walking after their own lusts; and their mouth speaketh great swelling words, having men's persons in admiration because of advantage.

admired.text: When he shall come to be glorified in his saints, and to be admired in all them that believe (because our testimony among you was believed) in that day.

admonish.text: And I myself also am persuaded of you, my brethren, that ye also are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another.

admonished.text: Better is a poor and a wise child than an old and foolish king, who will no more be admonished.

admonishing.text: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom; teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.

admonition.text: Now all these things happened unto them for ensamples: and they are written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the world are come.

adna.text: And of the sons of Pahathmoab; Adna, and Chelal, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattaniah, Bezaleel, and Binnui, and Manasseh.

ado.text: And when he was come in, he saith unto them, Why make ye this ado, and weep? the damsel is not dead, but sleepeth.

adonijah.text: And the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith; and the fifth, Shephatiah the son of Abital;

adonikam.text: The children of Adonikam, six hundred sixty and six.

adonizedec.text: Now it came to pass, when Adonizedec king of Jerusalem had heard how Joshua had taken Ai, and had utterly destroyed it; as he had done to Jericho and her king, so he had done to Ai and her king; and how the inhabitants of Gibeon had made peace with Israel, and were among them;

adoption.text: For ye have not received the spirit of bondage again to fear; but ye have received the Spirit of adoption, whereby we cry, Abba, Father.

adoraim.text: And Adoraim, and Lachish, and Azekah,

adoram.text: And Adoram was over the tribute: and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder:

adorn.text: In like manner also, that women adorn themselves in modest apparel, with shamefacedness and sobriety; not with broided hair, or gold, or pearls, or costly array;

adorned.text: Again I will build thee, and thou shalt be built, O virgin of Israel: thou shalt again be adorned with thy tabrets, and shalt go forth in the dances of them that make merry.

adorneth.text: I will greatly rejoice in the LORD, my soul shall be joyful in my God; for he hath clothed me with the garments of salvation, he hath covered me with the robe of righteousness, as a bridegroom decketh himself with ornaments, and as a bride adorneth herself with her jewels.

adorning.text: Whose adorning let it not be that outward adorning of plaiting the hair, and of wearing of gold, or of putting on of apparel;

adrammelech.text: And the Avites made Nibhaz and Tartak, and the Sepharvites burnt their children in fire to Adrammelech and Anammelech, the gods of Sepharvaim.

adramyttium.text: And entering into a ship of Adramyttium, we launched, meaning to sail by the coasts of Asia; one Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica, being with us.

adria.text: But when the fourteenth night was come, as we were driven up and down in Adria, about midnight the shipmen deemed that they drew near to some country;

adriel.text: But it came to pass at the time when Merab Saul's daughter should have been given to David, that she was given unto Adriel the Meholathite to wife.

adullam.text: The king of Libnah, one; the king of Adullam, one;

adullamite.text: And it came to pass at that time, that Judah went down from his brethren, and turned in to a certain Adullamite, whose name was Hirah.

adulterer.text: And the man that committeth adultery with another man's wife, even he that committeth adultery with his neighbour's wife, the adulterer and the adulteress shall surely be put to death.

adulterers.text: When thou sawest a thief, then thou consentedst with him, and hast been partaker with adulterers.

adulteress.text: And the man that committeth adultery with another man's wife, even he that committeth adultery with his neighbour's wife, the adulterer and the adulteress shall surely be put to death.

adulteresses.text: And the righteous men, they shall judge them after the manner of adulteresses, and after the manner of women that shed blood; because they are adulteresses, and blood is in their hands.

adulteries.text: I have seen thine adulteries, and thy neighings, the lewdness of thy whoredom, and thine abominations on the hills in the fields. Woe unto thee, O Jerusalem! wilt thou not be made clean? when shall it once be?

adulterous.text: Such is the way of an adulterous woman; she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness.

adummim.text: And the border went up toward Debir from the valley of Achor, and so northward, looking toward Gilgal, that is before the going up to Adummim, which is on the south side of the river: and the border passed toward the waters of Enshemesh, and the goings out thereof were at Enrogel:

advanced.text: And Samuel said unto the people, It is the LORD that advanced Moses and Aaron, and that brought your fathers up out of the land of Egypt.

advantage.text: For thou saidst, What advantage will it be unto thee? and, What profit shall I have, if I be cleansed from my sin?

advantaged.text: For what is a man advantaged, if he gain the whole world, and lose himself, or be cast away?

advantageth.text: If after the manner of men I have fought with beasts at Ephesus, what advantageth it me, if the dead rise not? let us eat and drink; for to morrow we die.

adventure.text: The tender and delicate woman among you, which would not adventure to set the sole of her foot upon the ground for delicateness and tenderness, her eye shall be evil toward the husband of her bosom, and toward her son, and toward her daughter,

adventured.text: (For my father fought for you, and adventured his life far, and delivered you out of the hand of Midian:

adversaries.text: But if thou shalt indeed obey his voice, and do all that I speak; then I will be an enemy unto thine enemies, and an adversary unto thine adversaries.

adversary.text: But if thou shalt indeed obey his voice, and do all that I speak; then I will be an enemy unto thine enemies, and an adversary unto thine adversaries.

adversities.text: And ye have this day rejected your God, who himself saved you out of all your adversities and your tribulations; and ye have said unto him, Nay, but set a king over us. Now therefore present yourselves before the LORD by your tribes, and by your thousands.

adversity.text: And David answered Rechab and Baanah his brother, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, and said unto them, As the LORD liveth, who hath redeemed my soul out of all adversity,

advertise.text: And now, behold, I go unto my people: come therefore, and I will advertise thee what this people shall do to thy people in the latter days.

advice.text: And it was so, that all that saw it said, There was no such deed done nor seen from the day that the children of Israel came up out of the land of Egypt unto this day: consider of it, take advice, and speak your minds.

advise.text: So Gad came to David, and told him, and said unto him, Shall seven years of famine come unto thee in thy land? or wilt thou flee three months before thine enemies, while they pursue thee? or that there be three days' pestilence in thy land? now advise, and see what answer I shall return to him that sent me.

advised.text: Only by pride cometh contention: but with the well advised is wisdom.

advisement.text: And there fell some of Manasseh to David, when he came with the Philistines against Saul to battle: but they helped them not: for the lords of the Philistines upon advisement sent him away, saying, He will fall to his master Saul to the jeopardy of our heads.

advocate.text: My little children, these things write I unto you, that ye sin not. And if any man sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous:

aeneas.text: And there he found a certain man named Aeneas, which had kept his bed eight years, and was sick of the palsy.

aenon.text: And John also was baptizing in Aenon near to Salim, because there was much water there: and they came, and were baptized.

afar.text: Then on the third day Abraham lifted up his eyes, and saw the place afar off.

affairs.text: And his brethren, men of valour, were two thousand and seven hundred chief fathers, whom king David made rulers over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh, for every matter pertaining to God, and affairs of the king.

affect.text: They zealously affect you, but not well; yea, they would exclude you, that ye might affect them.

affected.text: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles, and made their minds evil affected against the brethren.

affecteth.text: Mine eye affecteth mine heart because of all the daughters of my city.

affection.text: Moreover, because I have set my affection to the house of my God, I have of mine own proper good, of gold and silver, which I have given to the house of my God, over and above all that I have prepared for the holy house,

affectionately.text: So being affectionately desirous of you, we were willing to have imparted unto you, not the gospel of God only, but also our own souls, because ye were dear unto us.

affectioned.text: Be kindly affectioned one to another with brotherly love; in honour preferring one another;

affections.text: For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections: for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature:

affinity.text: And Solomon made affinity with Pharaoh king of Egypt, and took Pharaoh's daughter, and brought her into the city of David, until he had made an end of building his own house, and the house of the LORD, and the wall of Jerusalem round about.

affirm.text: And not rather, (as we be slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say,) Let us do evil, that good may come? whose damnation is just.

affirmed.text: And about the space of one hour after another confidently affirmed, saying, Of a truth this fellow also was with him: for he is a Galilaean.

afflict.text: And he said unto Abram, Know of a surety that thy seed shall be a stranger in a land that is not theirs, and shall serve them; and they shall afflict them four hundred years;

afflicted.text: But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and grew. And they were grieved because of the children of Israel.

afflictest.text: When heaven is shut up, and there is no rain, because they have sinned against thee; if they pray toward this place, and confess thy name, and turn from their sin, when thou afflictest them:

affliction.text: And the angel of the LORD said unto her, Behold, thou art with child, and shalt bear a son, and shalt call his name Ishmael; because the LORD hath heard thy affliction.

afflictions.text: Many are the afflictions of the righteous: but the LORD delivereth him out of them all.

affording.text: That our garners may be full, affording all manner of store: that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets:

affright.text: Then they cried with a loud voice in the Jews' speech unto the people of Jerusalem that were on the wall, to affright them, and to trouble them; that they might take the city.

affrighted.text: Thou shalt not be affrighted at them: for the LORD thy God is among you, a mighty God and terrible.

afoot.text: And the people saw them departing, and many knew him, and ran afoot thither out of all cities, and outwent them, and came together unto him.

aforetime.text: And he had prepared for him a great chamber, where aforetime they laid the meat offerings, the frankincense, and the vessels, and the tithes of the corn, the new wine, and the oil, which was commanded to be given to the Levites, and the singers, and the porters; and the offerings of the priests.

afraid.text: And he said, I heard thy voice in the garden, and I was afraid, because I was naked; and I hid myself.

afresh.text: If they shall fall away, to renew them again unto repentance; seeing they crucify to themselves the Son of God afresh, and put him to an open shame.

after.text: And God said, Let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed, and the fruit tree yielding fruit after his kind, whose seed is in itself, upon the earth: and it was so.

afternoon.text: And he arose early in the morning on the fifth day to depart: and the damsel's father said, Comfort thine heart, I pray thee. And they tarried until afternoon, and they did eat both of them.

afterwards.text: And afterwards she bare a daughter, and called her name Dinah.

again.text: And she again bare his brother Abel. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.

ages.text: That in the ages to come he might shew the exceeding riches of his grace in his kindness toward us through Christ Jesus.

ago.text: And as for thine asses that were lost three days ago, set not thy mind on them; for they are found. And on whom is all the desire of Israel? Is it not on thee, and on all thy father's house?

agree.text: Agree with thine adversary quickly, whiles thou art in the way with him; lest at any time the adversary deliver thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and thou be cast into prison.

agreed.text: Can two walk together, except they be agreed?

ahinadab.text: Ahinadab the son of Iddo had Mahanaim:

ahinoam.text: And the name of Saul's wife was Ahinoam, the daughter of Ahimaaz: and the name of the captain of his host was Abner, the son of Ner, Saul's uncle.

ahira.text: Of Naphtali; Ahira the son of Enan.

ahiram.text: The sons of Benjamin after their families: of Bela, the family of the Belaites: of Ashbel, the family of the Ashbelites: of Ahiram, the family of the Ahiramites:

ahisamach.text: And I, behold, I have given with him Aholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan: and in the hearts of all that are wise hearted I have put wisdom, that they may make all that I have commanded thee;

ahishahar.text: The sons also of Jediael; Bilhan: and the sons of Bilhan; Jeush, and Benjamin, and Ehud, and Chenaanah, and Zethan, and Tharshish, and Ahishahar.

ahishar.text: And Ahishar was over the household: and Adoniram the son of Abda was over the tribute.

ahitub.text: And Ahiah, the son of Ahitub, Ichabod's brother, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eli, the LORD's priest in Shiloh, wearing an ephod. And the people knew not that Jonathan was gone.

ahlab.text: Neither did Asher drive out the inhabitants of Accho, nor the inhabitants of Zidon, nor of Ahlab, nor of Achzib, nor of Helbah, nor of Aphik, nor of Rehob:

ahlai.text: And the sons of Appaim; Ishi. And the sons of Ishi; Sheshan. And the children of Sheshan; Ahlai.

ahoah.text: And Abishua, and Naaman, and Ahoah,

ahohite.text: And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodo the Ahohite, one of the three mighty men with David, when they defied the Philistines that were there gathered together to battle, and the men of Israel were gone away:

aholah.text: And the names of them were Aholah the elder, and Aholibah her sister: and they were mine, and they bare sons and daughters. Thus were their names; Samaria is Aholah, and Jerusalem Aholibah.

aholiab.text: And I, behold, I have given with him Aholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan: and in the hearts of all that are wise hearted I have put wisdom, that they may make all that I have commanded thee;

aholibah.text: And the names of them were Aholah the elder, and Aholibah her sister: and they were mine, and they bare sons and daughters. Thus were their names; Samaria is Aholah, and Jerusalem Aholibah.

aholibamah.text: Esau took his wives of the daughters of Canaan; Adah the daughter of Elon the Hittite, and Aholibamah the daughter of Anah the daughter of Zibeon the Hivite;

ahuzam.text: And Naarah bare him Ahuzam, and Hepher, and Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.

ahuzzath.text: Then Abimelech went to him from Gerar, and Ahuzzath one of his friends, and Phichol the chief captain of his army.

ai.text: And Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is beside Bethaven, on the east side of Bethel, and spake unto them, saying, Go up and view the country.  And the men went up and viewed Ai.

aiah.text: And Saul had a concubine, whose name was Rizpah, the daughter of Aiah: and Ishbosheth said to Abner, Wherefore hast thou gone in unto my father's concubine?

aiath.text: He is come to Aiath, he is passed to Migron; at Michmash he hath laid up his carriages:

aided.text: That the cruelty done to the threescore and ten sons of Jerubbaal might come, and their blood be laid upon Abimelech their brother, which slew them; and upon the men of Shechem, which aided him in the killing of his brethren.

aija.text: The children also of Benjamin from Geba dwelt at Michmash, and Aija, and Bethel, and in their villages,

aijalon.text: Aijalon with her suburbs, Gathrimmon with her suburbs; four cities.

ailed.text: What ailed thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest? thou Jordan, that thou wast driven back?

aileth.text: And God heard the voice of the lad; and the angel of God called to Hagar out of heaven, and said unto her, What aileth thee, Hagar? fear not; for God hath heard the voice of the lad where he is.

ain.text: And the coast shall go down from Shepham to Riblah, on the east side of Ain; and the border shall descend, and shall reach unto the side of the sea of Chinnereth eastward:

air.text: And God said, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.

ajah.text: And these are the children of Zibeon; both Ajah, and Anah: this was that Anah that found the mules in the wilderness, as he fed the asses of Zibeon his father.

ajalon.text: Then spake Joshua to the LORD in the day when the LORD delivered up the Amorites before the children of Israel, and he said in the sight of Israel, Sun, stand thou still upon Gibeon; and thou, Moon, in the valley of Ajalon.

beast.text: And God said, Let the earth bring forth the living creature after his kind, cattle, and creeping thing, and beast of the earth after his kind: and it was so.

beasts.text: Of every clean beast thou shalt take to thee by sevens, the male and his female: and of beasts that are not clean by two, the male and his female.

beat.text: And thou shalt beat some of it very small, and put of it before the testimony in the tabernacle of the congregation, where I will meet with thee: it shall be unto you most holy.

beaten.text: And the officers of the children of Israel, which Pharaoh's taskmasters had set over them, were beaten, and demanded, Wherefore have ye not fulfilled your task in making brick both yesterday and to day, as heretofore?

beatest.text: When thou beatest thine olive tree, thou shalt not go over the boughs again: it shall be for the stranger, for the fatherless, and for the widow.

beateth.text: I therefore so run, not as uncertainly; so fight I, not as one that beateth the air:

beating.text: And the watchmen of Saul in Gibeah of Benjamin looked; and, behold, the multitude melted away, and they went on beating down one another.

beauties.text: Thy people shall be willing in the day of thy power, in the beauties of holiness from the womb of the morning: thou hast the dew of thy youth.

beautiful.text: Leah was tender eyed; but Rachel was beautiful and well favoured.

beautify.text: Blessed be the LORD God of our fathers, which hath put such a thing as this in the king's heart, to beautify the house of the LORD which is in Jerusalem:

beauty.text: And thou shalt make holy garments for Aaron thy brother for glory and for beauty.

bebai.text: The children of Bebai, six hundred twenty and three.

became.text: And the LORD God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.

becamest.text: For thy people Israel didst thou make thine own people for ever; and thou, LORD, becamest their God.

because.text: And God blessed the seventh day, and sanctified it: because that in it he had rested from all his work which God created and made.

becher.text: And the sons of Benjamin were Belah, and Becher, and Ashbel, Gera, and Naaman, Ehi, and Rosh, Muppim, and Huppim, and Ard.

bechorath.text: Now there was a man of Benjamin, whose name was Kish, the son of Abiel, the son of Zeror, the son of Bechorath, the son of Aphiah, a Benjamite, a mighty man of power.

beckoned.text: And when he came out, he could not speak unto them: and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple: for he beckoned unto them, and remained speechless.

beckoning.text: But he, beckoning unto them with the hand to hold their peace, declared unto them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, Go shew these things unto James, and to the brethren. And he departed, and went into another place.

become.text: And the LORD God said, Behold, the man is become as one of us, to know good and evil: and now, lest he put forth his hand, and take also of the tree of life, and eat, and live for ever:

becometh.text: Thy testimonies are very sure: holiness becometh thine house, O LORD, for ever.

bed.text: And he said, Swear unto me. And he sware unto him. And Israel bowed himself upon the bed's head.

bedad.text: And Husham died, and Hadad the son of Bedad, who smote Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Avith.

bedan.text: And the LORD sent Jerubbaal, and Bedan, and Jephthah, and Samuel, and delivered you out of the hand of your enemies on every side, and ye dwelled safe.

bedchamber.text: And the river shall bring forth frogs abundantly, which shall go up and come into thine house, and into thy bedchamber, and upon thy bed, and into the house of thy servants, and upon thy people, and into thine ovens, and into thy kneadingtroughs:

beds.text: Brought beds, and basons, and earthen vessels, and wheat, and barley, and flour, and parched corn, and beans, and lentiles, and parched pulse,

bedstead.text: For only Og king of Bashan remained of the remnant of giants; behold, his bedstead was a bedstead of iron; is it not in Rabbath of the children of Ammon? nine cubits was the length thereof, and four cubits the breadth of it, after the cubit of a man.

bee.text: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the LORD shall hiss for the fly that is in the uttermost part of the rivers of Egypt, and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.

beeliada.text: And Elishama, and Beeliada, and Eliphalet.

beelzebub.text: It is enough for the disciple that he be as his master, and the servant as his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub, how much more shall they call them of his household?

been.text: And he went on his journeys from the south even to Bethel, unto the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between Bethel and Hai;

beer.text: And from thence they went to Beer: that is the well whereof the LORD spake unto Moses, Gather the people together, and I will give them water.

beera.text: Bezer, and Hod, and Shamma, and Shilshah, and Ithran, and Beera.

beerah.text: Beerah his son, whom Tilgathpilneser king of Assyria carried away captive: he was prince of the Reubenites.

beerelim.text: For the cry is gone round about the borders of Moab; the howling thereof unto Eglaim, and the howling thereof unto Beerelim.

beeri.text: And Esau was forty years old when he took to wife Judith the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Bashemath the daughter of Elon the Hittite:

beerlahairoi.text: Wherefore the well was called Beerlahairoi; behold, it is between Kadesh and Bered.

beeroth.text: And the children of Israel took their journey from Beeroth of the children of Jaakan to Mosera: there Aaron died, and there he was buried; and Eleazar his son ministered in the priest's office in his stead.

beerothite.text: And Saul's son had two men that were captains of bands: the name of the one was Baanah, and the name of the other Rechab, the sons of Rimmon a Beerothite, of the children of Benjamin: (for Beeroth also was reckoned to Benjamin.

beerothites.text: And the Beerothites fled to Gittaim, and were sojourners there until this day.)

beersheba.text: And Abraham rose up early in the morning, and took bread, and a bottle of water, and gave it unto Hagar, putting it on her shoulder, and the child, and sent her away: and she departed, and wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba.

bees.text: And the Amorites, which dwelt in that mountain, came out against you, and chased you, as bees do, and destroyed you in Seir, even unto Hormah.

beeshterah.text: And unto the children of Gershon, of the families of the Levites, out of the other half tribe of Manasseh they gave Golan in Bashan with her suburbs, to be a city of refuge for the slayer; and Beeshterah with her suburbs; two cities.

beetle.text: Even these of them ye may eat; the locust after his kind, and the bald locust after his kind, and the beetle after his kind, and the grasshopper after his kind.

beeves.text: Ye shall offer at your own will a male without blemish, of the beeves, of the sheep, or of the goats.

befall.text: But Benjamin, Joseph's brother, Jacob sent not with his brethren; for he said, Lest peradventure mischief befall him.

befallen.text: And Aaron said unto Moses, Behold, this day have they offered their sin offering and their burnt offering before the LORD; and such things have befallen me: and if I had eaten the sin offering to day, should it have been accepted in the sight of the LORD?

befalleth.text: For that which befalleth the sons of men befalleth beasts; even one thing befalleth them: as the one dieth, so dieth the other; yea, they have all one breath; so that a man hath no preeminence above a beast: for all is vanity.

befell.text: And they came unto Jacob their father unto the land of Canaan, and told him all that befell unto them; saying,

before.text: And every plant of the field before it was in the earth, and every herb of the field before it grew: for the LORD God had not caused it to rain upon the earth, and there was not a man to till the ground.

beforehand.text: But when they shall lead you, and deliver you up, take no thought beforehand what ye shall speak, neither do ye premeditate: but whatsoever shall be given you in that hour, that speak ye: for it is not ye that speak, but the Holy Ghost.

beforetime.text: The Horims also dwelt in Seir beforetime; but the children of Esau succeeded them, when they had destroyed them from before them, and dwelt in their stead; as Israel did unto the land of his possession, which the LORD gave unto them.

beg.text: Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek their bread also out of their desolate places.

began.text: And to Seth, to him also there was born a son; and he called his name Enos: then began men to call upon the name of the LORD.

begat.text: And unto Enoch was born Irad: and Irad begat Mehujael: and Mehujael begat Methusael: and Methusael begat Lamech.

beget.text: And as for Ishmael, I have heard thee: Behold, I have blessed him, and will make him fruitful, and will multiply him exceedingly; twelve princes shall he beget, and I will make him a great nation.

begettest.text: And thy issue, which thou begettest after them, shall be thine, and shall be called after the name of their brethren in their inheritance.

begetteth.text: He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow: and the father of a fool hath no joy.

beggar.text: He raiseth up the poor out of the dust, and lifteth up the beggar from the dunghill, to set them among princes, and to make them inherit the throne of glory: for the pillars of the earth are the LORD's, and he hath set the world upon them.

beggarly.text: But now, after that ye have known God, or rather are known of God, how turn ye again to the weak and beggarly elements, whereunto ye desire again to be in bondage?

begged.text: He went to Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be delivered.

begging.text: I have been young, and now am old; yet have I not seen the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging bread.

begin.text: And the LORD said, Behold, the people is one, and they have all one language; and this they begin to do: and now nothing will be restrained from them, which they have imagined to do.

beginnest.text: Seven weeks shalt thou number unto thee: begin to number the seven weeks from such time as thou beginnest to put the sickle to the corn.

beginning.text: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.

beginnings.text: Also in the day of your gladness, and in your solemn days, and in the beginnings of your months, ye shall blow with the trumpets over your burnt offerings, and over the sacrifices of your peace offerings; that they may be to you for a memorial before your God: I am the LORD your God.

begotten.text: And the days of Adam after he had begotten Seth were eight hundred years: and he begat sons and daughters:

beguile.text: And this I say, lest any man should beguile you with enticing words.

beguiled.text: And the LORD God said unto the woman, What is this that thou hast done? And the woman said, The serpent beguiled me, and I did eat.

beguiling.text: Having eyes full of adultery, and that cannot cease from sin; beguiling unstable souls: an heart they have exercised with covetous practices; cursed children:

begun.text: And Moses said unto Aaron, Take a censer, and put fire therein from off the altar, and put on incense, and go quickly unto the congregation, and make an atonement for them: for there is wrath gone out from the LORD; the plague is begun.

behalf.text: In the tabernacle of the congregation without the vail, which is before the testimony, Aaron and his sons shall order it from evening to morning before the LORD: it shall be a statute for ever unto their generations on the behalf of the children of Israel.

behave.text: Were it not that I feared the wrath of the enemy, lest their adversaries should behave themselves strangely, and lest they should say, Our hand is high, and the LORD hath not done all this.

behaved.text: And David went out whithersoever Saul sent him, and behaved himself wisely: and Saul set him over the men of war, and he was accepted in the sight of all the people, and also in the sight of Saul's servants.

behaveth.text: But if any man think that he behaveth himself uncomely toward his virgin, if she pass the flower of her age, and need so require, let him do what he will, he sinneth not: let them marry.

behaviour.text: And he changed his behaviour before them, and feigned himself mad in their hands, and scrabbled on the doors of the gate, and let his spittle fall down upon his beard.

beheaded.text: And all the elders of that city, that are next unto the slain man, shall wash their hands over the heifer that is beheaded in the valley:

beheld.text: And it came to pass, that, when Abram was come into Egypt, the Egyptians beheld the woman that she was very fair.

behemoth.text: Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.

behind.text: And he said, I will certainly return unto thee according to the time of life; and, lo, Sarah thy wife shall have a son. And Sarah heard it in the tent door, which was behind him.

behold.text: And God said, Behold, I have given you every herb bearing seed, which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in the which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for meat.

beholdest.text: Thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.

beholdeth.text: He is swift as the waters; their portion is cursed in the earth: he beholdeth not the way of the vineyards.

beholding.text: Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity; and quicken thou me in thy way.

behoved.text: And said unto them, Thus it is written, and thus it behoved Christ to suffer, and to rise from the dead the third day:

being.text: Therefore Sarah laughed within herself, saying, After I am waxed old shall I have pleasure, my lord being old also?

bekah.text: A bekah for every man, that is, half a shekel, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for every one that went to be numbered, from twenty years old and upward, for six hundred thousand and three thousand and five hundred and fifty men.

bel.text: Bel boweth down, Nebo stoopeth, their idols were upon the beasts, and upon the cattle: your carriages were heavy loaden; they are a burden to the weary beast.

bela.text: That these made war with Bera king of Sodom, and with Birsha king of Gomorrah, Shinab king of Admah, and Shemeber king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar.

belah.text: And the sons of Benjamin were Belah, and Becher, and Ashbel, Gera, and Naaman, Ehi, and Rosh, Muppim, and Huppim, and Ard.

belch.text: Behold, they belch out with their mouth: swords are in their lips: for who, say they, doth hear?

belial.text: Certain men, the children of Belial, are gone out from among you, and have withdrawn the inhabitants of their city, saying, Let us go and serve other gods, which ye have not known;

belied.text: They have belied the LORD, and said, It is not he; neither shall evil come upon us; neither shall we see sword nor famine:

belief.text: But we are bound to give thanks alway to God for you, brethren beloved of the Lord, because God hath from the beginning chosen you to salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth:

believe.text: And Moses answered and said, But, behold, they will not believe me, nor hearken unto my voice: for they will say, The LORD hath not appeared unto thee.

believed.text: And he believed in the LORD; and he counted it to him for righteousness.

believers.text: And believers were the more added to the Lord, multitudes both of men and women.)

believest.text: And, behold, thou shalt be dumb, and not able to speak, until the day that these things shall be performed, because thou believest not my words, which shall be fulfilled in their season.

believeth.text: He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.

believing.text: And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive.

bell.text: A golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, upon the hem of the robe round about.

bellies.text: One of themselves, even a prophet of their own, said, The Cretians are alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.

bellow.text: Because ye were glad, because ye rejoiced, O ye destroyers of mine heritage, because ye are grown fat as the heifer at grass, and bellow as bulls;

bellows.text: The bellows are burned, the lead is consumed of the fire; the founder melteth in vain: for the wicked are not plucked away.

bells.text: And beneath upon the hem of it thou shalt make pomegranates of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, round about the hem thereof; and bells of gold between them round about:

belly.text: And the LORD God said unto the serpent, Because thou hast done this, thou art cursed above all cattle, and above every beast of the field; upon thy belly shalt thou go, and dust shalt thou eat all the days of thy life:

belong.text: And they said unto him, We have dreamed a dream, and there is no interpreter of it. And Joseph said unto them, Do not interpretations belong to God? tell me them, I pray you.

belonged.text: Now Manasseh had the land of Tappuah: but Tappuah on the border of Manasseh belonged to the children of Ephraim;

belongest.text: And David said unto him, To whom belongest thou? and whence art thou? And he said, I am a young man of Egypt, servant to an Amalekite; and my master left me, because three days agone I fell sick.

belongeth.text: This is it that belongeth unto the Levites: from twenty and five years old and upward they shall go in to wait upon the service of the tabernacle of the congregation:

belonging.text: But unto the sons of Kohath he gave none: because the service of the sanctuary belonging unto them was that they should bear upon their shoulders.

beloved.text: If a man have two wives, one beloved, and another hated, and they have born him children, both the beloved and the hated; and if the firstborn son be hers that was hated:

belshazzar.text: Belshazzar the king made a great feast to a thousand of his lords, and drank wine before the thousand.

belteshazzar.text: Unto whom the prince of the eunuchs gave names: for he gave unto Daniel the name of Belteshazzar; and to Hananiah, of Shadrach; and to Mishael, of Meshach; and to Azariah, of Abednego.

bemoan.text: For who shall have pity upon thee, O Jerusalem? or who shall bemoan thee? or who shall go aside to ask how thou doest?

bemoaned.text: Then came there unto him all his brethren, and all his sisters, and all they that had been of his acquaintance before, and did eat bread with him in his house: and they bemoaned him, and comforted him over all the evil that the LORD had brought upon him: every man also gave him a piece of money, and every one an earring of gold.

bemoaning.text: I have surely heard Ephraim bemoaning himself thus; Thou hast chastised me, and I was chastised, as a bullock unaccustomed to the yoke: turn thou me, and I shall be turned; for thou art the LORD my God.

ben.text: And with them their brethren of the second degree, Zechariah, Ben, and Jaaziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, Eliab, and Benaiah, and Maaseiah, and Mattithiah, and Elipheleh, and Mikneiah, and Obededom, and Jeiel, the porters.

benaiah.text: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over both the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and David's sons were chief rulers.

benammi.text: And the younger, she also bare a son, and called his name Benammi: the same is the father of the children of Ammon unto this day.

benches.text: Of the oaks of Bashan have they made thine oars; the company of the Ashurites have made thy benches of ivory, brought out of the isles of Chittim.

bend.text: For, lo, the wicked bend their bow, they make ready their arrow upon the string, that they may privily shoot at the upright in heart.

bendeth.text: Let them melt away as waters which run continually: when he bendeth his bow to shoot his arrows, let them be as cut in pieces.

bending.text: The sons also of them that afflicted thee shall come bending unto thee; and all they that despised thee shall bow themselves down at the soles of thy feet; and they shall call thee, The city of the LORD, The Zion of the Holy One of Israel.

beneath.text: But Deborah Rebekah's nurse died, and she was buried beneath Bethel under an oak: and the name of it was called Allonbachuth.

beneberak.text: And Jehud, and Beneberak, and Gathrimmon,

benefactors.text: And he said unto them, The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them; and they that exercise authority upon them are called benefactors.

benefit.text: But Hezekiah rendered not again according to the benefit done unto him; for his heart was lifted up: therefore there was wrath upon him, and upon Judah and Jerusalem.

benefits.text: Blessed be the Lord, who daily loadeth us with benefits, even the God of our salvation. Selah.

benejaakan.text: And they departed from Moseroth, and pitched in Benejaakan.

benevolence.text: Let the husband render unto the wife due benevolence: and likewise also the wife unto the husband.

benhadad.text: Then Asa took all the silver and the gold that were left in the treasures of the house of the LORD, and the treasures of the king's house, and delivered them into the hand of his servants: and king Asa sent them to Benhadad, the son of Tabrimon, the son of Hezion, king of Syria, that dwelt at Damascus, saying,

benhail.text: Also in the third year of his reign he sent to his princes, even to Benhail, and to Obadiah, and to Zechariah, and to Nethaneel, and to Michaiah, to teach in the cities of Judah.

benhanan.text: And the sons of Shimon were, Amnon, and Rinnah, Benhanan, and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi were, Zoheth, and Benzoheth.

benjamin.text: And it came to pass, as her soul was in departing, (for she died) that she called his name Benoni: but his father called him Benjamin.

benjamite.text: But when the children of Israel cried unto the LORD, the LORD raised them up a deliverer, Ehud the son of Gera, a Benjamite, a man lefthanded: and by him the children of Israel sent a present unto Eglon the king of Moab.

benjamites.text: And, behold, there came an old man from his work out of the field at even, which was also of mount Ephraim; and he sojourned in Gibeah: but the men of the place were Benjamites.

beno.text: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi: the sons of Jaaziah; Beno.

benoni.text: And it came to pass, as her soul was in departing, (for she died) that she called his name Benoni: but his father called him Benjamin.

bent.text: If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.

benzoheth.text: And the sons of Shimon were, Amnon, and Rinnah, Benhanan, and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi were, Zoheth, and Benzoheth.

bera.text: That these made war with Bera king of Sodom, and with Birsha king of Gomorrah, Shinab king of Admah, and Shemeber king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar.

beraiah.text: And Adaiah, and Beraiah, and Shimrath, the sons of Shimhi;

berea.text: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea: who coming thither went into the synagogue of the Jews.

bereave.text: There is one alone, and there is not a second; yea, he hath neither child nor brother: yet is there no end of all his labour; neither is his eye satisfied with riches; neither saith he, For whom do I labour, and bereave my soul of good? This is also vanity, yea, it is a sore travail.

bereaved.text: And Jacob their father said unto them, Me have ye bereaved of my children: Joseph is not, and Simeon is not, and ye will take Benjamin away: all these things are against me.

bereaveth.text: Behold, O LORD; for I am in distress: my bowels are troubled; mine heart is turned within me; for I have grievously rebelled: abroad the sword bereaveth, at home there is as death.

bered.text: Wherefore the well was called Beerlahairoi; behold, it is between Kadesh and Bered.

beriites.text: Of the children of Asher after their families: of Jimna, the family of the Jimnites: of Jesui, the family of the Jesuites: of Beriah, the family of the Beriites.

bernice.text: And after certain days king Agrippa and Bernice came unto Caesarea to salute Festus.

beryl.text: And the fourth row a beryl, and an onyx, and a jasper: they shall be set in gold in their inclosings.

beseeching.text: And when Jesus was entered into Capernaum, there came unto him a centurion, beseeching him,
