necromancer.text: Or a charmer, or a consulter with familiar spirits, or a wizard, or a necromancer.

nedabiah.text: Malchiram also, and Pedaiah, and Shenazar, Jecamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.

need.text: But thou shalt open thine hand wide unto him, and shalt surely lend him sufficient for his need, in that which he wanteth.

needed.text: And needed not that any should testify of man: for he knew what was in man.

needest.text: Now are we sure that thou knowest all things, and needest not that any man should ask thee: by this we believe that thou camest forth from God.

needeth.text: And Esau said, Let me now leave with thee some of the folk that are with me. And he said, What needeth it? let me find grace in the sight of my lord.

needful.text: And whatsoever more shall be needful for the house of thy God, which thou shalt have occasion to bestow, bestow it out of the king's treasure house.

needle.text: And again I say unto you, It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

needlework.text: And thou shalt make an hanging for the door of the tent, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, wrought with needlework.

needs.text: He that is born in thy house, and he that is bought with thy money, must needs be circumcised: and my covenant shall be in your flesh for an everlasting covenant.

needy.text: For the poor shall never cease out of the land: therefore I command thee, saying, Thou shalt open thine hand wide unto thy brother, to thy poor, and to thy needy, in thy land.

neesings.text: By his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.

neglect.text: And if he shall neglect to hear them, tell it unto the church: but if he neglect to hear the church, let him be unto thee as an heathen man and a publican.

neglected.text: And in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplied, there arose a murmuring of the Grecians against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration.

neglecting.text: Which things have indeed a shew of wisdom in will worship, and humility, and neglecting of the body; not in any honour to the satisfying of the flesh.

negligent.text: My sons, be not now negligent: for the LORD hath chosen you to stand before him, to serve him, and that ye should minister unto him, and burn incense.

nehelamite.text: Thus shalt thou also speak to Shemaiah the Nehelamite, saying,

nehemiah.text: Which came with Zerubbabel: Jeshua, Nehemiah, Seraiah, Reelaiah, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mizpar, Bigvai, Rehum, Baanah. The number of the men of the people of Israel:

nehum.text: Who came with Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Azariah, Raamiah, Nahamani, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispereth, Bigvai, Nehum, Baanah. The number, I say, of the men of the people of Israel was this;

nehushta.text: Jehoiachin was eighteen years old when he began to reign, and he reigned in Jerusalem three months. And his mother's name was Nehushta, the daughter of Elnathan of Jerusalem.

nehushtan.text: He removed the high places, and brake the images, and cut down the groves, and brake in pieces the brasen serpent that Moses had made: for unto those days the children of Israel did burn incense to it: and he called it Nehushtan.

neiel.text: And turneth toward the sunrising to Bethdagon, and reacheth to Zebulun, and to the valley of Jiphthahel toward the north side of Bethemek, and Neiel, and goeth out to Cabul on the left hand,

neighbour.text: But every woman shall borrow of her neighbour, and of her that sojourneth in her house, jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment: and ye shall put them upon your sons, and upon your daughters; and ye shall spoil the Egyptians.

neighbours.text: And it came to pass at the end of three days after they had made a league with them, that they heard that they were their neighbours, and that they dwelt among them.

neighed.text: They were as fed horses in the morning: every one neighed after his neighbour's wife.

neighing.text: The snorting of his horses was heard from Dan: the whole land trembled at the sound of the neighing of his strong ones; for they are come, and have devoured the land, and all that is in it; the city, and those that dwell therein.

neighings.text: I have seen thine adulteries, and thy neighings, the lewdness of thy whoredom, and thine abominations on the hills in the fields. Woe unto thee, O Jerusalem! wilt thou not be made clean? when shall it once be?

neither.text: But of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden, God hath said, Ye shall not eat of it, neither shall ye touch it, lest ye die.

nekeb.text: And their coast was from Heleph, from Allon to Zaanannim, and Adami, Nekeb, and Jabneel, unto Lakum; and the outgoings thereof were at Jordan:

nekoda.text: The children of Rezin, the children of Nekoda, the children of Gazzam,

nemuel.text: And the sons of Eliab; Nemuel, and Dathan, and Abiram. This is that Dathan and Abiram, which were famous in the congregation, who strove against Moses and against Aaron in the company of Korah, when they strove against the LORD:

nemuelites.text: The sons of Simeon after their families: of Nemuel, the family of the Nemuelites: of Jamin, the family of the Jaminites: of Jachin, the family of the Jachinites:

nepheg.text: And the sons of Izhar; Korah, and Nepheg, and Zichri.

nephew.text: He shall neither have son nor nephew among his people, nor any remaining in his dwellings.

nephews.text: And he had forty sons and thirty nephews, that rode on threescore and ten ass colts: and he judged Israel eight years.

nephish.text: And they made war with the Hagarites, with Jetur, and Nephish, and Nodab.

nephishesim.text: The children of Besai, the children of Meunim, the children of Nephishesim,

nephthalim.text: And leaving Nazareth, he came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is upon the sea coast, in the borders of Zabulon and Nephthalim:

nephtoah.text: And the border was drawn from the top of the hill unto the fountain of the water of Nephtoah, and went out to the cities of mount Ephron; and the border was drawn to Baalah, which is Kirjathjearim:

nephusim.text: The children of Asnah, the children of Mehunim, the children of Nephusim,

ner.text: And the name of Saul's wife was Ahinoam, the daughter of Ahimaaz: and the name of the captain of his host was Abner, the son of Ner, Saul's uncle.

nereus.text: Salute Philologus, and Julia, Nereus, and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints which are with them.

nergal.text: And the men of Babylon made Succothbenoth, and the men of Cuth made Nergal, and the men of Hamath made Ashima,

nergalsharezer.text: And all the princes of the king of Babylon came in, and sat in the middle gate, even Nergalsharezer, Samgarnebo, Sarsechim, Rabsaris, Nergalsharezer, Rabmag, with all the residue of the princes of the king of Babylon.

neri.text: Which was the son of Joanna, which was the son of Rhesa, which was the son of Zorobabel, which was the son of Salathiel, which was the son of Neri,

neriah.text: And I gave the evidence of the purchase unto Baruch the son of Neriah, the son of Maaseiah, in the sight of Hanameel mine uncle's son, and in the presence of the witnesses that subscribed the book of the purchase, before all the Jews that sat in the court of the prison.

nest.text: And he looked on the Kenites, and took up his parable, and said, Strong is thy dwellingplace, and thou puttest thy nest in a rock.

nests.text: Where the birds make their nests: as for the stork, the fir trees are her house.

net.text: And thou shalt make for it a grate of network of brass; and upon the net shalt thou make four brasen rings in the four corners thereof.

nethaneel.text: Of Issachar; Nethaneel the son of Zuar.

nethaniah.text: And when all the captains of the armies, they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah governor, there came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, even Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan the son of Careah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah the son of a Maachathite, they and their men.

nether.text: And Moses brought forth the people out of the camp to meet with God; and they stood at the nether part of the mount.

nethermost.text: The nethermost chamber was five cubits broad, and the middle was six cubits broad, and the third was seven cubits broad: for without in the wall of the house he made narrowed rests round about, that the beams should not be fastened in the walls of the house.

nethinims.text: Now the first inhabitants that dwelt in their possessions in their cities were, the Israelites, the priests, Levites, and the Nethinims.

netophah.text: The men of Netophah, fifty and six.

netophathi.text: And the sons of the singers gathered themselves together, both out of the plain country round about Jerusalem, and from the villages of Netophathi;

netophathite.text: Zalmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite,

netophathites.text: The sons of Salma; Bethlehem, and the Netophathites, Ataroth, the house of Joab, and half of the Manahethites, the Zorites.

nets.text: And nets of checker work, and wreaths of chain work, for the chapiters which were upon the top of the pillars; seven for the one chapiter, and seven for the other chapiter.

nettles.text: Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were gathered together.

network.text: And thou shalt make for it a grate of network of brass; and upon the net shalt thou make four brasen rings in the four corners thereof.

networks.text: The two pillars, and the two bowls of the chapiters that were on the top of the two pillars; and the two networks, to cover the two bowls of the chapiters which were upon the top of the pillars;

never.text: Ask me never so much dowry and gift, and I will give according as ye shall say unto me: but give me the damsel to wife.

nevertheless.text: Therefore now go, lead the people unto the place of which I have spoken unto thee: behold, mine Angel shall go before thee: nevertheless in the day when I visit I will visit their sin upon them.

new.text: Now there arose up a new king over Egypt, which knew not Joseph.

newborn.text: As newborn babes, desire the sincere milk of the word, that ye may grow thereby:

newly.text: They sacrificed unto devils, not to God; to gods whom they knew not, to new gods that came newly up, whom your fathers feared not.

newness.text: Therefore we are buried with him by baptism into death: that like as Christ was raised up from the dead by the glory of the Father, even so we also should walk in newness of life.

news.text: As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.

next.text: But my covenant will I establish with Isaac, which Sarah shall bear unto thee at this set time in the next year.

neziah.text: The children of Neziah, the children of Hatipha.

nezib.text: And Jiphtah, and Ashnah, and Nezib,

nibhaz.text: And the Avites made Nibhaz and Tartak, and the Sepharvites burnt their children in fire to Adrammelech and Anammelech, the gods of Sepharvaim.

nibshan.text: And Nibshan, and the city of Salt, and Engedi; six cities with their villages.

nicanor.text: And the saying pleased the whole multitude: and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Ghost, and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolas a proselyte of Antioch:

nicodemus.text: There was a man of the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews:

nicolaitanes.text: But this thou hast, that thou hatest the deeds of the Nicolaitanes, which I also hate.

nicolas.text: And the saying pleased the whole multitude: and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Ghost, and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolas a proselyte of Antioch:

nicopolis.text: When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis: for I have determined there to winter.

niger.text: Now there were in the church that was at Antioch certain prophets and teachers; as Barnabas, and Simeon that was called Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene, and Manaen, which had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.

nigh.text: And the time drew nigh that Israel must die: and he called his son Joseph, and said unto him, If now I have found grace in thy sight, put, I pray thee, thy hand under my thigh, and deal kindly and truly with me; bury me not, I pray thee, in Egypt:

night.text: And God called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night. And the evening and the morning were the first day.

nights.text: For yet seven days, and I will cause it to rain upon the earth forty days and forty nights; and every living substance that I have made will I destroy from off the face of the earth.

nimrah.text: Ataroth, and Dibon, and Jazer, and Nimrah, and Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Shebam, and Nebo, and Beon,

nimrim.text: For the waters of Nimrim shall be desolate: for the hay is withered away, the grass faileth, there is no green thing.

nimrod.text: And Cush begat Nimrod: he began to be a mighty one in the earth.

nimshi.text: And Jehu the son of Nimshi shalt thou anoint to be king over Israel: and Elisha the son of Shaphat of Abelmeholah shalt thou anoint to be prophet in thy room.

nine.text: And all the days that Adam lived were nine hundred and thirty years: and he died.

nineteen.text: And Nahor lived after he begat Terah an hundred and nineteen years, and begat sons and daughters.

nineteenth.text: And in the fifth month, on the seventh day of the month, which is the nineteenth year of king Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, came Nebuzaradan, captain of the guard, a servant of the king of Babylon, unto Jerusalem:

ninety.text: And Enos lived ninety years, and begat Cainan:

nineve.text: The men of Nineve shall rise up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and, behold, a greater than Jonas is here.

nineveh.text: Out of that land went forth Asshur, and builded Nineveh, and the city Rehoboth, and Calah,

ninevites.text: For as Jonas was a sign unto the Ninevites, so shall also the Son of man be to this generation.

ninth.text: It shall be unto you a sabbath of rest, and ye shall afflict your souls: in the ninth day of the month at even, from even unto even, shall ye celebrate your sabbath.

nisan.text: And it came to pass in the month Nisan, in the twentieth year of Artaxerxes the king, that wine was before him: and I took up the wine, and gave it unto the king. Now I had not been beforetime sad in his presence.

nisroch.text: And it came to pass, as he was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons smote him with the sword: and they escaped into the land of Armenia. And Esarhaddon his son reigned in his stead.

nitre.text: As he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, so is he that singeth songs to an heavy heart.

noadiah.text: Now on the fourth day was the silver and the gold and the vessels weighed in the house of our God by the hand of Meremoth the son of Uriah the priest; and with him was Eleazar the son of Phinehas; and with them was Jozabad the son of Jeshua, and Noadiah the son of Binnui, Levites;

noah.text: And he called his name Noah, saying, This same shall comfort us concerning our work and toil of our hands, because of the ground which the LORD hath cursed.

nob.text: Then came David to Nob to Ahimelech the priest: and Ahimelech was afraid at the meeting of David, and said unto him, Why art thou alone, and no man with thee?

nobah.text: And Nobah went and took Kenath, and the villages thereof, and called it Nobah, after his own name.

noble.text: And the rest of the nations whom the great and noble Asnapper brought over, and set in the cities of Samaria, and the rest that are on this side the river, and at such a time.

nobleman.text: He said therefore, A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom, and to return.

nobles.text: And upon the nobles of the children of Israel he laid not his hand: also they saw God, and did eat and drink.

nod.text: And Cain went out from the presence of the LORD, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.

nodab.text: And they made war with the Hagarites, with Jetur, and Nephish, and Nodab.

noe.text: But as the days of Noe were, so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.

nogah.text: And Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,

nohah.text: Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.

noise.text: And all the people saw the thunderings, and the lightnings, and the noise of the trumpet, and the mountain smoking: and when the people saw it, they removed, and stood afar off.

noised.text: So the LORD was with Joshua; and his fame was noised throughout all the country.

noisome.text: Surely he shall deliver thee from the snare of the fowler, and from the noisome pestilence.

non.text: Non his son, Jehoshuah his son,

none.text: Hear us, my lord: thou art a mighty prince among us: in the choice of our sepulchres bury thy dead; none of us shall withhold from thee his sepulchre, but that thou mayest bury thy dead.

noon.text: And when Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to the ruler of his house, Bring these men home, and slay, and make ready; for these men shall dine with me at noon.

noonday.text: And thou shalt grope at noonday, as the blind gropeth in darkness, and thou shalt not prosper in thy ways: and thou shalt be only oppressed and spoiled evermore, and no man shall save thee.

noontide.text: And let that man be as the cities which the LORD overthrew, and repented not: and let him hear the cry in the morning, and the shouting at noontide;

noph.text: The princes of Zoan are become fools, the princes of Noph are deceived; they have also seduced Egypt, even they that are the stay of the tribes thereof.

nophah.text: We have shot at them; Heshbon is perished even unto Dibon, and we have laid them waste even unto Nophah, which reacheth unto Medeba.

nor.text: And they made their father drink wine that night: and the firstborn went in, and lay with her father; and he perceived not when she lay down, nor when she arose.

north.text: And thy seed shall be as the dust of the earth, and thou shalt spread abroad to the west, and to the east, and to the north, and to the south: and in thee and in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.

northern.text: Shall iron break the northern iron and the steel?

northward.text: And the LORD said unto Abram, after that Lot was separated from him, Lift up now thine eyes, and look from the place where thou art northward, and southward, and eastward, and westward:

nose.text: For whatsoever man he be that hath a blemish, he shall not approach: a blind man, or a lame, or he that hath a flat nose, or any thing superfluous,

noses.text: They have ears, but they hear not: noses have they, but they smell not:

nostrils.text: And the LORD God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.

notable.text: And as I was considering, behold, an he goat came from the west on the face of the whole earth, and touched not the ground: and the goat had a notable horn between his eyes.

note.text: Now go, write it before them in a table, and note it in a book, that it may be for the time to come for ever and ever:

noted.text: But I will shew thee that which is noted in the scripture of truth: and there is none that holdeth with me in these things, but Michael your prince.

nothing.text: And the LORD said, Behold, the people is one, and they have all one language; and this they begin to do: and now nothing will be restrained from them, which they have imagined to do.

notice.text: And all the people took notice of it, and it pleased them: as whatsoever the king did pleased all the people.

notwithstanding.text: Notwithstanding they hearkened not unto Moses; but some of them left of it until the morning, and it bred worms, and stank: and Moses was wroth with them.

nought.text: And Laban said unto Jacob, Because thou art my brother, shouldest thou therefore serve me for nought? tell me, what shall thy wages be?

nourish.text: And there will I nourish thee; for yet there are five years of famine; lest thou, and thy household, and all that thou hast, come to poverty.

nourished.text: And Joseph nourished his father, and his brethren, and all his father's household, with bread, according to their families.

nourisher.text: And he shall be unto thee a restorer of thy life, and a nourisher of thine old age: for thy daughter in law, which loveth thee, which is better to thee than seven sons, hath born him.

nourisheth.text: For no man ever yet hated his own flesh; but nourisheth and cherisheth it, even as the Lord the church:

nourishing.text: And the king appointed them a daily provision of the king's meat, and of the wine which he drank: so nourishing them three years, that at the end thereof they might stand before the king.

nourishment.text: And not holding the Head, from which all the body by joints and bands having nourishment ministered, and knit together, increaseth with the increase of God.

novice.text: Not a novice, lest being lifted up with pride he fall into the condemnation of the devil.

now.text: And Adam said, This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh: she shall be called Woman, because she was taken out of Man.

number.text: And I will make thy seed as the dust of the earth: so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then shall thy seed also be numbered.

numbered.text: And I will make thy seed as the dust of the earth: so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then shall thy seed also be numbered.

numberest.text: When thou takest the sum of the children of Israel after their number, then shall they give every man a ransom for his soul unto the LORD, when thou numberest them; that there be no plague among them, when thou numberest them.

numbering.text: And Joseph gathered corn as the sand of the sea, very much, until he left numbering; for it was without number.

numbers.text: And these are the numbers of the bands that were ready armed to the war, and came to David to Hebron, to turn the kingdom of Saul to him, according to the word of the LORD.

nun.text: And the LORD spake unto Moses face to face, as a man speaketh unto his friend. And he turned again into the camp: but his servant Joshua, the son of Nun, a young man, departed not out of the tabernacle.

nurse.text: And they sent away Rebekah their sister, and her nurse, and Abraham's servant, and his men.

nursed.text: And Pharaoh's daughter said unto her, Take this child away, and nurse it for me, and I will give thee thy wages. And the woman took the child, and nursed it.

nursing.text: Have I conceived all this people? have I begotten them, that thou shouldest say unto me, Carry them in thy bosom, as a nursing father beareth the sucking child, unto the land which thou swarest unto their fathers?

nurture.text: And, ye fathers, provoke not your children to wrath: but bring them up in the nurture and admonition of the Lord.

nuts.text: And their father Israel said unto them, If it must be so now, do this; take of the best fruits in the land in your vessels, and carry down the man a present, a little balm, and a little honey, spices, and myrrh, nuts, and almonds:

nymphas.text: Salute the brethren which are in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the church which is in his house.

o.text: And Abraham said unto God, O that Ishmael might live before thee!

oak.text: And they gave unto Jacob all the strange gods which were in their hand, and all their earrings which were in their ears; and Jacob hid them under the oak which was by Shechem.

oaks.text: For they shall be ashamed of the oaks which ye have desired, and ye shall be confounded for the gardens that ye have chosen.

oar.text: And all that handle the oar, the mariners, and all the pilots of the sea, shall come down from their ships, they shall stand upon the land;

oars.text: But there the glorious LORD will be unto us a place of broad rivers and streams; wherein shall go no galley with oars, neither shall gallant ship pass thereby.

oath.text: And if the woman will not be willing to follow thee, then thou shalt be clear from this my oath: only bring not my son thither again.

oaths.text: And it shall be unto them as a false divination in their sight, to them that have sworn oaths: but he will call to remembrance the iniquity, that they may be taken.

obadiah.text: And Ahab called Obadiah, which was the governor of his house. (Now Obadiah feared the LORD greatly:

obal.text: And Obal, and Abimael, and Sheba,

obed.text: And the women her neighbours gave it a name, saying, There is a son born to Naomi; and they called his name Obed: he is the father of Jesse, the father of David.

obededom.text: So David would not remove the ark of the LORD unto him into the city of David: but David carried it aside into the house of Obededom the Gittite.

obedience.text: By whom we have received grace and apostleship, for obedience to the faith among all nations, for his name:

obedient.text: And he took the book of the covenant, and read in the audience of the people: and they said, All that the LORD hath said will we do, and be obedient.

obeisance.text: For, behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and, lo, my sheaf arose, and also stood upright; and, behold, your sheaves stood round about, and made obeisance to my sheaf.

obey.text: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice according to that which I command thee.

obeyed.text: And in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed; because thou hast obeyed my voice.

obeyedst.text: Because thou obeyedst not the voice of the LORD, nor executedst his fierce wrath upon Amalek, therefore hath the LORD done this thing unto thee this day.

obeyeth.text: Who is among you that feareth the LORD, that obeyeth the voice of his servant, that walketh in darkness, and hath no light? let him trust in the name of the LORD, and stay upon his God.

obeying.text: And yet they would not hearken unto their judges, but they went a whoring after other gods, and bowed themselves unto them: they turned quickly out of the way which their fathers walked in, obeying the commandments of the LORD; but they did not so.

obil.text: Over the camels also was Obil the Ishmaelite: and over the asses was Jehdeiah the Meronothite:

object.text: Who ought to have been here before thee, and object, if they had ought against me.

oblation.text: And if thou bring an oblation of a meat offering baken in the oven, it shall be unleavened cakes of fine flour mingled with oil, or unleavened wafers anointed with oil.

oblations.text: Which the LORD commanded Moses in mount Sinai, in the day that he commanded the children of Israel to offer their oblations unto the LORD, in the wilderness of Sinai.

oboth.text: And the children of Israel set forward, and pitched in Oboth.

obscure.text: Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.

obscurity.text: And in that day shall the deaf hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity, and out of darkness.

observation.text: And when he was demanded of the Pharisees, when the kingdom of God should come, he answered them and said, The kingdom of God cometh not with observation:

observe.text: And ye shall observe the feast of unleavened bread; for in this selfsame day have I brought your armies out of the land of Egypt: therefore shall ye observe this day in your generations by an ordinance for ever.

observed.text: And his brethren envied him; but his father observed the saying.

observer.text: There shall not be found among you any one that maketh his son or his daughter to pass through the fire, or that useth divination, or an observer of times, or an enchanter, or a witch.

observers.text: For these nations, which thou shalt possess, hearkened unto observers of times, and unto diviners: but as for thee, the LORD thy God hath not suffered thee so to do.

observest.text: Seeing many things, but thou observest not; opening the ears, but he heareth not.

observeth.text: He that observeth the wind shall not sow; and he that regardeth the clouds shall not reap.

obstinate.text: But Sihon king of Heshbon would not let us pass by him: for the LORD thy God hardened his spirit, and made his heart obstinate, that he might deliver him into thy hand, as appeareth this day.

obtain.text: And Sarai said unto Abram, Behold now, the LORD hath restrained me from bearing: I pray thee, go in unto my maid; it may be that I may obtain children by her. And Abram hearkened to the voice of Sarai.

obtained.text: But in all this time was not I at Jerusalem: for in the two and thirtieth year of Artaxerxes king of Babylon came I unto the king, and after certain days obtained I leave of the king:

obtaineth.text: A good man obtaineth favour of the LORD: but a man of wicked devices will he condemn.

obtaining.text: Whereunto he called you by our gospel, to the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.

occasion.text: And the men were afraid, because they were brought into Joseph's house; and they said, Because of the money that was returned in our sacks at the first time are we brought in; that he may seek occasion against us, and fall upon us, and take us for bondmen, and our asses.

occasioned.text: And David said unto Abiathar, I knew it that day, when Doeg the Edomite was there, that he would surely tell Saul: I have occasioned the death of all the persons of thy father's house.

occasions.text: And give occasions of speech against her, and bring up an evil name upon her, and say, I took this woman, and when I came to her, I found her not a maid:

occupation.text: And it shall come to pass, when Pharaoh shall call you, and shall say, What is your occupation?

overspread.text: These are the three sons of Noah: and of them was the whole earth overspread.

overspreading.text: And he shall confirm the covenant with many for one week: and in the midst of the week he shall cause the sacrifice and the oblation to cease, and for the overspreading of abominations he shall make it desolate, even until the consummation, and that determined shall be poured upon the desolate.

overtake.text: And when they were gone out of the city, and not yet far off, Joseph said unto his steward, Up, follow after the men; and when thou dost overtake them, say unto them, Wherefore have ye rewarded evil for good?

overtaken.text: I have pursued mine enemies, and overtaken them: neither did I turn again till they were consumed.

overtaketh.text: Either three years' famine; or three months to be destroyed before thy foes, while that the sword of thine enemies overtaketh thee; or else three days the sword of the LORD, even the pestilence, in the land, and the angel of the LORD destroying throughout all the coasts of Israel. Now therefore advise thyself what word I shall bring again to him that sent me.

overthrew.text: And he overthrew those cities, and all the plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities, and that which grew upon the ground.

overthrow.text: And he said unto him, See, I have accepted thee concerning this thing also, that I will not overthrow this city, for the which thou hast spoken.

overthroweth.text: He leadeth princes away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.

overthrown.text: And in the greatness of thine excellency thou hast overthrown them that rose up against thee: thou sentest forth thy wrath, which consumed them as stubble.

overtook.text: And he took his brethren with him, and pursued after him seven days' journey; and they overtook him in the mount Gilead.

overturn.text: Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up: also he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.

overturned.text: And when Gideon was come, behold, there was a man that told a dream unto his fellow, and said, Behold, I dreamed a dream, and, lo, a cake of barley bread tumbled into the host of Midian, and came unto a tent, and smote it that it fell, and overturned it, that the tent lay along.

overturneth.text: Which removeth the mountains, and they know not: which overturneth them in his anger.

overwhelm.text: Yea, ye overwhelm the fatherless, and ye dig a pit for your friend.

overwhelmed.text: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.

owe.text: Owe no man any thing, but to love one another: for he that loveth another hath fulfilled the law.

owed.text: And when he had begun to reckon, one was brought unto him, which owed him ten thousand talents.

owest.text: But the same servant went out, and found one of his fellowservants, which owed him an hundred pence: and he laid hands on him, and took him by the throat, saying, Pay me that thou owest.

oweth.text: If he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee ought, put that on mine account;

owl.text: And the owl, and the night hawk, and the cuckow, and the hawk after his kind,

owls.text: I am a brother to dragons, and a companion to owls.

own.text: So God created man in his own image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them.

owner.text: If an ox gore a man or a woman, that they die: then the ox shall be surely stoned, and his flesh shall not be eaten; but the owner of the ox shall be quit.

owners.text: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life:

owneth.text: And he that owneth the house shall come and tell the priest, saying, It seemeth to me there is as it were a plague in the house:

ox.text: Thou shalt not covet thy neighbour's house, thou shalt not covet thy neighbour's wife, nor his manservant, nor his maidservant, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor any thing that is thy neighbour's.

oxen.text: And he entreated Abram well for her sake: and he had sheep, and oxen, and he asses, and menservants, and maidservants, and she asses, and camels.

ozem.text: Ozem the sixth, David the seventh:

ozias.text: And Asa begat Josaphat; and Josaphat begat Joram; and Joram begat Ozias;

ozni.text: Of Ozni, the family of the Oznites: of Eri, the family of the Erites:

oznites.text: Of Ozni, the family of the Oznites: of Eri, the family of the Erites:

paarai.text: Hezrai the Carmelite, Paarai the Arbite,

paces.text: And it was so, that when they that bare the ark of the LORD had gone six paces, he sacrificed oxen and fatlings.

pacified.text: So they hanged Haman on the gallows that he had prepared for Mordecai. Then was the king's wrath pacified.

pacifieth.text: A gift in secret pacifieth anger: and a reward in the bosom strong wrath.

pacify.text: The wrath of a king is as messengers of death: but a wise man will pacify it.

padan.text: And as for me, when I came from Padan, Rachel died by me in the land of Canaan in the way, when yet there was but a little way to come unto Ephrath: and I buried her there in the way of Ephrath; the same is Bethlehem.

padanaram.text: And Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah to wife, the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian of Padanaram, the sister to Laban the Syrian.

paddle.text: And thou shalt have a paddle upon thy weapon; and it shall be, when thou wilt ease thyself abroad, thou shalt dig therewith, and shalt turn back and cover that which cometh from thee:

padon.text: The children of Keros, the children of Siaha, the children of Padon,

pagiel.text: Of Asher; Pagiel the son of Ocran.

pahathmoab.text: The children of Pahathmoab, of the children of Jeshua and Joab, two thousand eight hundred and twelve.

pai.text: And when Baalhanan was dead, Hadad reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Pai; and his wife's name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.

paid.text: There have been mighty kings also over Jerusalem, which have ruled over all countries beyond the river; and toll, tribute, and custom, was paid unto them.

pain.text: But his flesh upon him shall have pain, and his soul within him shall mourn.

pained.text: My heart is sore pained within me: and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.

painful.text: When I thought to know this, it was too painful for me;

painfulness.text: In weariness and painfulness, in watchings often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness.

pains.text: And his daughter in law, Phinehas' wife, was with child, near to be delivered: and when she heard the tidings that the ark of God was taken, and that her father in law and her husband were dead, she bowed herself and travailed; for her pains came upon her.

painted.text: And when Jehu was come to Jezreel, Jezebel heard of it; and she painted her face, and tired her head, and looked out at a window.

paintedst.text: And furthermore, that ye have sent for men to come from far, unto whom a messenger was sent; and, lo, they came: for whom thou didst wash thyself, paintedst thy eyes, and deckedst thyself with ornaments,

painting.text: And when thou art spoiled, what wilt thou do? Though thou clothest thyself with crimson, though thou deckest thee with ornaments of gold, though thou rentest thy face with painting, in vain shalt thou make thyself fair; thy lovers will despise thee, they will seek thy life.

pair.text: Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Israel, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they sold the righteous for silver, and the poor for a pair of shoes;

palace.text: And it came to pass, when Zimri saw that the city was taken, that he went into the palace of the king's house, and burnt the king's house over him with fire, and died,

palaces.text: And they burnt the house of God, and brake down the wall of Jerusalem, and burnt all the palaces thereof with fire, and destroyed all the goodly vessels thereof.

palal.text: Palal the son of Uzai, over against the turning of the wall, and the tower which lieth out from the king's high house, that was by the court of the prison. After him Pedaiah the son of Parosh.

pale.text: Therefore thus saith the LORD, who redeemed Abraham, concerning the house of Jacob, Jacob shall not now be ashamed, neither shall his face now wax pale.

paleness.text: Ask ye now, and see whether a man doth travail with child? wherefore do I see every man with his hands on his loins, as a woman in travail, and all faces are turned into paleness?

palestina.text: The people shall hear, and be afraid: sorrow shall take hold on the inhabitants of Palestina.

palestine.text: Yea, and what have ye to do with me, O Tyre, and Zidon, and all the coasts of Palestine? will ye render me a recompence? and if ye recompense me, swiftly and speedily will I return your recompence upon your own head;

pallu.text: These be the heads of their fathers' houses: The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel; Hanoch, and Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi: these be the families of Reuben.

palluites.text: Reuben, the eldest son of Israel: the children of Reuben; Hanoch, of whom cometh the family of the Hanochites: of Pallu, the family of the Palluites:

palm.text: And they came to Elim, where were twelve wells of water, and threescore and ten palm trees: and they encamped there by the waters.

palmerworm.text: That which the palmerworm hath left hath the locust eaten; and that which the locust hath left hath the cankerworm eaten; and that which the cankerworm hath left hath the caterpiller eaten.

palms.text: And when they arose early on the morrow morning, behold, Dagon was fallen upon his face to the ground before the ark of the LORD; and the head of Dagon and both the palms of his hands were cut off upon the threshold; only the stump of Dagon was left to him.

palsies.text: For unclean spirits, crying with loud voice, came out of many that were possessed with them: and many taken with palsies, and that were lame, were healed.

palsy.text: And his fame went throughout all Syria: and they brought unto him all sick people that were taken with divers diseases and torments, and those which were possessed with devils, and those which were lunatick, and those that had the palsy; and he healed them.

palti.text: Of the tribe of Benjamin, Palti the son of Raphu.

paltiel.text: And the prince of the tribe of the children of Issachar, Paltiel the son of Azzan.

paltite.text: Helez the Paltite, Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite,

pamphylia.text: Phrygia, and Pamphylia, in Egypt, and in the parts of Libya about Cyrene, and strangers of Rome, Jews and proselytes,

pan.text: And if thy oblation be a meat offering baken in a pan, it shall be of fine flour unleavened, mingled with oil.

pangs.text: And they shall be afraid: pangs and sorrows shall take hold of them; they shall be in pain as a woman that travaileth: they shall be amazed one at another; their faces shall be as flames.

pannag.text: Judah, and the land of Israel, they were thy merchants: they traded in thy market wheat of Minnith, and Pannag, and honey, and oil, and balm.

pans.text: And thou shalt make his pans to receive his ashes, and his shovels, and his basons, and his fleshhooks, and his firepans: all the vessels thereof thou shalt make of brass.

pant.text: That pant after the dust of the earth on the head of the poor, and turn aside the way of the meek: and a man and his father will go in unto the same maid, to profane my holy name:

panted.text: I opened my mouth, and panted: for I longed for thy commandments.

panteth.text: My heart panteth, my strength faileth me: as for the light of mine eyes, it also is gone from me.

paper.text: The paper reeds by the brooks, by the mouth of the brooks, and every thing sown by the brooks, shall wither, be driven away, and be no more.

paphos.text: And when they had gone through the isle unto Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name was Barjesus:

paps.text: Thus thou calledst to remembrance the lewdness of thy youth, in bruising thy teats by the Egyptians for the paps of thy youth.

parable.text: And he took up his parable, and said, Balak the king of Moab hath brought me from Aram, out of the mountains of the east, saying, Come, curse me Jacob, and come, defy Israel.

parables.text: Then said I, Ah Lord GOD! they say of me, Doth he not speak parables?

paradise.text: And Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, To day shalt thou be with me in paradise.

parah.text: And Avim, and Parah, and Ophrah,

paramours.text: For she doted upon their paramours, whose flesh is as the flesh of asses, and whose issue is like the issue of horses.

paran.text: And he dwelt in the wilderness of Paran: and his mother took him a wife out of the land of Egypt.

parbar.text: At Parbar westward, four at the causeway, and two at Parbar.

parcel.text: And he bought a parcel of a field, where he had spread his tent, at the hand of the children of Hamor, Shechem's father, for an hundred pieces of money.

parched.text: And ye shall eat neither bread, nor parched corn, nor green ears, until the selfsame day that ye have brought an offering unto your God: it shall be a statute for ever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.

parchments.text: The cloke that I left at Troas with Carpus, when thou comest, bring with thee, and the books, but especially the parchments.

pardon.text: Beware of him, and obey his voice, provoke him not; for he will not pardon your transgressions: for my name is in him.

pardoned.text: And the LORD said, I have pardoned according to thy word:

pardoneth.text: Who is a God like unto thee, that pardoneth iniquity, and passeth by the transgression of the remnant of his heritage? he retaineth not his anger for ever, because he delighteth in mercy.

pare.text: Then thou shalt bring her home to thine house; and she shall shave her head, and pare her nails;

parents.text: And the brother shall deliver up the brother to death, and the father the child: and the children shall rise up against their parents, and cause them to be put to death.

parlour.text: And Ehud came unto him; and he was sitting in a summer parlour, which he had for himself alone. And Ehud said, I have a message from God unto thee. And he arose out of his seat.

parlours.text: Then David gave to Solomon his son the pattern of the porch, and of the houses thereof, and of the treasuries thereof, and of the upper chambers thereof, and of the inner parlours thereof, and of the place of the mercy seat,

parmashta.text: And Parmashta, and Arisai, and Aridai, and Vajezatha,

parmenas.text: And the saying pleased the whole multitude: and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Ghost, and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolas a proselyte of Antioch:

parnach.text: And the prince of the tribe of the children of Zebulun, Elizaphan the son of Parnach.

parosh.text: The children of Parosh, two thousand an hundred seventy and two.

parshandatha.text: And Parshandatha, and Dalphon, and Aspatha,

part.text: Let Pharaoh do this, and let him appoint officers over the land, and take up the fifth part of the land of Egypt in the seven plenteous years.

partaker.text: When thou sawest a thief, then thou consentedst with him, and hast been partaker with adulterers.

partakers.text: And say, If we had been in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.

partakest.text: And if some of the branches be broken off, and thou, being a wild olive tree, wert graffed in among them, and with them partakest of the root and fatness of the olive tree;

parted.text: And a river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from thence it was parted, and became into four heads.

parteth.text: Whatsoever parteth the hoof, and is clovenfooted, and cheweth the cud, among the beasts, that shall ye eat.

parthians.text: Parthians, and Medes, and Elamites, and the dwellers in Mesopotamia, and in Judaea, and Cappadocia, in Pontus, and Asia,

partial.text: Therefore have I also made you contemptible and base before all the people, according as ye have not kept my ways, but have been partial in the law.

partiality.text: I charge thee before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, and the elect angels, that thou observe these things without preferring one before another, doing nothing by partiality.

particular.text: Now ye are the body of Christ, and members in particular.

particularly.text: And when he had saluted them, he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry.

parties.text: For all manner of trespass, whether it be for ox, for ass, for sheep, for raiment, or for any manner of lost thing, which another challengeth to be his, the cause of both parties shall come before the judges; and whom the judges shall condemn, he shall pay double unto his neighbour.

parting.text: For the king of Babylon stood at the parting of the way, at the head of the two ways, to use divination: he made his arrows bright, he consulted with images, he looked in the liver.

partition.text: So Solomon overlaid the house within with pure gold: and he made a partition by the chains of gold before the oracle; and he overlaid it with gold.

partly.text: And as the toes of the feet were part of iron, and part of clay, so the kingdom shall be partly strong, and partly broken.

partner.text: Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul: he heareth cursing, and bewrayeth it not.

partners.text: And they beckoned unto their partners, which were in the other ship, that they should come and help them. And they came, and filled both the ships, so that they began to sink.

partridge.text: Now therefore, let not my blood fall to the earth before the face of the LORD: for the king of Israel is come out to seek a flea, as when one doth hunt a partridge in the mountains.

parts.text: And it shall come to pass in the increase, that ye shall give the fifth part unto Pharaoh, and four parts shall be your own, for seed of the field, and for your food, and for them of your households, and for food for your little ones.

paruah.text: Jehoshaphat the son of Paruah, in Issachar:

parvaim.text: And he garnished the house with precious stones for beauty: and the gold was gold of Parvaim.

pasach.text: And the sons of Japhlet; Pasach, and Bimhal, and Ashvath. These are the children of Japhlet.

pasdammim.text: He was with David at Pasdammim, and there the Philistines were gathered together to battle, where was a parcel of ground full of barley; and the people fled from before the Philistines.

paseah.text: And Eshton begat Bethrapha, and Paseah, and Tehinnah the father of Irnahash. These are the men of Rechah.

pashur.text: And Adaiah the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashur, the son of Malchijah, and Maasiai the son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer;

pass.text: And in process of time it came to pass, that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto the LORD.

passage.text: Thus Edom refused to give Israel passage through his border: wherefore Israel turned away from him.

passages.text: And the Gileadites took the passages of Jordan before the Ephraimites: and it was so, that when those Ephraimites which were escaped said, Let me go over; that the men of Gilead said unto him, Art thou an Ephraimite? If he said, Nay;

passed.text: And Abram passed through the land unto the place of Sichem, unto the plain of Moreh. And the Canaanite was then in the land.

passedst.text: And the men of Ephraim gathered themselves together, and went northward, and said unto Jephthah, Wherefore passedst thou over to fight against the children of Ammon, and didst not call us to go with thee? we will burn thine house upon thee with fire.

passengers.text: To call passengers who go right on their ways:

passest.text: And I commanded Joshua at that time, saying, Thine eyes have seen all that the LORD your God hath done unto these two kings: so shall the LORD do unto all the kingdoms whither thou passest.

passeth.text: This they shall give, every one that passeth among them that are numbered, half a shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary: (a shekel is twenty gerahs:) an half shekel shall be the offering of the LORD.

passing.text: And he said unto him, We are passing from Bethlehemjudah toward the side of mount Ephraim; from thence am I: and I went to Bethlehemjudah, but I am now going to the house of the LORD; and there is no man that receiveth me to house.

passion.text: To whom also he shewed himself alive after his passion by many infallible proofs, being seen of them forty days, and speaking of the things pertaining to the kingdom of God:

passions.text: And saying, Sirs, why do ye these things? We also are men of like passions with you, and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living God, which made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all things that are therein:

passover.text: And thus shall ye eat it; with your loins girded, your shoes on your feet, and your staff in your hand; and ye shall eat it in haste: it is the LORD's passover.

passovers.text: For there were many in the congregation that were not sanctified: therefore the Levites had the charge of the killing of the passovers for every one that was not clean, to sanctify them unto the LORD.

past.text: And when the days of his mourning were past, Joseph spake unto the house of Pharaoh, saying, If now I have found grace in your eyes, speak, I pray you, in the ears of Pharaoh, saying,

pastor.text: As for me, I have not hastened from being a pastor to follow thee: neither have I desired the woeful day; thou knowest: that which came out of my lips was right before thee.

pastors.text: The priests said not, Where is the LORD? and they that handle the law knew me not: the pastors also transgressed against me, and the prophets prophesied by Baal, and walked after things that do not profit.

pasture.text: They said moreover unto Pharaoh, For to sojourn in the land are we come; for thy servants have no pasture for their flocks; for the famine is sore in the land of Canaan: now therefore, we pray thee, let thy servants dwell in the land of Goshen.

pastures.text: Ten fat oxen, and twenty oxen out of the pastures, and an hundred sheep, beside harts, and roebucks, and fallowdeer, and fatted fowl.

patara.text: And it came to pass, that after we were gotten from them, and had launched, we came with a straight course unto Coos, and the day following unto Rhodes, and from thence unto Patara:

pate.text: His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.

path.text: Dan shall be a serpent by the way, an adder in the path, that biteth the horse heels, so that his rider shall fall backward.

pathros.text: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the Lord shall set his hand again the second time to recover the remnant of his people, which shall be left, from Assyria, and from Egypt, and from Pathros, and from Cush, and from Elam, and from Shinar, and from Hamath, and from the islands of the sea.

pathrusim.text: And Pathrusim, and Casluhim, (out of whom came Philistim,) and Caphtorim.

paths.text: The paths of their way are turned aside; they go to nothing, and perish.

pathway.text: In the way of righteousness is life: and in the pathway thereof there is no death.

patience.text: The servant therefore fell down, and worshipped him, saying, Lord, have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.

patient.text: Better is the end of a thing than the beginning thereof: and the patient in spirit is better than the proud in spirit.

patiently.text: Rest in the LORD, and wait patiently for him: fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his way, because of the man who bringeth wicked devices to pass.

patmos.text: I John, who also am your brother, and companion in tribulation, and in the kingdom and patience of Jesus Christ, was in the isle that is called Patmos, for the word of God, and for the testimony of Jesus Christ.

patriarch.text: Men and brethren, let me freely speak unto you of the patriarch David, that he is both dead and buried, and his sepulchre is with us unto this day.

patriarchs.text: And he gave him the covenant of circumcision: and so Abraham begat Isaac, and circumcised him the eighth day; and Isaac begat Jacob; and Jacob begat the twelve patriarchs.

patrimony.text: They shall have like portions to eat, beside that which cometh of the sale of his patrimony.

patrobas.text: Salute Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Hermes, and the brethren which are with them.

pattern.text: According to all that I shew thee, after the pattern of the tabernacle, and the pattern of all the instruments thereof, even so shall ye make it.

patterns.text: It was therefore necessary that the patterns of things in the heavens should be purified with these; but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.

pau.text: And Baalhanan the son of Achbor died, and Hadar reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Pau; and his wife's name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.

paul.text: Then Saul, (who also is called Paul,) filled with the Holy Ghost, set his eyes on him,

paulus.text: Which was with the deputy of the country, Sergius Paulus, a prudent man; who called for Barnabas and Saul, and desired to hear the word of God.

paved.text: And they saw the God of Israel: and there was under his feet as it were a paved work of a sapphire stone, and as it were the body of heaven in his clearness.

pavement.text: And king Ahaz cut off the borders of the bases, and removed the laver from off them; and took down the sea from off the brasen oxen that were under it, and put it upon a pavement of stones.

pavilion.text: He made darkness his secret place; his pavilion round about him were dark waters and thick clouds of the skies.

pavilions.text: And he made darkness pavilions round about him, dark waters, and thick clouds of the skies.

paw.text: David said moreover, The LORD that delivered me out of the paw of the lion, and out of the paw of the bear, he will deliver me out of the hand of this Philistine. And Saul said unto David, Go, and the LORD be with thee.

paweth.text: He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in his strength: he goeth on to meet the armed men.

paws.text: And whatsoever goeth upon his paws, among all manner of beasts that go on all four, those are unclean unto you: whoso toucheth their carcase shall be unclean until the even.

pay.text: If he rise again, and walk abroad upon his staff, then shall he that smote him be quit: only he shall pay for the loss of his time, and shall cause him to be thoroughly healed.

payed.text: I have peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.

payeth.text: The wicked borroweth, and payeth not again: but the righteous sheweth mercy, and giveth.

payment.text: But forasmuch as he had not to pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, and his wife, and children, and all that he had, and payment to be made.

peace.text: And thou shalt go to thy fathers in peace; thou shalt be buried in a good old age.

peaceable.text: These men are peaceable with us; therefore let them dwell in the land, and trade therein; for the land, behold, it is large enough for them; let us take their daughters to us for wives, and let us give them our daughters.

peaceably.text: And when his brethren saw that their father loved him more than all his brethren, they hated him, and could not speak peaceably unto him.

peacemakers.text: Blessed are the peacemakers: for they shall be called the children of God.

peacocks.text: For the king had at sea a navy of Tharshish with the navy of Hiram: once in three years came the navy of Tharshish, bringing gold, and silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks.

pearl.text: Who, when he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had, and bought it.

pearls.text: No mention shall be made of coral, or of pearls: for the price of wisdom is above rubies.

peculiar.text: Now therefore, if ye will obey my voice indeed, and keep my covenant, then ye shall be a peculiar treasure unto me above all people: for all the earth is mine:

pedahel.text: And the prince of the tribe of the children of Naphtali, Pedahel the son of Ammihud.

pedahzur.text: Of the children of Joseph: of Ephraim; Elishama the son of Ammihud: of Manasseh; Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.

pedaiah.text: Jehoiakim was twenty and five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Zebudah, the daughter of Pedaiah of Rumah.

pedigrees.text: And they assembled all the congregation together on the first day of the second month, and they declared their pedigrees after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, by their polls.

peeled.text: That sendeth ambassadors by the sea, even in vessels of bulrushes upon the waters, saying, Go, ye swift messengers, to a nation scattered and peeled, to a people terrible from their beginning hitherto; a nation meted out and trodden down, whose land the rivers have spoiled!

pouredst.text: But thou didst trust in thine own beauty, and playedst the harlot because of thy renown, and pouredst out thy fornications on every one that passed by; his it was.

poureth.text: He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.

pouring.text: And it came to pass, while they were slaying them, and I was left, that I fell upon my face, and cried, and said, Ah Lord GOD! wilt thou destroy all the residue of Israel in thy pouring out of thy fury upon Jerusalem?

pourtray.text: Thou also, son of man, take thee a tile, and lay it before thee, and pourtray upon it the city, even Jerusalem:

pourtrayed.text: So I went in and saw; and behold every form of creeping things, and abominable beasts, and all the idols of the house of Israel, pourtrayed upon the wall round about.

poverty.text: And there will I nourish thee; for yet there are five years of famine; lest thou, and thy household, and all that thou hast, come to poverty.

powder.text: And he took the calf which they had made, and burnt it in the fire, and ground it to powder, and strawed it upon the water, and made the children of Israel drink of it.

powders.text: Who is this that cometh out of the wilderness like pillars of smoke, perfumed with myrrh and frankincense, with all powders of the merchant?

power.text: And ye know that with all my power I have served your father.

powerful.text: The voice of the LORD is powerful; the voice of the LORD is full of majesty.

powers.text: Immediately after the tribulation of those days shall the sun be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken:

practices.text: Having eyes full of adultery, and that cannot cease from sin; beguiling unstable souls: an heart they have exercised with covetous practices; cursed children:

practise.text: Incline not my heart to any evil thing, to practise wicked works with men that work iniquity: and let me not eat of their dainties.

practised.text: And David knew that Saul secretly practised mischief against him; and he said to Abiathar the priest, Bring hither the ephod.

praetorium.text: And the soldiers led him away into the hall, called Praetorium; and they call together the whole band.

praise.text: And she conceived again, and bare a son: and she said, Now will I praise the LORD: therefore she called his name Judah; and left bearing.

praised.text: And when the people saw him, they praised their god: for they said, Our god hath delivered into our hands our enemy, and the destroyer of our country, which slew many of us.

praises.text: Who is like unto thee, O LORD, among the gods? who is like thee, glorious in holiness, fearful in praises, doing wonders?

praiseth.text: Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her.

praising.text: It came even to pass, as the trumpeters and singers were as one, to make one sound to be heard in praising and thanking the LORD; and when they lifted up their voice with the trumpets and cymbals and instruments of musick, and praised the LORD, saying, For he is good; for his mercy endureth for ever: that then the house was filled with a cloud, even the house of the LORD;

pransing.text: The noise of a whip, and the noise of the rattling of the wheels, and of the pransing horses, and of the jumping chariots.

pransings.text: Then were the horsehoofs broken by the means of the pransings, the pransings of their mighty ones.

prating.text: The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.

pray.text: Say, I pray thee, thou art my sister: that it may be well with me for thy sake; and my soul shall live because of thee.

prayed.text: So Abraham prayed unto God: and God healed Abimelech, and his wife, and his maidservants; and they bare children.

prayer.text: For thou, O LORD of hosts, God of Israel, hast revealed to thy servant, saying, I will build thee an house: therefore hath thy servant found in his heart to pray this prayer unto thee.

prayers.text: The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.

prayest.text: And when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocrites are: for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

prayeth.text: Yet have thou respect unto the prayer of thy servant, and to his supplication, O LORD my God, to hearken unto the cry and to the prayer, which thy servant prayeth before thee to day:

praying.text: And it came to pass, as she continued praying before the LORD, that Eli marked her mouth.

preach.text: And thou hast also appointed prophets to preach of thee at Jerusalem, saying, There is a king in Judah: and now shall it be reported to the king according to these words. Come now therefore, and let us take counsel together.

preached.text: I have preached righteousness in the great congregation: lo, I have not refrained my lips, O LORD, thou knowest.

preacher.text: The words of the Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem.

preachest.text: Thou therefore which teachest another, teachest thou not thyself? thou that preachest a man should not steal, dost thou steal?

preacheth.text: Then certain of the vagabond Jews, exorcists, took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the LORD Jesus, saying, We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth.

preaching.text: Arise, go unto Nineveh, that great city, and preach unto it the preaching that I bid thee.

precept.text: For precept must be upon precept, precept upon precept; line upon line, line upon line; here a little, and there a little:

precepts.text: And madest known unto them thy holy sabbath, and commandedst them precepts, statutes, and laws, by the hand of Moses thy servant:

precious.text: And the servant brought forth jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment, and gave them to Rebekah: he gave also to her brother and to her mother precious things.

predestinate.text: For whom he did foreknow, he also did predestinate to be conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brethren.

predestinated.text: Having predestinated us unto the adoption of children by Jesus Christ to himself, according to the good pleasure of his will,

preeminence.text: For that which befalleth the sons of men befalleth beasts; even one thing befalleth them: as the one dieth, so dieth the other; yea, they have all one breath; so that a man hath no preeminence above a beast: for all is vanity.

prefer.text: If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.

preferred.text: And the maiden pleased him, and she obtained kindness of him; and he speedily gave her her things for purification, with such things as belonged to her, and seven maidens, which were meet to be given her, out of the king's house: and he preferred her and her maids unto the best place of the house of the women.

preferring.text: Be kindly affectioned one to another with brotherly love; in honour preferring one another;

premeditate.text: But when they shall lead you, and deliver you up, take no thought beforehand what ye shall speak, neither do ye premeditate: but whatsoever shall be given you in that hour, that speak ye: for it is not ye that speak, but the Holy Ghost.

preparation.text: And David said, Solomon my son is young and tender, and the house that is to be builded for the LORD must be exceeding magnifical, of fame and of glory throughout all countries: I will therefore now make preparation for it. So David prepared abundantly before his death.

preparations.text: The preparations of the heart in man, and the answer of the tongue, is from the LORD.

prepare.text: The LORD is my strength and song, and he is become my salvation: he is my God, and I will prepare him an habitation; my father's God, and I will exalt him.

prepared.text: And he said, Come in, thou blessed of the LORD; wherefore standest thou without? for I have prepared the house, and room for the camels.

preparedst.text: Thou preparedst room before it, and didst cause it to take deep root, and it filled the land.

preparest.text: And when thou preparest a bullock for a burnt offering, or for a sacrifice in performing a vow, or peace offerings unto the LORD:

prepareth.text: That prepareth his heart to seek God, the LORD God of his fathers, though he be not cleansed according to the purification of the sanctuary.

preparing.text: And I came to Jerusalem, and understood of the evil that Eliashib did for Tobiah, in preparing him a chamber in the courts of the house of God.

presbytery.text: Neglect not the gift that is in thee, which was given thee by prophecy, with the laying on of the hands of the presbytery.

prescribed.text: Woe unto them that decree unrighteous decrees, and that write grievousness which they have prescribed;

prescribing.text: Unto an hundred talents of silver, and to an hundred measures of wheat, and to an hundred baths of wine, and to an hundred baths of oil, and salt without prescribing how much.

presence.text: And they heard the voice of the LORD God walking in the garden in the cool of the day: and Adam and his wife hid themselves from the presence of the LORD God amongst the trees of the garden.

present.text: And he lodged there that same night; and took of that which came to his hand a present for Esau his brother;

presented.text: And Joseph made ready his chariot, and went up to meet Israel his father, to Goshen, and presented himself unto him; and he fell on his neck, and wept on his neck a good while.

presenting.text: And whiles I was speaking, and praying, and confessing my sin and the sin of my people Israel, and presenting my supplication before the LORD my God for the holy mountain of my God;

presently.text: And if any man said unto him, Let them not fail to burn the fat presently, and then take as much as thy soul desireth; then he would answer him, Nay; but thou shalt give it me now: and if not, I will take it by force.

presents.text: But the children of Belial said, How shall this man save us? And they despised him, and brought him no presents. But he held his peace.

preserve.text: Come, let us make our father drink wine, and we will lie with him, that we may preserve seed of our father.

preserved.text: And Jacob called the name of the place Peniel: for I have seen God face to face, and my life is preserved.

preserver.text: I have sinned; what shall I do unto thee, O thou preserver of men? why hast thou set me as a mark against thee, so that I am a burden to myself?

preservest.text: Thou, even thou, art LORD alone; thou hast made heaven, the heaven of heavens, with all their host, the earth, and all things that are therein, the seas, and all that is therein, and thou preservest them all; and the host of heaven worshippeth thee.

preserveth.text: He preserveth not the life of the wicked: but giveth right to the poor.

presidents.text: And over these three presidents; of whom Daniel was first: that the princes might give accounts unto them, and the king should have no damage.

press.text: Put ye in the sickle, for the harvest is ripe: come, get you down; for the press is full, the fats overflow; for their wickedness is great.

pressed.text: And he pressed upon them greatly; and they turned in unto him, and entered into his house; and he made them a feast, and did bake unleavened bread, and they did eat.

presses.text: In those days saw I in Judah some treading wine presses on the sabbath, and bringing in sheaves, and lading asses; as also wine, grapes, and figs, and all manner of burdens, which they brought into Jerusalem on the sabbath day: and I testified against them in the day wherein they sold victuals.

presseth.text: For thine arrows stick fast in me, and thy hand presseth me sore.

pressfat.text: Since those days were, when one came to an heap of twenty measures, there were but ten: when one came to the pressfat for to draw out fifty vessels out of the press, there were but twenty.

presume.text: But the prophet, which shall presume to speak a word in my name, which I have not commanded him to speak, or that shall speak in the name of other gods, even that prophet shall die.

presumed.text: But they presumed to go up unto the hill top: nevertheless the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and Moses, departed not out of the camp.

presumptuous.text: Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous sins; let them not have dominion over me: then shall I be upright, and I shall be innocent from the great transgression.

presumptuously.text: But if a man come presumptuously upon his neighbour, to slay him with guile; thou shalt take him from mine altar, that he may die.

pretence.text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye devour widows' houses, and for a pretence make long prayer: therefore ye shall receive the greater damnation.

prevail.text: Fifteen cubits upward did the waters prevail; and the mountains were covered.

prevailed.text: And the waters prevailed, and were increased greatly upon the earth; and the ark went upon the face of the waters.

prevailest.text: Thou prevailest for ever against him, and he passeth: thou changest his countenance, and sendest him away.

prevaileth.text: From above hath he sent fire into my bones, and it prevaileth against them: he hath spread a net for my feet, he hath turned me back: he hath made me desolate and faint all the day.

prevent.text: Why did the knees prevent me? or why the breasts that I should suck?

prevented.text: The sorrows of hell compassed me about; the snares of death prevented me;

preventest.text: For thou preventest him with the blessings of goodness: thou settest a crown of pure gold on his head.

prey.text: Judah is a lion's whelp: from the prey, my son, thou art gone up: he stooped down, he couched as a lion, and as an old lion; who shall rouse him up?

price.text: According to the multitude of years thou shalt increase the price thereof, and according to the fewness of years thou shalt diminish the price of it: for according to the number of the years of the fruits doth he sell unto thee.

prices.text: Neither was there any among them that lacked: for as many as were possessors of lands or houses sold them, and brought the prices of the things that were sold,

pricked.text: Thus my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.

pricking.text: And there shall be no more a pricking brier unto the house of Israel, nor any grieving thorn of all that are round about them, that despised them; and they shall know that I am the Lord GOD.

pricks.text: But if ye will not drive out the inhabitants of the land from before you; then it shall come to pass, that those which ye let remain of them shall be pricks in your eyes, and thorns in your sides, and shall vex you in the land wherein ye dwell.

pride.text: And I will break the pride of your power; and I will make your heaven as iron, and your earth as brass:

priest.text: And Melchizedek king of Salem brought forth bread and wine: and he was the priest of the most high God.

priesthood.text: And thou shalt anoint them, as thou didst anoint their father, that they may minister unto me in the priest's office: for their anointing shall surely be an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations.

priests.text: Only the land of the priests bought he not; for the priests had a portion assigned them of Pharaoh, and did eat their portion which Pharaoh gave them: wherefore they sold not their lands.

prince.text: Hear us, my lord: thou art a mighty prince among us: in the choice of our sepulchres bury thy dead; none of us shall withhold from thee his sepulchre, but that thou mayest bury thy dead.

princes.text: The princes also of Pharaoh saw her, and commended her before Pharaoh: and the woman was taken into Pharaoh's house.

princess.text: How doth the city sit solitary, that was full of people! how is she become as a widow! she that was great among the nations, and princess among the provinces, how is she become tributary!

princesses.text: And he had seven hundred wives, princesses, and three hundred concubines: and his wives turned away his heart.

principal.text: Take thou also unto thee principal spices, of pure myrrh five hundred shekels, and of sweet cinnamon half so much, even two hundred and fifty shekels, and of sweet calamus two hundred and fifty shekels,

principalities.text: Say unto the king and to the queen, Humble yourselves, sit down: for your principalities shall come down, even the crown of your glory.

principality.text: Far above all principality, and power, and might, and dominion, and every name that is named, not only in this world, but also in that which is to come:

print.text: Ye shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead, nor print any marks upon you: I am the LORD.

printed.text: Oh that my words were now written! oh that they were printed in a book!

private.text: Knowing this first, that no prophecy of the scripture is of any private interpretation.

privately.text: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives, the disciples came unto him privately, saying, Tell us, when shall these things be? and what shall be the sign of thy coming, and of the end of the world?

privy.text: He that is wounded in the stones, or hath his privy member cut off, shall not enter into the congregation of the LORD.

prize.text: Know ye not that they which run in a race run all, but one receiveth the prize? So run, that ye may obtain.

proceeding.text: And he shewed me a pure river of water of life, clear as crystal, proceeding out of the throne of God and of the Lamb.

process.text: And in process of time it came to pass, that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto the LORD.

proclaimed.text: And the LORD descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the name of the LORD.

procure.text: Did Hezekiah king of Judah and all Judah put him at all to death? did he not fear the LORD, and besought the LORD, and the LORD repented him of the evil which he had pronounced against them? Thus might we procure great evil against our souls.

procured.text: Hast thou not procured this unto thyself, in that thou hast forsaken the LORD thy God, when he led thee by the way?

profaneth.text: And the daughter of any priest, if she profane herself by playing the whore, she profaneth her father: she shall be burnt with fire.

profaning.text: Did not your fathers thus, and did not our God bring all this evil upon us, and upon this city? yet ye bring more wrath upon Israel by profaning the sabbath.
