sweareth.text: Or have found that which was lost, and lieth concerning it, and sweareth falsely; in any of all these that a man doeth, sinning therein:

swearing.text: And if a soul sin, and hear the voice of swearing, and is a witness, whether he hath seen or known of it; if he do not utter it, then he shall bear his iniquity.

sweat.text: In the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat bread, till thou return unto the ground; for out of it wast thou taken: for dust thou art, and unto dust shalt thou return.

sweep.text: I will also make it a possession for the bittern, and pools of water: and I will sweep it with the besom of destruction, saith the LORD of hosts.

sweeping.text: A poor man that oppresseth the poor is like a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.

sweet.text: And the LORD smelled a sweet savour; and the LORD said in his heart, I will not again curse the ground any more for man's sake; for the imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth; neither will I again smite any more every thing living, as I have done.

sweeter.text: And the men of the city said unto him on the seventh day before the sun went down, What is sweeter than honey? And what is stronger than a lion? And he said unto them, If ye had not plowed with my heifer, ye had not found out my riddle.

sweetly.text: The womb shall forget him; the worm shall feed sweetly on him; he shall be no more remembered; and wickedness shall be broken as a tree.

sweetness.text: But the fig tree said unto them, Should I forsake my sweetness, and my good fruit, and go to be promoted over the trees?

sweetsmelling.text: And walk in love, as Christ also hath loved us, and hath given himself for us an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweetsmelling savour.

swell.text: Then the priest shall charge the woman with an oath of cursing, and the priest shall say unto the woman, The LORD make thee a curse and an oath among thy people, when the LORD doth make thy thigh to rot, and thy belly to swell;

swelled.text: Yea, forty years didst thou sustain them in the wilderness, so that they lacked nothing; their clothes waxed not old, and their feet swelled not.

swelling.text: Though the waters thereof roar and be troubled, though the mountains shake with the swelling thereof. Selah.

swellings.text: For I fear, lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I would, and that I shall be found unto you such as ye would not: lest there be debates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings, swellings, tumults:

swept.text: The river of Kishon swept them away, that ancient river, the river Kishon. O my soul, thou hast trodden down strength.

swerved.text: From which some having swerved have turned aside unto vain jangling;

swift.text: The LORD shall bring a nation against thee from far, from the end of the earth, as swift as the eagle flieth; a nation whose tongue thou shalt not understand;

swifter.text: Saul and Jonathan were lovely and pleasant in their lives, and in their death they were not divided: they were swifter than eagles, they were stronger than lions.

swiftly.text: He sendeth forth his commandment upon earth: his word runneth very swiftly.

swim.text: And the man of God said, Where fell it? And he shewed him the place. And he cut down a stick, and cast it in thither; and the iron did swim.

swimmest.text: I will also water with thy blood the land wherein thou swimmest, even to the mountains; and the rivers shall be full of thee.

swimmeth.text: And he shall spread forth his hands in the midst of them, as he that swimmeth spreadeth forth his hands to swim: and he shall bring down their pride together with the spoils of their hands.

swine.text: And the swine, though he divide the hoof, and be clovenfooted, yet he cheweth not the cud; he is unclean to you.

swollen.text: Howbeit they looked when he should have swollen, or fallen down dead suddenly: but after they had looked a great while, and saw no harm come to him, they changed their minds, and said that he was a god.

swoon.text: Mine eyes do fail with tears, my bowels are troubled, my liver is poured upon the earth, for the destruction of the daughter of my people; because the children and the sucklings swoon in the streets of the city.

swooned.text: They say to their mothers, Where is corn and wine? when they swooned as the wounded in the streets of the city, when their soul was poured out into their mothers' bosom.

sword.text: So he drove out the man; and he placed at the east of the garden of Eden Cherubims, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life.

swords.text: Now there was no smith found throughout all the land of Israel: for the Philistines said, Lest the Hebrews make them swords or spears:

sworn.text: And said, By myself have I sworn, saith the LORD, for because thou hast done this thing, and hast not withheld thy son, thine only son:

sycamine.text: And the Lord said, If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye might say unto this sycamine tree, Be thou plucked up by the root, and be thou planted in the sea; and it should obey you.

sychar.text: Then cometh he to a city of Samaria, which is called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.

sychem.text: And were carried over into Sychem, and laid in the sepulchre that Abraham bought for a sum of money of the sons of Emmor the father of Sychem.

sycomore.text: And the king made silver to be in Jerusalem as stones, and cedars made he to be as the sycomore trees that are in the vale, for abundance.

sycomores.text: The bricks are fallen down, but we will build with hewn stones: the sycomores are cut down, but we will change them into cedars.

syene.text: Behold, therefore I am against thee, and against thy rivers, and I will make the land of Egypt utterly waste and desolate, from the tower of Syene even unto the border of Ethiopia.

synagogue.text: And when he was departed thence, he went into their synagogue:

synagogues.text: They said in their hearts, Let us destroy them together: they have burned up all the synagogues of God in the land.

syntyche.text: I beseech Euodias, and beseech Syntyche, that they be of the same mind in the Lord.

syracuse.text: And landing at Syracuse, we tarried there three days.

syria.text: And the children of Israel did evil again in the sight of the LORD, and served Baalim, and Ashtaroth, and the gods of Syria, and the gods of Zidon, and the gods of Moab, and the gods of the children of Ammon, and the gods of the Philistines, and forsook the LORD, and served not him.

syriack.text: Then spake the Chaldeans to the king in Syriack, O king, live for ever: tell thy servants the dream, and we will shew the interpretation.

syriadamascus.text: Then David put garrisons in Syriadamascus; and the Syrians became David's servants, and brought gifts. Thus the LORD preserved David whithersoever he went.

syriamaachah.text: And when the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the children of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire them chariots and horsemen out of Mesopotamia, and out of Syriamaachah, and out of Zobah.

syrian.text: And Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah to wife, the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian of Padanaram, the sister to Laban the Syrian.

syrians.text: And when the Syrians of Damascus came to succour Hadadezer king of Zobah, David slew of the Syrians two and twenty thousand men.

syrophenician.text: The woman was a Greek, a Syrophenician by nation; and she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter.

taanach.text: The king of Taanach, one; the king of Megiddo, one;

taanathshiloh.text: And the border went out toward the sea to Michmethah on the north side; and the border went about eastward unto Taanathshiloh, and passed by it on the east to Janohah;

tabbaoth.text: The Nethinims: the children of Ziha, the children of Hasupha, the children of Tabbaoth,

tabbath.text: And the three hundred blew the trumpets, and the LORD set every man's sword against his fellow, even throughout all the host: and the host fled to Bethshittah in Zererath, and to the border of Abelmeholah, unto Tabbath.

tabeal.text: Let us go up against Judah, and vex it, and let us make a breach therein for us, and set a king in the midst of it, even the son of Tabeal:

tabeel.text: And in the days of Artaxerxes wrote Bishlam, Mithredath, Tabeel, and the rest of their companions, unto Artaxerxes king of Persia; and the writing of the letter was written in the Syrian tongue, and interpreted in the Syrian tongue.

taberah.text: And he called the name of the place Taberah: because the fire of the LORD burnt among them.

tabering.text: And Huzzab shall be led away captive, she shall be brought up, and her maids shall lead her as with the voice of doves, tabering upon their breasts.

tabernacle.text: According to all that I shew thee, after the pattern of the tabernacle, and the pattern of all the instruments thereof, even so shall ye make it.

tabernacles.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, The fifteenth day of this seventh month shall be the feast of tabernacles for seven days unto the LORD.

tabitha.text: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which by interpretation is called Dorcas: this woman was full of good works and almsdeeds which she did.

table.text: Thou shalt also make a table of shittim wood: two cubits shall be the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof.

tables.text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Come up to me into the mount, and be there: and I will give thee tables of stone, and a law, and commandments which I have written; that thou mayest teach them.

tablets.text: And they came, both men and women, as many as were willing hearted, and brought bracelets, and earrings, and rings, and tablets, all jewels of gold: and every man that offered offered an offering of gold unto the LORD.

tabor.text: And the coast reacheth to Tabor, and Shahazimah, and Bethshemesh; and the outgoings of their border were at Jordan: sixteen cities with their villages.

tabret.text: Wherefore didst thou flee away secretly, and steal away from me; and didst not tell me, that I might have sent thee away with mirth, and with songs, with tabret, and with harp?

tabrets.text: And it came to pass as they came, when David was returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, that the women came out of all cities of Israel, singing and dancing, to meet king Saul, with tabrets, with joy, and with instruments of musick.

tabrimon.text: Then Asa took all the silver and the gold that were left in the treasures of the house of the LORD, and the treasures of the king's house, and delivered them into the hand of his servants: and king Asa sent them to Benhadad, the son of Tabrimon, the son of Hezion, king of Syria, that dwelt at Damascus, saying,

taches.text: And thou shalt make fifty taches of gold, and couple the curtains together with the taches: and it shall be one tabernacle.

tachmonite.text: These be the names of the mighty men whom David had: The Tachmonite that sat in the seat, chief among the captains; the same was Adino the Eznite: he lift up his spear against eight hundred, whom he slew at one time.

tackling.text: And the third day we cast out with our own hands the tackling of the ship.

tacklings.text: Thy tacklings are loosed; they could not well strengthen their mast, they could not spread the sail: then is the prey of a great spoil divided; the lame take the prey.

tadmor.text: And Baalath, and Tadmor in the wilderness, in the land,

tahan.text: These are the sons of Ephraim after their families: of Shuthelah, the family of the Shuthalhites: of Becher, the family of the Bachrites: of Tahan, the family of the Tahanites.

tahanites.text: These are the sons of Ephraim after their families: of Shuthelah, the family of the Shuthalhites: of Becher, the family of the Bachrites: of Tahan, the family of the Tahanites.

tahapanes.text: Also the children of Noph and Tahapanes have broken the crown of thy head.

tahath.text: And they removed from Makheloth, and encamped at Tahath.

tahpanhes.text: So they came into the land of Egypt: for they obeyed not the voice of the LORD: thus came they even to Tahpanhes.

tahpenes.text: And Hadad found great favour in the sight of Pharaoh, so that he gave him to wife the sister of his own wife, the sister of Tahpenes the queen.

tahrea.text: And the sons of Micah were, Pithon, and Melech, and Tahrea, and Ahaz.

tahtimhodshi.text: Then they came to Gilead, and to the land of Tahtimhodshi; and they came to Danjaan, and about to Zidon,

tail.text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Put forth thine hand, and take it by the tail. And he put forth his hand, and caught it, and it became a rod in his hand:

tails.text: And Samson went and caught three hundred foxes, and took firebrands, and turned tail to tail, and put a firebrand in the midst between two tails.

take.text: And the LORD God said, Behold, the man is become as one of us, to know good and evil: and now, lest he put forth his hand, and take also of the tree of life, and eat, and live for ever:

taken.text: And the rib, which the LORD God had taken from man, made he a woman, and brought her unto the man.

taker.text: And it shall be, as with the people, so with the priest; as with the servant, so with his master; as with the maid, so with her mistress; as with the buyer, so with the seller; as with the lender, so with the borrower; as with the taker of usury, so with the giver of usury to him.

takest.text: And it shall come to pass, if they will not believe also these two signs, neither hearken unto thy voice, that thou shalt take of the water of the river, and pour it upon the dry land: and the water which thou takest out of the river shall become blood upon the dry land.

taketh.text: Thou shalt not take the name of the LORD thy God in vain; for the LORD will not hold him guiltless that taketh his name in vain.

taking.text: Wherefore now let the fear of the LORD be upon you; take heed and do it: for there is no iniquity with the LORD our God, nor respect of persons, nor taking of gifts.

tale.text: And the tale of the bricks, which they did make heretofore, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish ought thereof: for they be idle; therefore they cry, saying, Let us go and sacrifice to our God.

talebearer.text: Thou shalt not go up and down as a talebearer among thy people: neither shalt thou stand against the blood of thy neighbour: I am the LORD.

talent.text: Of a talent of pure gold shall he make it, with all these vessels.

talents.text: All the gold that was occupied for the work in all the work of the holy place, even the gold of the offering, was twenty and nine talents, and seven hundred and thirty shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary.

tales.text: In thee are men that carry tales to shed blood: and in thee they eat upon the mountains: in the midst of thee they commit lewdness.

talitha.text: And he took the damsel by the hand, and said unto her, Talitha cumi; which is, being interpreted, Damsel, I say unto thee, arise.

talk.text: And I will come down and talk with thee there: and I will take of the spirit which is upon thee, and will put it upon them; and they shall bear the burden of the people with thee, that thou bear it not thyself alone.

talked.text: And Cain talked with Abel his brother: and it came to pass, when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel his brother, and slew him.

talkers.text: Therefore prophesy and say, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Because they have made you desolate, and swallowed you up on every side, that ye might be a possession unto the residue of the heathen, and ye are taken up in the lips of talkers, and are an infamy of the people:

talkest.text: And he said unto him, If now I have found grace in thy sight, then shew me a sign that thou talkest with me.

talketh.text: The mouth of the righteous speaketh wisdom, and his tongue talketh of judgment.

talking.text: And he left off talking with him, and God went up from Abraham.

tall.text: The Emims dwelt therein in times past, a people great, and many, and tall, as the Anakims;

taller.text: Whither shall we go up? our brethren have discouraged our heart, saying, The people is greater and taller than we; the cities are great and walled up to heaven; and moreover we have seen the sons of the Anakims there.

talmai.text: And they ascended by the south, and came unto Hebron; where Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the children of Anak, were. (Now Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)

talmon.text: And the porters were, Shallum, and Akkub, and Talmon, and Ahiman, and their brethren: Shallum was the chief;

tamah.text: The children of Barkos, the children of Sisera, the children of Tamah,

tamar.text: And Judah took a wife for Er his firstborn, whose name was Tamar.

tame.text: Because that he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been plucked asunder by him, and the fetters broken in pieces: neither could any man tame him.

tamed.text: For every kind of beasts, and of birds, and of serpents, and of things in the sea, is tamed, and hath been tamed of mankind:

tammuz.text: Then he brought me to the door of the gate of the LORD's house which was toward the north; and, behold, there sat women weeping for Tammuz.

tanach.text: And out of the half tribe of Manasseh, Tanach with her suburbs, and Gathrimmon with her suburbs; two cities.

tanhumeth.text: And when all the captains of the armies, they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah governor, there came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, even Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan the son of Careah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah the son of a Maachathite, they and their men.

tanner.text: And it came to pass, that he tarried many days in Joppa with one Simon a tanner.

tapestry.text: I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.

taphath.text: The son of Abinadab, in all the region of Dor; which had Taphath the daughter of Solomon to wife:

tappuah.text: The king of Tappuah, one; the king of Hepher, one;

tarah.text: And they departed from Tahath, and pitched at Tarah.

taralah.text: And Rekem, and Irpeel, and Taralah,

tare.text: Then the king arose, and tare his garments, and lay on the earth; and all his servants stood by with their clothes rent.

tarea.text: And the sons of Micah were, Pithon, and Melech, and Tarea, and Ahaz.

tares.text: But while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way.

target.text: And he had greaves of brass upon his legs, and a target of brass between his shoulders.

targets.text: And king Solomon made two hundred targets of beaten gold: six hundred shekels of gold went to one target.

tarpelites.text: Then wrote Rehum the chancellor, and Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their companions; the Dinaites, the Apharsathchites, the Tarpelites, the Apharsites, the Archevites, the Babylonians, the Susanchites, the Dehavites, and the Elamites,

tarried.text: And they did eat and drink, he and the men that were with him, and tarried all night; and they rose up in the morning, and he said, Send me away unto my master.

tarriest.text: And now why tarriest thou? arise, and be baptized, and wash away thy sins, calling on the name of the Lord.

tarrieth.text: For who will hearken unto you in this matter? but as his part is that goeth down to the battle, so shall his part be that tarrieth by the stuff: they shall part alike.

tarry.text: And he said, Behold now, my lords, turn in, I pray you, into your servant's house, and tarry all night, and wash your feet, and ye shall rise up early, and go on your ways. And they said, Nay; but we will abide in the street all night.

tarrying.text: But I am poor and needy; yet the Lord thinketh upon me: thou art my help and my deliverer; make no tarrying, O my God.

tarshish.text: And the sons of Javan; Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.

tarsus.text: And the Lord said unto him, Arise, and go into the street which is called Straight, and enquire in the house of Judas for one called Saul, of Tarsus: for, behold, he prayeth,

tartak.text: And the Avites made Nibhaz and Tartak, and the Sepharvites burnt their children in fire to Adrammelech and Anammelech, the gods of Sepharvaim.

tartan.text: And the king of Assyria sent Tartan and Rabsaris and Rabshakeh from Lachish to king Hezekiah with a great host against Jerusalem. And they went up and came to Jerusalem. And when they were come up, they came and stood by the conduit of the upper pool, which is in the highway of the fuller's field.

task.text: And the officers of the children of Israel, which Pharaoh's taskmasters had set over them, were beaten, and demanded, Wherefore have ye not fulfilled your task in making brick both yesterday and to day, as heretofore?

taskmasters.text: Therefore they did set over them taskmasters to afflict them with their burdens. And they built for Pharaoh treasure cities, Pithom and Raamses.

tasks.text: And the taskmasters hasted them, saying, Fulfil your works, your daily tasks, as when there was straw.

taste.text: And the house of Israel called the name thereof Manna: and it was like coriander seed, white; and the taste of it was like wafers made with honey.

tasted.text: And the men of Israel were distressed that day: for Saul had adjured the people, saying, Cursed be the man that eateth any food until evening, that I may be avenged on mine enemies. So none of the people tasted any food.

tasteth.text: For the ear trieth words, as the mouth tasteth meat.

tatnai.text: At the same time came to them Tatnai, governor on this side the river, and Shetharboznai, and their companions, and said thus unto them, Who hath commanded you to build this house, and to make up this wall?

tattlers.text: And withal they learn to be idle, wandering about from house to house; and not only idle, but tattlers also and busybodies, speaking things which they ought not.

taught.text: Behold, I have taught you statutes and judgments, even as the LORD my God commanded me, that ye should do so in the land whither ye go to possess it.

taunt.text: And I will deliver them to be removed into all the kingdoms of the earth for their hurt, to be a reproach and a proverb, a taunt and a curse, in all places whither I shall drive them.

taunting.text: Shall not all these take up a parable against him, and a taunting proverb against him, and say, Woe to him that increaseth that which is not his! how long? and to him that ladeth himself with thick clay!

taverns.text: And from thence, when the brethren heard of us, they came to meet us as far as Appii forum, and The three taverns: whom when Paul saw, he thanked God, and took courage.

taxation.text: And Jehoiakim gave the silver and the gold to Pharaoh; but he taxed the land to give the money according to the commandment of Pharaoh: he exacted the silver and the gold of the people of the land, of every one according to his taxation, to give it unto Pharaohnechoh.

taxed.text: And Jehoiakim gave the silver and the gold to Pharaoh; but he taxed the land to give the money according to the commandment of Pharaoh: he exacted the silver and the gold of the people of the land, of every one according to his taxation, to give it unto Pharaohnechoh.

taxes.text: Then shall stand up in his estate a raiser of taxes in the glory of the kingdom: but within few days he shall be destroyed, neither in anger, nor in battle.

taxing.text: (And this taxing was first made when Cyrenius was governor of Syria.)

teach.text: Now therefore go, and I will be with thy mouth, and teach thee what thou shalt say.

teacher.text: And they cast lots, ward against ward, as well the small as the great, the teacher as the scholar.

teachers.text: I have more understanding than all my teachers: for thy testimonies are my meditation.

teachest.text: Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O LORD, and teachest him out of thy law;

teacheth.text: He teacheth my hands to war; so that a bow of steel is broken by mine arms.

teaching.text: Now for a long season Israel hath been without the true God, and without a teaching priest, and without law.

tear.text: And Gideon said, Therefore when the LORD hath delivered Zebah and Zalmunna into mine hand, then I will tear your flesh with the thorns of the wilderness and with briers.

teareth.text: And of Gad he said, Blessed be he that enlargeth Gad: he dwelleth as a lion, and teareth the arm with the crown of the head.

tears.text: Turn again, and tell Hezekiah the captain of my people, Thus saith the LORD, the God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears: behold, I will heal thee: on the third day thou shalt go up unto the house of the LORD.

teats.text: They shall lament for the teats, for the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vine.

tebah.text: And his concubine, whose name was Reumah, she bare also Tebah, and Gaham, and Thahash, and Maachah.

tebaliah.text: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth: all the sons and brethren of Hosah were thirteen.

tebeth.text: So Esther was taken unto king Ahasuerus into his house royal in the tenth month, which is the month Tebeth, in the seventh year of his reign.

tedious.text: Notwithstanding, that I be not further tedious unto thee, I pray thee that thou wouldest hear us of thy clemency a few words.

teeth.text: His eyes shall be red with wine, and his teeth white with milk.

tehaphnehes.text: At Tehaphnehes also the day shall be darkened, when I shall break there the yokes of Egypt: and the pomp of her strength shall cease in her: as for her, a cloud shall cover her, and her daughters shall go into captivity.

tehinnah.text: And Eshton begat Bethrapha, and Paseah, and Tehinnah the father of Irnahash. These are the men of Rechah.

teil.text: But yet in it shall be a tenth, and it shall return, and shall be eaten: as a teil tree, and as an oak, whose substance is in them, when they cast their leaves: so the holy seed shall be the substance thereof.

tekel.text: And this is the writing that was written, MENE, MENE, TEKEL, UPHARSIN.

tekoa.text: And after that Hezron was dead in Calebephratah, then Abiah Hezron's wife bare him Ashur the father of Tekoa.

tekoah.text: And Joab sent to Tekoah, and fetched thence a wise woman, and said unto her, I pray thee, feign thyself to be a mourner, and put on now mourning apparel, and anoint not thyself with oil, but be as a woman that had a long time mourned for the dead:

tekoite.text: Helez the Paltite, Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite,

tekoites.text: And next unto them the Tekoites repaired; but their nobles put not their necks to the work of their LORD.

telabib.text: Then I came to them of the captivity at Telabib, that dwelt by the river of Chebar, and I sat where they sat, and remained there astonished among them seven days.

telah.text: And Rephah was his son, also Resheph, and Telah his son, and Tahan his son,

telaim.text: And Saul gathered the people together, and numbered them in Telaim, two hundred thousand footmen, and ten thousand men of Judah.

telassar.text: Have the gods of the nations delivered them which my fathers have destroyed, as Gozan, and Haran, and Rezeph, and the children of Eden which were in Telassar?

telharesha.text: And these were they which went up also from Telmelah, Telharesha, Cherub, Addon, and Immer: but they could not shew their father's house, nor their seed, whether they were of Israel.

telharsa.text: And these were they which went up from Telmelah, Telharsa, Cherub, Addan, and Immer: but they could not shew their father's house, and their seed, whether they were of Israel:

tell.text: And Pharaoh called Abram, and said, What is this that thou hast done unto me? why didst thou not tell me that she was thy wife?

tellest.text: Thou tellest my wanderings: put thou my tears into thy bottle: are they not in thy book?

telleth.text: And as since the time that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel, and have caused thee to rest from all thine enemies. Also the LORD telleth thee that he will make thee an house.

telling.text: And it was so, when Gideon heard the telling of the dream, and the interpretation thereof, that he worshipped, and returned into the host of Israel, and said, Arise; for the LORD hath delivered into your hand the host of Midian.

telmelah.text: And these were they which went up from Telmelah, Telharsa, Cherub, Addan, and Immer: but they could not shew their father's house, and their seed, whether they were of Israel:

tema.text: Hadar, and Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah:

teman.text: And the sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, and Gatam, and Kenaz.

temani.text: And Jobab died, and Husham of the land of Temani reigned in his stead.

temanite.text: Now when Job's three friends heard of all this evil that was come upon him, they came every one from his own place; Eliphaz the Temanite, and Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite: for they had made an appointment together to come to mourn with him and to comfort him.

temanites.text: And when Jobab was dead, Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his stead.

temeni.text: And Naarah bare him Ahuzam, and Hepher, and Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.

temper.text: And thou shalt prepare a meat offering for it every morning, the sixth part of an ephah, and the third part of an hin of oil, to temper with the fine flour; a meat offering continually by a perpetual ordinance unto the LORD.

temperance.text: And as he reasoned of righteousness, temperance, and judgment to come, Felix trembled, and answered, Go thy way for this time; when I have a convenient season, I will call for thee.

temperate.text: And every man that striveth for the mastery is temperate in all things. Now they do it to obtain a corruptible crown; but we an incorruptible.

tempered.text: And unleavened bread, and cakes unleavened tempered with oil, and wafers unleavened anointed with oil: of wheaten flour shalt thou make them.

tempest.text: For he breaketh me with a tempest, and multiplieth my wounds without cause.

tempestuous.text: Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence: a fire shall devour before him, and it shall be very tempestuous round about him.

temple.text: So Hannah rose up after they had eaten in Shiloh, and after they had drunk. Now Eli the priest sat upon a seat by a post of the temple of the LORD.

temples.text: Then Jael Heber's wife took a nail of the tent, and took an hammer in her hand, and went softly unto him, and smote the nail into his temples, and fastened it into the ground: for he was fast asleep and weary. So he died.

temporal.text: While we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen: for the things which are seen are temporal; but the things which are not seen are eternal.

tempt.text: And it came to pass after these things, that God did tempt Abraham, and said unto him, Abraham: and he said, Behold, here I am.

temptation.text: Harden not your heart, as in the provocation, and as in the day of temptation in the wilderness:

temptations.text: Or hath God assayed to go and take him a nation from the midst of another nation, by temptations, by signs, and by wonders, and by war, and by a mighty hand, and by a stretched out arm, and by great terrors, according to all that the LORD your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?

tempted.text: And he called the name of the place Massah, and Meribah, because of the chiding of the children of Israel, and because they tempted the LORD, saying, Is the LORD among us, or not?

tempter.text: And when the tempter came to him, he said, If thou be the Son of God, command that these stones be made bread.

tempteth.text: Let no man say when he is tempted, I am tempted of God: for God cannot be tempted with evil, neither tempteth he any man:

tempting.text: The Pharisees also with the Sadducees came, and tempting desired him that he would shew them a sign from heaven.

ten.text: And all the days of Cainan were nine hundred and ten years: and he died.

tend.text: The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; but of every one that is hasty only to want.

tender.text: And Abraham ran unto the herd, and fetcht a calf tender and good, and gave it unto a young man; and he hasted to dress it.

tenderhearted.text: And there are gathered unto him vain men, the children of Belial, and have strengthened themselves against Rehoboam the son of Solomon, when Rehoboam was young and tenderhearted, and could not withstand them.

tenderness.text: The tender and delicate woman among you, which would not adventure to set the sole of her foot upon the ground for delicateness and tenderness, her eye shall be evil toward the husband of her bosom, and toward her son, and toward her daughter,

tendeth.text: The labour of the righteous tendeth to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.

tenons.text: Two tenons shall there be in one board, set in order one against another: thus shalt thou make for all the boards of the tabernacle.

tenor.text: And they said, The man asked us straitly of our state, and of our kindred, saying, Is your father yet alive? have ye another brother? and we told him according to the tenor of these words: could we certainly know that he would say, Bring your brother down?

tens.text: Moreover thou shalt provide out of all the people able men, such as fear God, men of truth, hating covetousness; and place such over them, to be rulers of thousands, and rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens:

tent.text: And he drank of the wine, and was drunken; and he was uncovered within his tent.

tenth.text: And the waters decreased continually until the tenth month: in the tenth month, on the first day of the month, were the tops of the mountains seen.

tentmakers.text: And because he was of the same craft, he abode with them, and wrought: for by their occupation they were tentmakers.

tents.text: And Adah bare Jabal: he was the father of such as dwell in tents, and of such as have cattle.

terah.text: And Nahor lived nine and twenty years, and begat Terah:

teraphim.text: And the man Micah had an house of gods, and made an ephod, and teraphim, and consecrated one of his sons, who became his priest.

teresh.text: In those days, while Mordecai sat in the king's gate, two of the king's chamberlains, Bigthan and Teresh, of those which kept the door, were wroth, and sought to lay hand on the king Ahasuerus.

termed.text: Thou shalt no more be termed Forsaken; neither shall thy land any more be termed Desolate: but thou shalt be called Hephzibah, and thy land Beulah: for the LORD delighteth in thee, and thy land shall be married.

terraces.text: And the king made of the algum trees terraces to the house of the LORD, and to the king's palace, and harps and psalteries for singers: and there were none such seen before in the land of Judah.

terrestrial.text: There are also celestial bodies, and bodies terrestrial: but the glory of the celestial is one, and the glory of the terrestrial is another.

terrible.text: And he said, Behold, I make a covenant: before all thy people I will do marvels, such as have not been done in all the earth, nor in any nation: and all the people among which thou art shall see the work of the LORD: for it is a terrible thing that I will do with thee.

terribleness.text: And the LORD brought us forth out of Egypt with a mighty hand, and with an outstretched arm, and with great terribleness, and with signs, and with wonders:

terribly.text: And they shall go into the holes of the rocks, and into the caves of the earth, for fear of the LORD, and for the glory of his majesty, when he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.

terrified.text: And shall say unto them, Hear, O Israel, ye approach this day unto battle against your enemies: let not your hearts faint, fear not, and do not tremble, neither be ye terrified because of them;

terrifiest.text: Then thou scarest me with dreams, and terrifiest me through visions:

terrify.text: Let darkness and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell upon it; let the blackness of the day terrify it.

terror.text: And they journeyed: and the terror of God was upon the cities that were round about them, and they did not pursue after the sons of Jacob.

terrors.text: Or hath God assayed to go and take him a nation from the midst of another nation, by temptations, by signs, and by wonders, and by war, and by a mighty hand, and by a stretched out arm, and by great terrors, according to all that the LORD your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?

tertius.text: I Tertius, who wrote this epistle, salute you in the Lord.

tertullus.text: And after five days Ananias the high priest descended with the elders, and with a certain orator named Tertullus, who informed the governor against Paul.

testament.text: For this is my blood of the new testament, which is shed for many for the remission of sins.

testator.text: For where a testament is, there must also of necessity be the death of the testator.

testified.text: But if the ox were wont to push with his horn in time past, and it hath been testified to his owner, and he hath not kept him in, but that he hath killed a man or a woman; the ox shall be stoned, and his owner also shall be put to death.

testifiedst.text: And testifiedst against them, that thou mightest bring them again unto thy law: yet they dealt proudly, and hearkened not unto thy commandments, but sinned against thy judgments, (which if a man do, he shall live in them;) and withdrew the shoulder, and hardened their neck, and would not hear.

testifieth.text: And the pride of Israel testifieth to his face: and they do not return to the LORD their God, nor seek him for all this.

testify.text: Whoso killeth any person, the murderer shall be put to death by the mouth of witnesses: but one witness shall not testify against any person to cause him to die.

testifying.text: Testifying both to the Jews, and also to the Greeks, repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.

testimonies.text: These are the testimonies, and the statutes, and the judgments, which Moses spake unto the children of Israel, after they came forth out of Egypt,

testimony.text: As the LORD commanded Moses, so Aaron laid it up before the Testimony, to be kept.

tetrarch.text: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus,

thaddaeus.text: Philip, and Bartholomew; Thomas, and Matthew the publican; James the son of Alphaeus, and Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus;

thahash.text: And his concubine, whose name was Reumah, she bare also Tebah, and Gaham, and Thahash, and Maachah.

thamah.text: The children of Barkos, the children of Sisera, the children of Thamah,

thamar.text: And Judas begat Phares and Zara of Thamar; and Phares begat Esrom; and Esrom begat Aram;

than.text: Now the serpent was more subtil than any beast of the field which the LORD God had made. And he said unto the woman, Yea, hath God said, Ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?

thank.text: And he appointed certain of the Levites to minister before the ark of the LORD, and to record, and to thank and praise the LORD God of Israel:

thanked.text: And Joab fell to the ground on his face, and bowed himself, and thanked the king: and Joab said, To day thy servant knoweth that I have found grace in thy sight, my lord, O king, in that the king hath fulfilled the request of his servant.

thankful.text: Enter into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise: be thankful unto him, and bless his name.

thankfulness.text: We accept it always, and in all places, most noble Felix, with all thankfulness.

thanking.text: It came even to pass, as the trumpeters and singers were as one, to make one sound to be heard in praising and thanking the LORD; and when they lifted up their voice with the trumpets and cymbals and instruments of musick, and praised the LORD, saying, For he is good; for his mercy endureth for ever: that then the house was filled with a cloud, even the house of the LORD;

thanks.text: Therefore I will give thanks unto thee, O LORD, among the heathen, and I will sing praises unto thy name.

thanksgiving.text: If he offer it for a thanksgiving, then he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes mingled with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and cakes mingled with oil, of fine flour, fried.

thanksgivings.text: And at the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem they sought the Levites out of all their places, to bring them to Jerusalem, to keep the dedication with gladness, both with thanksgivings, and with singing, with cymbals, psalteries, and with harps.

thankworthy.text: For this is thankworthy, if a man for conscience toward God endure grief, suffering wrongfully.

thara.text: Which was the son of Jacob, which was the son of Isaac, which was the son of Abraham, which was the son of Thara, which was the son of Nachor,

tharshish.text: For the king had at sea a navy of Tharshish with the navy of Hiram: once in three years came the navy of Tharshish, bringing gold, and silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks.

theatre.text: And the whole city was filled with confusion: and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul's companions in travel, they rushed with one accord into the theatre.

thebez.text: Then went Abimelech to Thebez, and encamped against Thebez, and took it.

thee.text: And he said, Who told thee that thou wast naked? Hast thou eaten of the tree, whereof I commanded thee that thou shouldest not eat?

theeward.text: And Jonathan spake good of David unto Saul his father, and said unto him, Let not the king sin against his servant, against David; because he hath not sinned against thee, and because his works have been to thee-ward very good:

theft.text: If the sun be risen upon him, there shall be blood shed for him; for he should make full restitution; if he have nothing, then he shall be sold for his theft.

thefts.text: For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies:

theirs.text: And he said unto Abram, Know of a surety that thy seed shall be a stranger in a land that is not theirs, and shall serve them; and they shall afflict them four hundred years;

thelasar.text: Have the gods of the nations delivered them which my fathers have destroyed; as Gozan, and Haran, and Rezeph, and the children of Eden which were in Thelasar?

themselves.text: And the eyes of them both were opened, and they knew that they were naked; and they sewed fig leaves together, and made themselves aprons.

thence.text: And a river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from thence it was parted, and became into four heads.

thenceforth.text: When a bullock, or a sheep, or a goat, is brought forth, then it shall be seven days under the dam; and from the eighth day and thenceforth it shall be accepted for an offering made by fire unto the LORD.

theophilus.text: It seemed good to me also, having had perfect understanding of all things from the very first, to write unto thee in order, most excellent Theophilus,

thereabout.text: And it came to pass, as they were much perplexed thereabout, behold, two men stood by them in shining garments:

thereat.text: For Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet thereat:

thereby.text: And let it come to pass, that the damsel to whom I shall say, Let down thy pitcher, I pray thee, that I may drink; and she shall say, Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also: let the same be she that thou hast appointed for thy servant Isaac; and thereby shall I know that thou hast shewed kindness unto my master.

therefore.text: Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave unto his wife: and they shall be one flesh.

therefrom.text: Be ye therefore very courageous to keep and to do all that is written in the book of the law of Moses, that ye turn not aside therefrom to the right hand or to the left;

therein.text: And you, be ye fruitful, and multiply; bring forth abundantly in the earth, and multiply therein.

thereinto.text: Then let them which are in Judaea flee to the mountains; and let them which are in the midst of it depart out; and let not them that are in the countries enter thereinto.

thereof.text: But of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it: for in the day that thou eatest thereof thou shalt surely die.

thereon.text: And Jacob set up a pillar in the place where he talked with him, even a pillar of stone: and he poured a drink offering thereon, and he poured oil thereon.

thereout.text: And he shall bring it to Aaron's sons the priests: and he shall take thereout his handful of the flour thereof, and of the oil thereof, with all the frankincense thereof; and the priest shall burn the memorial of it upon the altar, to be an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD:

thereto.text: And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, and make thereto a crown of gold round about.

thereunto.text: They have turned aside quickly out of the way which I commanded them: they have made them a molten calf, and have worshipped it, and have sacrificed thereunto, and said, These be thy gods, O Israel, which have brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.

thereupon.text: The tabernacle of the congregation, and the ark of the testimony, and the mercy seat that is thereupon, and all the furniture of the tabernacle,

therewith.text: If fire break out, and catch in thorns, so that the stacks of corn, or the standing corn, or the field, be consumed therewith; he that kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.

thessalonians.text: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea; and of the Thessalonians, Aristarchus and Secundus; and Gaius of Derbe, and Timotheus; and of Asia, Tychicus and Trophimus.

thessalonica.text: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where was a synagogue of the Jews:

theudas.text: For before these days rose up Theudas, boasting himself to be somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves: who was slain; and all, as many as obeyed him, were scattered, and brought to nought.

thick.text: And Moses stretched forth his hand toward heaven; and there was a thick darkness in all the land of Egypt three days:

thicker.text: And the young men that were grown up with him spake unto him, saying, Thus shalt thou speak unto this people that spake unto thee, saying, Thy father made our yoke heavy, but make thou it lighter unto us; thus shalt thou say unto them, My little finger shall be thicker than my father's loins.

thicket.text: And Abraham lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold behind him a ram caught in a thicket by his horns: and Abraham went and took the ram, and offered him up for a burnt offering in the stead of his son.

thickets.text: When the men of Israel saw that they were in a strait, (for the people were distressed,) then the people did hide themselves in caves, and in thickets, and in rocks, and in high places, and in pits.

thickness.text: And the thickness of it was an handbreadth, and the brim of it like the work of the brim of a cup, with flowers of lilies; and it received and held three thousand baths.

thief.text: If a thief be found breaking up, and be smitten that he die, there shall no blood be shed for him.

thieves.text: Thy princes are rebellious, and companions of thieves: every one loveth gifts, and followeth after rewards: they judge not the fatherless, neither doth the cause of the widow come unto them.

thigh.text: And Abraham said unto his eldest servant of his house, that ruled over all that he had, Put, I pray thee, thy hand under my thigh:

thighs.text: And thou shalt make them linen breeches to cover their nakedness; from the loins even unto the thighs they shall reach:

thimnathah.text: And Elon, and Thimnathah, and Ekron,

thin.text: And, behold, seven thin ears and blasted with the east wind sprung up after them.

thine.text: And the LORD said unto Abram, after that Lot was separated from him, Lift up now thine eyes, and look from the place where thou art northward, and southward, and eastward, and westward:

thing.text: And God said, Let the earth bring forth the living creature after his kind, cattle, and creeping thing, and beast of the earth after his kind: and it was so.

things.text: And every living substance was destroyed which was upon the face of the ground, both man, and cattle, and the creeping things, and the fowl of the heaven; and they were destroyed from the earth: and Noah only remained alive, and they that were with him in the ark.

think.text: But think on me when it shall be well with thee, and shew kindness, I pray thee, unto me, and make mention of me unto Pharaoh, and bring me out of this house:

thinkest.text: And the princes of the children of Ammon said unto Hanun their lord, Thinkest thou that David doth honour thy father, that he hath sent comforters unto thee? hath not David rather sent his servants unto thee, to search the city, and to spy it out, and to overthrow it?

thinketh.text: And the watchman said, Me thinketh the running of the foremost is like the running of Ahimaaz the son of Zadok. And the king said, He is a good man, and cometh with good tidings.

thinking.text: When one told me, saying, Behold, Saul is dead, thinking to have brought good tidings, I took hold of him, and slew him in Ziklag, who thought that I would have given him a reward for his tidings:

third.text: And the evening and the morning were the third day.

thirdly.text: And God hath set some in the church, first apostles, secondarily prophets, thirdly teachers, after that miracles, then gifts of healings, helps, governments, diversities of tongues.

thirst.text: And the people thirsted there for water; and the people murmured against Moses, and said, Wherefore is this that thou hast brought us up out of Egypt, to kill us and our children and our cattle with thirst?

thirsted.text: And the people thirsted there for water; and the people murmured against Moses, and said, Wherefore is this that thou hast brought us up out of Egypt, to kill us and our children and our cattle with thirst?

thirsteth.text: My soul thirsteth for God, for the living God: when shall I come and appear before God?

thirsty.text: And he said unto her, Give me, I pray thee, a little water to drink; for I am thirsty. And she opened a bottle of milk, and gave him drink, and covered him.

thirteen.text: And Ishmael his son was thirteen years old, when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.

thirteenth.text: Twelve years they served Chedorlaomer, and in the thirteenth year they rebelled.

thirtieth.text: Shallum the son of Jabesh began to reign in the nine and thirtieth year of Uzziah king of Judah; and he reigned a full month in Samaria.

thirty.text: And Adam lived an hundred and thirty years, and begat a son in his own likeness, after his image; and called his name Seth:

thirtyfold.text: But other fell into good ground, and brought forth fruit, some an hundredfold, some sixtyfold, some thirtyfold.

thistle.text: And Jehoash the king of Israel sent to Amaziah king of Judah, saying, The thistle that was in Lebanon sent to the cedar that was in Lebanon, saying, Give thy daughter to my son to wife: and there passed by a wild beast that was in Lebanon, and trode down the thistle.

thistles.text: Thorns also and thistles shall it bring forth to thee; and thou shalt eat the herb of the field;

thither.text: Behold now, this city is near to flee unto, and it is a little one: Oh, let me escape thither, (is it not a little one?) and my soul shall live.

thitherward.text: And they turned thitherward, and came to the house of the young man the Levite, even unto the house of Micah, and saluted him.

thomas.text: Philip, and Bartholomew; Thomas, and Matthew the publican; James the son of Alphaeus, and Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus;

thongs.text: And as they bound him with thongs, Paul said unto the centurion that stood by, Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman, and uncondemned?

thorn.text: Canst thou put an hook into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a thorn?

thorns.text: Thorns also and thistles shall it bring forth to thee; and thou shalt eat the herb of the field;

thoroughly.text: And they said one to another, Go to, let us make brick, and burn them thoroughly. And they had brick for stone, and slime had they for morter.

those.text: There were giants in the earth in those days; and also after that, when the sons of God came in unto the daughters of men, and they bare children to them, the same became mighty men which were of old, men of renown.

thou.text: And the LORD God commanded the man, saying, Of every tree of the garden thou mayest freely eat:

though.text: And now, though thou wouldest needs be gone, because thou sore longedst after thy father's house, yet wherefore hast thou stolen my gods?

thought.text: And Abraham said, Because I thought, Surely the fear of God is not in this place; and they will slay me for my wife's sake.

thoughtest.text: These things hast thou done, and I kept silence; thou thoughtest that I was altogether such an one as thyself: but I will reprove thee, and set them in order before thine eyes.

thoughts.text: And God saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually.

thousand.text: And unto Sarah he said, Behold, I have given thy brother a thousand pieces of silver: behold, he is to thee a covering of the eyes, unto all that are with thee, and with all other: thus she was reproved.

thousands.text: And they blessed Rebekah, and said unto her, Thou art our sister, be thou the mother of thousands of millions, and let thy seed possess the gate of those which hate them.

thread.text: That I will not take from a thread even to a shoelatchet, and that I will not take any thing that is thine, lest thou shouldest say, I have made Abram rich:

threaten.text: But that it spread no further among the people, let us straitly threaten them, that they speak henceforth to no man in this name.

threatened.text: So when they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding nothing how they might punish them, because of the people: for all men glorified God for that which was done.

threatening.text: And, ye masters, do the same things unto them, forbearing threatening: knowing that your Master also is in heaven; neither is there respect of persons with him.

threatenings.text: And now, Lord, behold their threatenings: and grant unto thy servants, that with all boldness they may speak thy word,

three.text: And Enoch walked with God after he begat Methuselah three hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:

threefold.text: And if one prevail against him, two shall withstand him; and a threefold cord is not quickly broken.

threescore.text: And these are the days of the years of Abraham's life which he lived, an hundred threescore and fifteen years.

thresh.text: Behold, I will make thee a new sharp threshing instrument having teeth: thou shalt thresh the mountains, and beat them small, and shalt make the hills as chaff.

threshed.text: And there came an angel of the LORD, and sat under an oak which was in Ophrah, that pertained unto Joash the Abiezrite: and his son Gideon threshed wheat by the winepress, to hide it from the Midianites.

thresheth.text: Or saith he it altogether for our sakes? For our sakes, no doubt, this is written: that he that ploweth should plow in hope; and that he that thresheth in hope should be partaker of his hope.

threshing.text: And your threshing shall reach unto the vintage, and the vintage shall reach unto the sowing time: and ye shall eat your bread to the full, and dwell in your land safely.

threshingfloor.text: And they came to the threshingfloor of Atad, which is beyond Jordan, and there they mourned with a great and very sore lamentation: and he made a mourning for his father seven days.

threshingfloors.text: Then they told David, saying, Behold, the Philistines fight against Keilah, and they rob the threshingfloors.

threshingplace.text: And when the angel stretched out his hand upon Jerusalem to destroy it, the LORD repented him of the evil, and said to the angel that destroyed the people, It is enough: stay now thine hand. And the angel of the LORD was by the threshingplace of Araunah the Jebusite.

threshold.text: And her lord rose up in the morning, and opened the doors of the house, and went out to go his way: and, behold, the woman his concubine was fallen down at the door of the house, and her hands were upon the threshold.

thresholds.text: Mattaniah, and Bakbukiah, Obadiah, Meshullam, Talmon, Akkub, were porters keeping the ward at the thresholds of the gates.

threw.text: And as David and his men went by the way, Shimei went along on the hill's side over against him, and cursed as he went, and threw stones at him, and cast dust.

threwest.text: And thou didst divide the sea before them, so that they went through the midst of the sea on the dry land; and their persecutors thou threwest into the deeps, as a stone into the mighty waters.

thrice.text: Thrice in the year shall all your menchildren appear before the LORD God, the God of Israel.

throat.text: For there is no faithfulness in their mouth; their inward part is very wickedness; their throat is an open sepulchre; they flatter with their tongue.

throne.text: Thou shalt be over my house, and according unto thy word shall all my people be ruled: only in the throne will I be greater than thou.

thrones.text: For there are set thrones of judgment, the thrones of the house of David.

throng.text: And he spake to his disciples, that a small ship should wait on him because of the multitude, lest they should throng him.

thronged.text: And Jesus went with him; and much people followed him, and thronged him.

thronging.text: And his disciples said unto him, Thou seest the multitude thronging thee, and sayest thou, Who touched me?

through.text: And God said unto Noah, The end of all flesh is come before me; for the earth is filled with violence through them; and, behold, I will destroy them with the earth.

throughly.text: Oh that my grief were throughly weighed, and my calamity laid in the balances together!

throughout.text: Behold, there come seven years of great plenty throughout all the land of Egypt:

throw.text: And ye shall make no league with the inhabitants of this land; ye shall throw down their altars: but ye have not obeyed my voice: why have ye done this?

throwing.text: And if he smite him with throwing a stone, wherewith he may die, and he die, he is a murderer: the murderer shall surely be put to death.

thrown.text: Then sang Moses and the children of Israel this song unto the LORD, and spake, saying, I will sing unto the LORD, for he hath triumphed gloriously: the horse and his rider hath he thrown into the sea.

thrust.text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Yet will I bring one plague more upon Pharaoh, and upon Egypt; afterwards he will let you go hence: when he shall let you go, he shall surely thrust you out hence altogether.

thrusteth.text: Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.

thumb.text: Then shalt thou kill the ram, and take of his blood, and put it upon the tip of the right ear of Aaron, and upon the tip of the right ear of his sons, and upon the thumb of their right hand, and upon the great toe of their right foot, and sprinkle the blood upon the altar round about.

thumbs.text: And he brought Aaron's sons, and Moses put of the blood upon the tip of their right ear, and upon the thumbs of their right hands, and upon the great toes of their right feet: and Moses sprinkled the blood upon the altar round about.

thummim.text: And thou shalt put in the breastplate of judgment the Urim and the Thummim; and they shall be upon Aaron's heart, when he goeth in before the LORD: and Aaron shall bear the judgment of the children of Israel upon his heart before the LORD continually.

thunder.text: And Moses stretched forth his rod toward heaven: and the LORD sent thunder and hail, and the fire ran along upon the ground; and the LORD rained hail upon the land of Egypt.

thunderbolts.text: He gave up their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.

thundered.text: And as Samuel was offering up the burnt offering, the Philistines drew near to battle against Israel: but the LORD thundered with a great thunder on that day upon the Philistines, and discomfited them; and they were smitten before Israel.

thundereth.text: After it a voice roareth: he thundereth with the voice of his excellency; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard.

thunderings.text: Intreat the LORD (for it is enough) that there be no more mighty thunderings and hail; and I will let you go, and ye shall stay no longer.

thunders.text: And Moses went out of the city from Pharaoh, and spread abroad his hands unto the LORD: and the thunders and hail ceased, and the rain was not poured upon the earth.

thus.text: Thus the heavens and the earth were finished, and all the host of them.

thy.text: And he said, I heard thy voice in the garden, and I was afraid, because I was naked; and I hid myself.

thyatira.text: And a certain woman named Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, which worshipped God, heard us: whose heart the Lord opened, that she attended unto the things which were spoken of Paul.

thyine.text: The merchandise of gold, and silver, and precious stones, and of pearls, and fine linen, and purple, and silk, and scarlet, and all thyine wood, and all manner vessels of ivory, and all manner vessels of most precious wood, and of brass, and iron, and marble,

thyself.text: Is not the whole land before thee? separate thyself, I pray thee, from me: if thou wilt take the left hand, then I will go to the right; or if thou depart to the right hand, then I will go to the left.

tiberias.text: After these things Jesus went over the sea of Galilee, which is the sea of Tiberias.

tiberius.text: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judaea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip tetrarch of Ituraea and of the region of Trachonitis, and Lysanias the tetrarch of Abilene,

tibni.text: Then were the people of Israel divided into two parts: half of the people followed Tibni the son of Ginath, to make him king; and half followed Omri.

tie.text: Now therefore make a new cart, and take two milch kine, on which there hath come no yoke, and tie the kine to the cart, and bring their calves home from them:

tied.text: And they tied unto it a lace of blue, to fasten it on high upon the mitre; as the LORD commanded Moses.

tiglathpileser.text: In the days of Pekah king of Israel came Tiglathpileser king of Assyria, and took Ijon, and Abelbethmaachah, and Janoah, and Kedesh, and Hazor, and Gilead, and Galilee, all the land of Naphtali, and carried them captive to Assyria.

tikvah.text: So Hilkiah the priest, and Ahikam, and Achbor, and Shaphan, and Asahiah, went unto Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tikvah, the son of Harhas, keeper of the wardrobe; (now she dwelt in Jerusalem in the college;) and they communed with her.

tikvath.text: And Hilkiah, and they that the king had appointed, went to Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tikvath, the son of Hasrah, keeper of the wardrobe; (now she dwelt in Jerusalem in the college:) and they spake to her to that effect.

tile.text: Thou also, son of man, take thee a tile, and lay it before thee, and pourtray upon it the city, even Jerusalem:

tiling.text: And when they could not find by what way they might bring him in because of the multitude, they went upon the housetop, and let him down through the tiling with his couch into the midst before Jesus.

till.text: And every plant of the field before it was in the earth, and every herb of the field before it grew: for the LORD God had not caused it to rain upon the earth, and there was not a man to till the ground.

tillage.text: And over them that did the work of the field for tillage of the ground was Ezri the son of Chelub:

tiller.text: And she again bare his brother Abel. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.

tillest.text: When thou tillest the ground, it shall not henceforth yield unto thee her strength; a fugitive and a vagabond shalt thou be in the earth.

tilleth.text: He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread: but he that followeth vain persons is void of understanding.

tilon.text: And the sons of Shimon were, Amnon, and Rinnah, Benhanan, and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi were, Zoheth, and Benzoheth.

timber.text: And in cutting of stones, to set them, and in carving of timber, to work in all manner of workmanship.

timbrel.text: And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took a timbrel in her hand; and all the women went out after her with timbrels and with dances.

timbrels.text: And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took a timbrel in her hand; and all the women went out after her with timbrels and with dances.

time.text: And in process of time it came to pass, that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto the LORD.

times.text: And he said, Is not he rightly named Jacob? for he hath supplanted me these two times: he took away my birthright; and, behold, now he hath taken away my blessing. And he said, Hast thou not reserved a blessing for me?

tinkling.text: Moreover the LORD saith, Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, and walk with stretched forth necks and wanton eyes, walking and mincing as they go, and making a tinkling with their feet:

titles.text: Let me not, I pray you, accept any man's person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.

tittle.text: For verily I say unto you, Till heaven and earth pass, one jot or one tittle shall in no wise pass from the law, till all be fulfilled.

tormented.text: And saying, Lord, my servant lieth at home sick of the palsy, grievously tormented.

tormentors.text: And his lord was wroth, and delivered him to the tormentors, till he should pay all that was due unto him.

torments.text: And his fame went throughout all Syria: and they brought unto him all sick people that were taken with divers diseases and torments, and those which were possessed with devils, and those which were lunatick, and those that had the palsy; and he healed them.

tossed.text: I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.

tossings.text: When I lie down, I say, When shall I arise, and the night be gone? and I am full of tossings to and fro unto the dawning of the day.

touched.text: That thou wilt do us no hurt, as we have not touched thee, and as we have done unto thee nothing but good, and have sent thee away in peace: thou art now the blessed of the LORD.

towers.text: Therefore he said unto Judah, Let us build these cities, and make about them walls, and towers, gates, and bars, while the land is yet before us; because we have sought the LORD our God, we have sought him, and he hath given us rest on every side. So they built and prospered.

town.text: Then she let them down by a cord through the window: for her house was upon the town wall, and she dwelt upon the wall.

towns.text: These are the sons of Ishmael, and these are their names, by their towns, and by their castles; twelve princes according to their nations.

trade.text: And ye shall dwell with us: and the land shall be before you; dwell and trade ye therein, and get you possessions therein.

traded.text: Tarshish was thy merchant by reason of the multitude of all kind of riches; with silver, iron, tin, and lead, they traded in thy fairs.

traditions.text: And profited in the Jews' religion above many my equals in mine own nation, being more exceedingly zealous of the traditions of my fathers.

train.text: And she came to Jerusalem with a very great train, with camels that bare spices, and very much gold, and precious stones: and when she was come to Solomon, she communed with him of all that was in her heart.

trained.text: And when Abram heard that his brother was taken captive, he armed his trained servants, born in his own house, three hundred and eighteen, and pursued them unto Dan.

traitor.text: And Judas the brother of James, and Judas Iscariot, which also was the traitor.

traitors.text: Traitors, heady, highminded, lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God;

trample.text: Thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder: the young lion and the dragon shalt thou trample under feet.

trance.text: He hath said, which heard the words of God, which saw the vision of the Almighty, falling into a trance, but having his eyes open:

tranquillity.text: Wherefore, O king, let my counsel be acceptable unto thee, and break off thy sins by righteousness, and thine iniquities by shewing mercy to the poor; if it may be a lengthening of thy tranquillity.

transferred.text: And these things, brethren, I have in a figure transferred to myself and to Apollos for your sakes; that ye might learn in us not to think of men above that which is written, that no one of you be puffed up for one against another.
