transformed.text: And be not conformed to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what is that good, and acceptable, and perfect, will of God.

transforming.text: For such are false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into the apostles of Christ.

transgress.text: And Moses said, Wherefore now do ye transgress the commandment of the LORD? but it shall not prosper.

transgressed.text: Then thou shalt say before the LORD thy God, I have brought away the hallowed things out of mine house, and also have given them unto the Levite, and unto the stranger, to the fatherless, and to the widow, according to all thy commandments which thou hast commanded me: I have not transgressed thy commandments, neither have I forgotten them:

transgressest.text: Then the king's servants, which were in the king's gate, said unto Mordecai, Why transgressest thou the king's commandment?

transgresseth.text: A divine sentence is in the lips of the king: his mouth transgresseth not in judgment.

transgressing.text: If there be found among you, within any of thy gates which the LORD thy God giveth thee, man or woman, that hath wrought wickedness in the sight of the LORD thy God, in transgressing his covenant,

transgression.text: Keeping mercy for thousands, forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin, and that will by no means clear the guilty; visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, and upon the children's children, unto the third and to the fourth generation.

transgressions.text: Beware of him, and obey his voice, provoke him not; for he will not pardon your transgressions: for my name is in him.

transgressor.text: The wicked shall be a ransom for the righteous, and the transgressor for the upright.

transgressors.text: But the transgressors shall be destroyed together: the end of the wicked shall be cut off.

translate.text: To translate the kingdom from the house of Saul, and to set up the throne of David over Israel and over Judah, from Dan even to Beersheba.

translated.text: Who hath delivered us from the power of darkness, and hath translated us into the kingdom of his dear Son:

translation.text: By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death; and was not found, because God had translated him: for before his translation he had this testimony, that he pleased God.

transparent.text: And the twelve gates were twelve pearls: every several gate was of one pearl: and the street of the city was pure gold, as it were transparent glass.

trap.text: The snare is laid for him in the ground, and a trap for him in the way.

traps.text: Know for a certainty that the LORD your God will no more drive out any of these nations from before you; but they shall be snares and traps unto you, and scourges in your sides, and thorns in your eyes, until ye perish from off this good land which the LORD your God hath given you.

travail.text: And it came to pass in the time of her travail, that, behold, twins were in her womb.

travailed.text: And they journeyed from Bethel; and there was but a little way to come to Ephrath: and Rachel travailed, and she had hard labour.

travailest.text: For it is written, Rejoice, thou barren that bearest not; break forth and cry, thou that travailest not: for the desolate hath many more children than she which hath an husband.

travaileth.text: The wicked man travaileth with pain all his days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.

travailing.text: I have long time holden my peace; I have been still, and refrained myself: now will I cry like a travailing woman; I will destroy and devour at once.

travel.text: And the whole city was filled with confusion: and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul's companions in travel, they rushed with one accord into the theatre.

travelled.text: Now they which were scattered abroad upon the persecution that arose about Stephen travelled as far as Phenice, and Cyprus, and Antioch, preaching the word to none but unto the Jews only.

traveller.text: And there came a traveller unto the rich man, and he spared to take of his own flock and of his own herd, to dress for the wayfaring man that was come unto him; but took the poor man's lamb, and dressed it for the man that was come to him.

travellers.text: In the days of Shamgar the son of Anath, in the days of Jael, the highways were unoccupied, and the travellers walked through byways.

travelleth.text: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth, and thy want as an armed man.

travelling.text: The burden upon Arabia. In the forest in Arabia shall ye lodge, O ye travelling companies of Dedanim.

traversing.text: How canst thou say, I am not polluted, I have not gone after Baalim? see thy way in the valley, know what thou hast done: thou art a swift dromedary traversing her ways;

treacherous.text: A grievous vision is declared unto me; the treacherous dealer dealeth treacherously, and the spoiler spoileth. Go up, O Elam: besiege, O Media; all the sighing thereof have I made to cease.

treacherously.text: Then God sent an evil spirit between Abimelech and the men of Shechem; and the men of Shechem dealt treacherously with Abimelech:

treachery.text: And Joram turned his hands, and fled, and said to Ahaziah, There is treachery, O Ahaziah.

tread.text: Every place whereon the soles of your feet shall tread shall be yours: from the wilderness and Lebanon, from the river, the river Euphrates, even unto the uttermost sea shall your coast be.

treader.text: Behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that the plowman shall overtake the reaper, and the treader of grapes him that soweth seed; and the mountains shall drop sweet wine, and all the hills shall melt.

treaders.text: And gladness is taken away, and joy out of the plentiful field; and in the vineyards there shall be no singing, neither shall there be shouting: the treaders shall tread out no wine in their presses; I have made their vintage shouting to cease.

treadeth.text: Thou shalt not muzzle the ox when he treadeth out the corn.

treading.text: In those days saw I in Judah some treading wine presses on the sabbath, and bringing in sheaves, and lading asses; as also wine, grapes, and figs, and all manner of burdens, which they brought into Jerusalem on the sabbath day: and I testified against them in the day wherein they sold victuals.

treason.text: Now the rest of the acts of Zimri, and his treason that he wrought, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

treasure.text: And he said, Peace be to you, fear not: your God, and the God of your father, hath given you treasure in your sacks: I had your money. And he brought Simeon out unto them.

treasured.text: And her merchandise and her hire shall be holiness to the LORD: it shall not be treasured nor laid up; for her merchandise shall be for them that dwell before the LORD, to eat sufficiently, and for durable clothing.

treasurer.text: Even those did Cyrus king of Persia bring forth by the hand of Mithredath the treasurer, and numbered them unto Sheshbazzar, the prince of Judah.

treasurers.text: And I, even I Artaxerxes the king, do make a decree to all the treasurers which are beyond the river, that whatsoever Ezra the priest, the scribe of the law of the God of heaven, shall require of you, it be done speedily,

treasures.text: Is not this laid up in store with me, and sealed up among my treasures?

treasurest.text: But after thy hardness and impenitent heart treasurest up unto thyself wrath against the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God;

treasuries.text: For these Levites, the four chief porters, were in their set office, and were over the chambers and treasuries of the house of God.

treasury.text: But all the silver, and gold, and vessels of brass and iron, are consecrated unto the LORD: they shall come into the treasury of the LORD.

treatise.text: The former treatise have I made, O Theophilus, of all that Jesus began both to do and teach,

tree.text: And God said, Let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed, and the fruit tree yielding fruit after his kind, whose seed is in itself, upon the earth: and it was so.

trees.text: And the woman said unto the serpent, We may eat of the fruit of the trees of the garden:

tremble.text: This day will I begin to put the dread of thee and the fear of thee upon the nations that are under the whole heaven, who shall hear report of thee, and shall tremble, and be in anguish because of thee.

trembled.text: And Isaac trembled very exceedingly, and said, Who? where is he that hath taken venison, and brought it me, and I have eaten of all before thou camest, and have blessed him? yea, and he shall be blessed.

trembleth.text: At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of his place.

trembling.text: Then the dukes of Edom shall be amazed; the mighty men of Moab, trembling shall take hold upon them; all the inhabitants of Canaan shall melt away.

trench.text: And David rose up early in the morning, and left the sheep with a keeper, and took, and went, as Jesse had commanded him; and he came to the trench, as the host was going forth to the fight, and shouted for the battle.

trespass.text: And Jacob was wroth, and chode with Laban: and Jacob answered and said to Laban, What is my trespass? what is my sin, that thou hast so hotly pursued after me?

trespassed.text: It is a trespass offering: he hath certainly trespassed against the LORD.

trespasses.text: O LORD God of Israel, thou art righteous: for we remain yet escaped, as it is this day: behold, we are before thee in our trespasses: for we cannot stand before thee because of this.

trespassing.text: And the priest shall make an atonement for him before the LORD: and it shall be forgiven him for any thing of all that he hath done in trespassing therein.

trial.text: If the scourge slay suddenly, he will laugh at the trial of the innocent.

tribe.text: See, I have called by name Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah:

tribes.text: Dan shall judge his people, as one of the tribes of Israel.

tribulation.text: When thou art in tribulation, and all these things are come upon thee, even in the latter days, if thou turn to the LORD thy God, and shalt be obedient unto his voice;

tribulations.text: And ye have this day rejected your God, who himself saved you out of all your adversities and your tribulations; and ye have said unto him, Nay, but set a king over us. Now therefore present yourselves before the LORD by your tribes, and by your thousands.

tributaries.text: And it shall be, if it make thee answer of peace, and open unto thee, then it shall be, that all the people that is found therein shall be tributaries unto thee, and they shall serve thee.

tributary.text: How doth the city sit solitary, that was full of people! how is she become as a widow! she that was great among the nations, and princess among the provinces, how is she become tributary!

tribute.text: And he saw that rest was good, and the land that it was pleasant; and bowed his shoulder to bear, and became a servant unto tribute.

trickleth.text: Mine eye trickleth down, and ceaseth not, without any intermission,

tried.text: And the priests the sons of Levi shall come near; for them the LORD thy God hath chosen to minister unto him, and to bless in the name of the LORD; and by their word shall every controversy and every stroke be tried:

triest.text: I know also, my God, that thou triest the heart, and hast pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of mine heart I have willingly offered all these things: and now have I seen with joy thy people, which are present here, to offer willingly unto thee.

trieth.text: For the ear trieth words, as the mouth tasteth meat.

trimmed.text: And Mephibosheth the son of Saul came down to meet the king, and had neither dressed his feet, nor trimmed his beard, nor washed his clothes, from the day the king departed until the day he came again in peace.

trimmest.text: Why trimmest thou thy way to seek love? therefore hast thou also taught the wicked ones thy ways.

triumph.text: Tell it not in Gath, publish it not in the streets of Askelon; lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, lest the daughters of the uncircumcised triumph.

triumphed.text: Then sang Moses and the children of Israel this song unto the LORD, and spake, saying, I will sing unto the LORD, for he hath triumphed gloriously: the horse and his rider hath he thrown into the sea.

triumphing.text: That the triumphing of the wicked is short, and the joy of the hypocrite but for a moment?

troas.text: And they passing by Mysia came down to Troas.

trodden.text: Save Caleb the son of Jephunneh; he shall see it, and to him will I give the land that he hath trodden upon, and to his children, because he hath wholly followed the LORD.

trode.text: And they went out into the fields, and gathered their vineyards, and trode the grapes, and made merry, and went into the house of their god, and did eat and drink, and cursed Abimelech.

trogyllium.text: And we sailed thence, and came the next day over against Chios; and the next day we arrived at Samos, and tarried at Trogyllium; and the next day we came to Miletus.

troop.text: And Leah said, A troop cometh: and she called his name Gad.

troops.text: The troops of Tema looked, the companies of Sheba waited for them.

trophimus.text: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea; and of the Thessalonians, Aristarchus and Secundus; and Gaius of Derbe, and Timotheus; and of Asia, Tychicus and Trophimus.

trouble.text: And ye, in any wise keep yourselves from the accursed thing, lest ye make yourselves accursed, when ye take of the accursed thing, and make the camp of Israel a curse, and trouble it.

troubled.text: And Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, Ye have troubled me to make me to stink among the inhabitants of the land, among the Canaanites and the Perizzites: and I being few in number, they shall gather themselves together against me, and slay me; and I shall be destroyed, I and my house.

troubledst.text: Son of man, take up a lamentation for Pharaoh king of Egypt, and say unto him, Thou art like a young lion of the nations, and thou art as a whale in the seas: and thou camest forth with thy rivers, and troubledst the waters with thy feet, and fouledst their rivers.

troubler.text: And the sons of Carmi; Achar, the troubler of Israel, who transgressed in the thing accursed.

troubles.text: Then my anger shall be kindled against them in that day, and I will forsake them, and I will hide my face from them, and they shall be devoured, and many evils and troubles shall befall them; so that they will say in that day, Are not these evils come upon us, because our God is not among us?

troublest.text: While he yet spake, there came from the ruler of the synagogue's house certain which said, Thy daughter is dead: why troublest thou the Master any further?

troubleth.text: And Saul's servants said unto him, Behold now, an evil spirit from God troubleth thee.

troubling.text: There the wicked cease from troubling; and there the weary be at rest.

troublous.text: Know therefore and understand, that from the going forth of the commandment to restore and to build Jerusalem unto the Messiah the Prince shall be seven weeks, and threescore and two weeks: the street shall be built again, and the wall, even in troublous times.

trough.text: And she hasted, and emptied her pitcher into the trough, and ran again unto the well to draw water, and drew for all his camels.

troughs.text: And he set the rods which he had pilled before the flocks in the gutters in the watering troughs when the flocks came to drink, that they should conceive when they came to drink.

trow.text: Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him? I trow not.

trucebreakers.text: Without natural affection, trucebreakers, false accusers, incontinent, fierce, despisers of those that are good,

true.text: We are all one man's sons; we are true men, thy servants are no spies.

truly.text: If Cain shall be avenged sevenfold, truly Lamech seventy and sevenfold.

trump.text: In a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trump: for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.

trumpet.text: There shall not an hand touch it, but he shall surely be stoned, or shot through; whether it be beast or man, it shall not live: when the trumpet soundeth long, they shall come up to the mount.

trumpeters.text: And when she looked, behold, the king stood by a pillar, as the manner was, and the princes and the trumpeters by the king, and all the people of the land rejoiced, and blew with trumpets: and Athaliah rent her clothes, and cried, Treason, Treason.

trumpets.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, In the seventh month, in the first day of the month, shall ye have a sabbath, a memorial of blowing of trumpets, an holy convocation.

trust.text: And the bramble said unto the trees, If in truth ye anoint me king over you, then come and put your trust in my shadow: and if not, let fire come out of the bramble, and devour the cedars of Lebanon.

trusted.text: And he shall say, Where are their gods, their rock in whom they trusted,

trustedst.text: And he shall besiege thee in all thy gates, until thy high and fenced walls come down, wherein thou trustedst, throughout all thy land: and he shall besiege thee in all thy gates throughout all thy land, which the LORD thy God hath given thee.

trustest.text: And Rabshakeh said unto them, Speak ye now to Hezekiah, Thus saith the great king, the king of Assyria, What confidence is this wherein thou trustest?

trusteth.text: Behold, he drinketh up a river, and hasteth not: he trusteth that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth.

trusting.text: He shall not be afraid of evil tidings: his heart is fixed, trusting in the LORD.

trusty.text: He removeth away the speech of the trusty, and taketh away the understanding of the aged.

truth.text: And he said, Blessed be the LORD God of my master Abraham, who hath not left destitute my master of his mercy and his truth: I being in the way, the LORD led me to the house of my master's brethren.

try.text: And the LORD said unto Gideon, The people are yet too many; bring them down unto the water, and I will try them for thee there: and it shall be, that of whom I say unto thee, This shall go with thee, the same shall go with thee; and of whomsoever I say unto thee, This shall not go with thee, the same shall not go.

trying.text: Knowing this, that the trying of your faith worketh patience.

tryphena.text: Salute Tryphena and Tryphosa, who labour in the Lord. Salute the beloved Persis, which laboured much in the Lord.

tryphosa.text: Salute Tryphena and Tryphosa, who labour in the Lord. Salute the beloved Persis, which laboured much in the Lord.

tubal.text: The sons of Japheth; Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.

tubalcain.text: And Zillah, she also bare Tubalcain, an instructer of every artificer in brass and iron: and the sister of Tubalcain was Naamah.

tumbled.text: And when Gideon was come, behold, there was a man that told a dream unto his fellow, and said, Behold, I dreamed a dream, and, lo, a cake of barley bread tumbled into the host of Midian, and came unto a tent, and smote it that it fell, and overturned it, that the tent lay along.

tumult.text: And when Eli heard the noise of the crying, he said, What meaneth the noise of this tumult? And the man came in hastily, and told Eli.

tumults.text: Publish in the palaces at Ashdod, and in the palaces in the land of Egypt, and say, Assemble yourselves upon the mountains of Samaria, and behold the great tumults in the midst thereof, and the oppressed in the midst thereof.

tumultuous.text: The noise of a multitude in the mountains, like as of a great people; a tumultuous noise of the kingdoms of nations gathered together: the LORD of hosts mustereth the host of the battle.

turn.text: And he said, Behold now, my lords, turn in, I pray you, into your servant's house, and tarry all night, and wash your feet, and ye shall rise up early, and go on your ways. And they said, Nay; but we will abide in the street all night.

turned.text: So he drove out the man; and he placed at the east of the garden of Eden Cherubims, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life.

turnest.text: And keep the charge of the LORD thy God, to walk in his ways, to keep his statutes, and his commandments, and his judgments, and his testimonies, as it is written in the law of Moses, that thou mayest prosper in all that thou doest, and whithersoever thou turnest thyself:

turneth.text: And the soul that turneth after such as have familiar spirits, and after wizards, to go a whoring after them, I will even set my face against that soul, and will cut him off from among his people.

turning.text: And I will stretch over Jerusalem the line of Samaria, and the plummet of the house of Ahab: and I will wipe Jerusalem as a man wipeth a dish, wiping it, and turning it upside down.

turtle.text: The flowers appear on the earth; the time of the singing of birds is come, and the voice of the turtle is heard in our land;

turtledove.text: And he said unto him, Take me an heifer of three years old, and a she goat of three years old, and a ram of three years old, and a turtledove, and a young pigeon.

turtledoves.text: And if the burnt sacrifice for his offering to the LORD be of fowls, then he shall bring his offering of turtledoves, or of young pigeons.

turtles.text: And if she be not able to bring a lamb, then she shall bring two turtles, or two young pigeons; the one for the burnt offering, and the other for a sin offering: and the priest shall make an atonement for her, and she shall be clean.

tutors.text: But is under tutors and governors until the time appointed of the father.

twain.text: And Saul said, I will give him her, that she may be a snare to him, and that the hand of the Philistines may be against him. Wherefore Saul said to David, Thou shalt this day be my son in law in the one of the twain.

twelfth.text: On the twelfth day Ahira the son of Enan, prince of the children of Naphtali, offered:

twelve.text: And all the days of Seth were nine hundred and twelve years: and he died.

twentieth.text: And in the second month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, was the earth dried.

twenty.text: And the LORD said, My spirit shall not always strive with man, for that he also is flesh: yet his days shall be an hundred and twenty years.

twice.text: And for that the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.

twigs.text: He cropped off the top of his young twigs, and carried it into a land of traffick; he set it in a city of merchants.

twilight.text: And David smote them from the twilight even unto the evening of the next day: and there escaped not a man of them, save four hundred young men, which rode upon camels, and fled.

twined.text: Moreover thou shalt make the tabernacle with ten curtains of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet: with cherubims of cunning work shalt thou make them.

twinkling.text: In a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trump: for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.

twins.text: And when her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb.

two.text: And God made two great lights; the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night: he made the stars also.

twoedged.text: Let the high praises of God be in their mouth, and a two-edged sword in their hand;

twofold.text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye compass sea and land to make one proselyte, and when he is made, ye make him twofold more the child of hell than yourselves.

tychicus.text: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea; and of the Thessalonians, Aristarchus and Secundus; and Gaius of Derbe, and Timotheus; and of Asia, Tychicus and Trophimus.

tyrannus.text: But when divers were hardened, and believed not, but spake evil of that way before the multitude, he departed from them, and separated the disciples, disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus.

tyre.text: And then the coast turneth to Ramah, and to the strong city Tyre; and the coast turneth to Hosah; and the outgoings thereof are at the sea from the coast to Achzib:

tyrus.text: And all the kings of Tyrus, and all the kings of Zidon, and the kings of the isles which are beyond the sea,

ucal.text: The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, even the prophecy: the man spake unto Ithiel, even unto Ithiel and Ucal,

uel.text: Of the sons of Bani; Maadai, Amram, and Uel,

ulai.text: And I saw in a vision; and it came to pass, when I saw, that I was at Shushan in the palace, which is in the province of Elam; and I saw in a vision, and I was by the river of Ulai.

ulam.text: And Maachah the wife of Machir bare a son, and she called his name Peresh; and the name of his brother was Sheresh; and his sons were Ulam and Rakem.

ulla.text: And the sons of Ulla; Arah, and Haniel, and Rezia.

ummah.text: Ummah also, and Aphek, and Rehob: twenty and two cities with their villages.

unaccustomed.text: I have surely heard Ephraim bemoaning himself thus; Thou hast chastised me, and I was chastised, as a bullock unaccustomed to the yoke: turn thou me, and I shall be turned; for thou art the LORD my God.

unadvisedly.text: Because they provoked his spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.

unawares.text: And Jacob stole away unawares to Laban the Syrian, in that he told him not that he fled.

unbelief.text: And he did not many mighty works there because of their unbelief.

unbelievers.text: The lord of that servant will come in a day when he looketh not for him, and at an hour when he is not aware, and will cut him in sunder, and will appoint him his portion with the unbelievers.

unbelieving.text: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles, and made their minds evil affected against the brethren.

unblameable.text: In the body of his flesh through death, to present you holy and unblameable and unreproveable in his sight:

unblameably.text: Ye are witnesses, and God also, how holily and justly and unblameably we behaved ourselves among you that believe:

uncertain.text: For if the trumpet give an uncertain sound, who shall prepare himself to the battle?

uncertainly.text: I therefore so run, not as uncertainly; so fight I, not as one that beateth the air:

unchangeable.text: But this man, because he continueth ever, hath an unchangeable priesthood.

uncircumcised.text: And the uncircumcised man child whose flesh of his foreskin is not circumcised, that soul shall be cut off from his people; he hath broken my covenant.

uncircumcision.text: For circumcision verily profiteth, if thou keep the law: but if thou be a breaker of the law, thy circumcision is made uncircumcision.

uncle.text: And Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, the sons of Uzziel the uncle of Aaron, and said unto them, Come near, carry your brethren from before the sanctuary out of the camp.

unclean.text: Or if a soul touch any unclean thing, whether it be a carcase of an unclean beast, or a carcase of unclean cattle, or the carcase of unclean creeping things, and if it be hidden from him; he also shall be unclean, and guilty.

uncleanness.text: Or if he touch the uncleanness of man, whatsoever uncleanness it be that a man shall be defiled withal, and it be hid from him; when he knoweth of it, then he shall be guilty.

uncleannesses.text: I will also save you from all your uncleannesses: and I will call for the corn, and will increase it, and lay no famine upon you.

unclothed.text: For we that are in this tabernacle do groan, being burdened: not for that we would be unclothed, but clothed upon, that mortality might be swallowed up of life.

uncomely.text: But if any man think that he behaveth himself uncomely toward his virgin, if she pass the flower of her age, and need so require, let him do what he will, he sinneth not: let them marry.

uncondemned.text: But Paul said unto them, They have beaten us openly uncondemned, being Romans, and have cast us into prison; and now do they thrust us out privily? nay verily; but let them come themselves and fetch us out.

uncorruptible.text: And changed the glory of the uncorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man, and to birds, and fourfooted beasts, and creeping things.

uncorruptness.text: In all things shewing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine shewing uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity,

uncover.text: And Moses said unto Aaron, and unto Eleazar and unto Ithamar, his sons, Uncover not your heads, neither rend your clothes; lest ye die, and lest wrath come upon all the people: but let your brethren, the whole house of Israel, bewail the burning which the LORD hath kindled.

uncovered.text: And he drank of the wine, and was drunken; and he was uncovered within his tent.

uncovereth.text: And thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy mother's sister, nor of thy father's sister: for he uncovereth his near kin: they shall bear their iniquity.

unction.text: But ye have an unction from the Holy One, and ye know all things.

undefiled.text: Blessed are the undefiled in the way, who walk in the law of the LORD.

undergirding.text: Which when they had taken up, they used helps, undergirding the ship; and, fearing lest they should fall into the quicksands, strake sail, and so were driven.

underneath.text: And two other rings of gold thou shalt make, and shalt put them on the two sides of the ephod underneath, toward the forepart thereof, over against the other coupling thereof, above the curious girdle of the ephod.

undersetters.text: And every base had four brasen wheels, and plates of brass: and the four corners thereof had undersetters: under the laver were undersetters molten, at the side of every addition.

understand.text: Go to, let us go down, and there confound their language, that they may not understand one another's speech.

understandest.text: What knowest thou, that we know not? what understandest thou, which is not in us?

understandeth.text: And thou, Solomon my son, know thou the God of thy father, and serve him with a perfect heart and with a willing mind: for the LORD searcheth all hearts, and understandeth all the imaginations of the thoughts: if thou seek him, he will be found of thee; but if thou forsake him, he will cast thee off for ever.

understanding.text: And I have filled him with the spirit of God, in wisdom, and in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship,

understood.text: And they knew not that Joseph understood them; for he spake unto them by an interpreter.

undertake.text: Like a crane or a swallow, so did I chatter: I did mourn as a dove: mine eyes fail with looking upward: O LORD, I am oppressed; undertake for me.

undertook.text: And the Jews undertook to do as they had begun, and as Mordecai had written unto them;

undo.text: Is not this the fast that I have chosen? to loose the bands of wickedness, to undo the heavy burdens, and to let the oppressed go free, and that ye break every yoke?

undone.text: Woe to thee, Moab! thou art undone, O people of Chemosh: he hath given his sons that escaped, and his daughters, into captivity unto Sihon king of the Amorites.

undressed.text: That which groweth of its own accord of thy harvest thou shalt not reap, neither gather the grapes of thy vine undressed: for it is a year of rest unto the land.

unequal.text: Yet ye say, The way of the LORD is not equal. Hear now, O house of Israel; Is not my way equal? are not your ways unequal?

unequally.text: Be ye not unequally yoked together with unbelievers: for what fellowship hath righteousness with unrighteousness? and what communion hath light with darkness?

unfaithful.text: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.

unfaithfully.text: But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers: they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.

unfeigned.text: By pureness, by knowledge, by longsuffering, by kindness, by the Holy Ghost, by love unfeigned,

unfruitful.text: He also that received seed among the thorns is he that heareth the word; and the care of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, choke the word, and he becometh unfruitful.

vilely.text: Ye mountains of Gilboa, let there be no dew, neither let there be rain, upon you, nor fields of offerings: for there the shield of the mighty is vilely cast away, the shield of Saul, as though he had not been anointed with oil.

viler.text: They were children of fools, yea, children of base men: they were viler than the earth.

vilest.text: The wicked walk on every side, when the vilest men are exalted.

village.text: Saying unto them, Go into the village over against you, and straightway ye shall find an ass tied, and a colt with her: loose them, and bring them unto me.

villages.text: And the LORD did according to the word of Moses; and the frogs died out of the houses, out of the villages, and out of the fields.

villany.text: For the vile person will speak villany, and his heart will work iniquity, to practise hypocrisy, and to utter error against the LORD, to make empty the soul of the hungry, and he will cause the drink of the thirsty to fail.

vine.text: And the chief butler told his dream to Joseph, and said to him, In my dream, behold, a vine was before me;

vinedressers.text: But the captain of the guard left of the poor of the land to be vinedressers and husbandmen.

vinegar.text: He shall separate himself from wine and strong drink, and shall drink no vinegar of wine, or vinegar of strong drink, neither shall he drink any liquor of grapes, nor eat moist grapes, or dried.

vines.text: And wherefore have ye made us to come up out of Egypt, to bring us in unto this evil place? it is no place of seed, or of figs, or of vines, or of pomegranates; neither is there any water to drink.

vineyard.text: And Noah began to be an husbandman, and he planted a vineyard:

vineyards.text: Moreover thou hast not brought us into a land that floweth with milk and honey, or given us inheritance of fields and vineyards: wilt thou put out the eyes of these men? we will not come up.

vintage.text: And your threshing shall reach unto the vintage, and the vintage shall reach unto the sowing time: and ye shall eat your bread to the full, and dwell in your land safely.

viol.text: And the harp, and the viol, the tabret, and pipe, and wine, are in their feasts: but they regard not the work of the LORD, neither consider the operation of his hands.

violated.text: Her priests have violated my law, and have profaned mine holy things: they have put no difference between the holy and profane, neither have they shewed difference between the unclean and the clean, and have hid their eyes from my sabbaths, and I am profaned among them.

violence.text: The earth also was corrupt before God, and the earth was filled with violence.

violent.text: And that bringeth me forth from mine enemies: thou also hast lifted me up on high above them that rose up against me: thou hast delivered me from the violent man.

violently.text: And Abraham reproved Abimelech because of a well of water, which Abimelech's servants had violently taken away.

viols.text: Thy pomp is brought down to the grave, and the noise of thy viols: the worm is spread under thee, and the worms cover thee.

viper.text: He shall suck the poison of asps: the viper's tongue shall slay him.

vipers.text: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees come to his baptism, he said unto them, O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

virgin.text: And the damsel was very fair to look upon, a virgin, neither had any man known her: and she went down to the well, and filled her pitcher, and came up.

virginity.text: And he shall take a wife in her virginity.

virgins.text: If her father utterly refuse to give her unto him, he shall pay money according to the dowry of virgins.

virtue.text: And Jesus, immediately knowing in himself that virtue had gone out of him, turned him about in the press, and said, Who touched my clothes?

virtuous.text: And now, my daughter, fear not; I will do to thee all that thou requirest: for all the city of my people doth know that thou art a virtuous woman.

virtuously.text: Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.

visage.text: As many were astonied at thee; his visage was so marred more than any man, and his form more than the sons of men:

visible.text: For by him were all things created, that are in heaven, and that are in earth, visible and invisible, whether they be thrones, or dominions, or principalities, or powers: all things were created by him, and for him:

vision.text: After these things the word of the LORD came unto Abram in a vision, saying, Fear not, Abram: I am thy shield, and thy exceeding great reward.

visions.text: And God spake unto Israel in the visions of the night, and said, Jacob, Jacob. And he said, Here am I.

visit.text: And Joseph said unto his brethren, I die: and God will surely visit you, and bring you out of this land unto the land which he sware to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.

visitation.text: If these men die the common death of all men, or if they be visited after the visitation of all men; then the LORD hath not sent me.

visited.text: And the LORD visited Sarah as he had said, and the LORD did unto Sarah as he had spoken.

visitest.text: What is man, that thou art mindful of him? and the son of man, that thou visitest him?

visiteth.text: What then shall I do when God riseth up? and when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?

visiting.text: Thou shalt not bow down thyself to them, nor serve them: for I the LORD thy God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children unto the third and fourth generation of them that hate me;

vocation.text: I therefore, the prisoner of the Lord, beseech you that ye walk worthy of the vocation wherewith ye are called,

voice.text: And they heard the voice of the LORD God walking in the garden in the cool of the day: and Adam and his wife hid themselves from the presence of the LORD God amongst the trees of the garden.

voices.text: And the people came to the house of God, and abode there till even before God, and lifted up their voices, and wept sore;

void.text: And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.

volume.text: Then said I, Lo, I come: in the volume of the book it is written of me,

voluntarily.text: Now when the prince shall prepare a voluntary burnt offering or peace offerings voluntarily unto the LORD, one shall then open him the gate that looketh toward the east, and he shall prepare his burnt offering and his peace offerings, as he did on the sabbath day: then he shall go forth; and after his going forth one shall shut the gate.

voluntary.text: If his offering be a burnt sacrifice of the herd, let him offer a male without blemish: he shall offer it of his own voluntary will at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation before the LORD.

vomit.text: He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again: God shall cast them out of his belly.

vomited.text: And the LORD spake unto the fish, and it vomited out Jonah upon the dry land.

vomiteth.text: And the land is defiled: therefore I do visit the iniquity thereof upon it, and the land itself vomiteth out her inhabitants.

vophsi.text: Of the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi the son of Vophsi.

vow.text: And Jacob vowed a vow, saying, If God will be with me, and will keep me in this way that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and raiment to put on,

vowed.text: And Jacob vowed a vow, saying, If God will be with me, and will keep me in this way that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and raiment to put on,

vowedst.text: I am the God of Bethel, where thou anointedst the pillar, and where thou vowedst a vow unto me: now arise, get thee out from this land, and return unto the land of thy kindred.

vowest.text: Thou mayest not eat within thy gates the tithe of thy corn, or of thy wine, or of thy oil, or the firstlings of thy herds or of thy flock, nor any of thy vows which thou vowest, nor thy freewill offerings, or heave offering of thine hand:

voweth.text: But cursed be the deceiver, which hath in his flock a male, and voweth, and sacrificeth unto the LORD a corrupt thing: for I am a great King, saith the LORD of hosts, and my name is dreadful among the heathen.

vows.text: Speak unto Aaron, and to his sons, and unto all the children of Israel, and say unto them, Whatsoever he be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers in Israel, that will offer his oblation for all his vows, and for all his freewill offerings, which they will offer unto the LORD for a burnt offering;

voyage.text: And said unto them, Sirs, I perceive that this voyage will be with hurt and much damage, not only of the lading and ship, but also of our lives.

vulture.text: And the vulture, and the kite after his kind;

vultures.text: There shall the great owl make her nest, and lay, and hatch, and gather under her shadow: there shall the vultures also be gathered, every one with her mate.

wafer.text: And one loaf of bread, and one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer out of the basket of the unleavened bread that is before the LORD:

wafers.text: And the house of Israel called the name thereof Manna: and it was like coriander seed, white; and the taste of it was like wafers made with honey.

wag.text: To make their land desolate, and a perpetual hissing; every one that passeth thereby shall be astonished, and wag his head.

wages.text: And Laban said unto Jacob, Because thou art my brother, shouldest thou therefore serve me for nought? tell me, what shall thy wages be?

wagging.text: And they that passed by reviled him, wagging their heads,

wagon.text: And they brought their offering before the LORD, six covered wagons, and twelve oxen; a wagon for two of the princes, and for each one an ox: and they brought them before the tabernacle.

wagons.text: Now thou art commanded, this do ye; take you wagons out of the land of Egypt for your little ones, and for your wives, and bring your father, and come.

wail.text: Son of man, wail for the multitude of Egypt, and cast them down, even her, and the daughters of the famous nations, unto the nether parts of the earth, with them that go down into the pit.

wailed.text: And he cometh to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and seeth the tumult, and them that wept and wailed greatly.

wailing.text: And in every province, whithersoever the king's commandment and his decree came, there was great mourning among the Jews, and fasting, and weeping, and wailing; and many lay in sackcloth and ashes.

wait.text: And if a man lie not in wait, but God deliver him into his hand; then I will appoint thee a place whither he shall flee.

waited.text: I have waited for thy salvation, O LORD.

waiteth.text: The eye also of the adulterer waiteth for the twilight, saying, No eye shall see me: and disguiseth his face.

waiting.text: And from the age of fifty years they shall cease waiting upon the service thereof, and shall serve no more:

wake.text: In their heat I will make their feasts, and I will make them drunken, that they may rejoice, and sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, saith the LORD.

waked.text: And the angel that talked with me came again, and waked me, as a man that is wakened out of his sleep,

wakened.text: Let the heathen be wakened, and come up to the valley of Jehoshaphat: for there will I sit to judge all the heathen round about.

wakeneth.text: The Lord GOD hath given me the tongue of the learned, that I should know how to speak a word in season to him that is weary: he wakeneth morning by morning, he wakeneth mine ear to hear as the learned.

waketh.text: Except the LORD build the house, they labour in vain that build it: except the LORD keep the city, the watchman waketh but in vain.

waking.text: Thou holdest mine eyes waking: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.

walk.text: Arise, walk through the land in the length of it and in the breadth of it; for I will give it unto thee.

walked.text: And Enoch walked with God after he begat Methuselah three hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:

walkedst.text: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, When thou wast young, thou girdedst thyself, and walkedst whither thou wouldest: but when thou shalt be old, thou shalt stretch forth thy hands, and another shall gird thee, and carry thee whither thou wouldest not.

walkest.text: And thou shalt teach them diligently unto thy children, and shalt talk of them when thou sittest in thine house, and when thou walkest by the way, and when thou liest down, and when thou risest up.

walketh.text: For she had said unto the servant, What man is this that walketh in the field to meet us? And the servant had said, It is my master: therefore she took a vail, and covered herself.

walking.text: And they heard the voice of the LORD God walking in the garden in the cool of the day: and Adam and his wife hid themselves from the presence of the LORD God amongst the trees of the garden.

wall.text: O my soul, come not thou into their secret; unto their assembly, mine honour, be not thou united: for in their anger they slew a man, and in their selfwill they digged down a wall.

walled.text: And if a man sell a dwelling house in a walled city, then he may redeem it within a whole year after it is sold; within a full year may he redeem it.

wallow.text: O daughter of my people, gird thee with sackcloth, and wallow thyself in ashes: make thee mourning, as for an only son, most bitter lamentation: for the spoiler shall suddenly come upon us.

wallowed.text: And Amasa wallowed in blood in the midst of the highway. And when the man saw that all the people stood still, he removed Amasa out of the highway into the field, and cast a cloth upon him, when he saw that every one that came by him stood still.

wallowing.text: But it is happened unto them according to the true proverb, The dog is turned to his own vomit again; and the sow that was washed to her wallowing in the mire.

walls.text: And he shall look on the plague, and, behold, if the plague be in the walls of the house with hollow strakes, greenish or reddish, which in sight are lower than the wall;

wander.text: And it came to pass, when God caused me to wander from my father's house, that I said unto her, This is thy kindness which thou shalt shew unto me; at every place whither we shall come, say of me, He is my brother.

wandered.text: And Abraham rose up early in the morning, and took bread, and a bottle of water, and gave it unto Hagar, putting it on her shoulder, and the child, and sent her away: and she departed, and wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba.

wanderers.text: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will send unto him wanderers, that shall cause him to wander, and shall empty his vessels, and break their bottles.

wanderest.text: For of old time I have broken thy yoke, and burst thy bands; and thou saidst, I will not transgress; when upon every high hill and under every green tree thou wanderest, playing the harlot.

wandereth.text: He wandereth abroad for bread, saying, Where is it? he knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.

wandering.text: And a certain man found him, and, behold, he was wandering in the field: and the man asked him, saying, What seekest thou?

wanderings.text: Thou tellest my wanderings: put thou my tears into thy bottle: are they not in thy book?

want.text: Therefore shalt thou serve thine enemies which the LORD shall send against thee, in hunger, and in thirst, and in nakedness, and in want of all things: and he shall put a yoke of iron upon thy neck, until he have destroyed thee.

wanted.text: But since we left off to burn incense to the queen of heaven, and to pour out drink offerings unto her, we have wanted all things, and have been consumed by the sword and by the famine.

wanteth.text: But thou shalt open thine hand wide unto him, and shalt surely lend him sufficient for his need, in that which he wanteth.

wanting.text: Now therefore call unto me all the prophets of Baal, all his servants, and all his priests; let none be wanting: for I have a great sacrifice to do to Baal; whosoever shall be wanting, he shall not live. But Jehu did it in subtilty, to the intent that he might destroy the worshippers of Baal.

wanton.text: Moreover the LORD saith, Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, and walk with stretched forth necks and wanton eyes, walking and mincing as they go, and making a tinkling with their feet:

wantonness.text: Let us walk honestly, as in the day; not in rioting and drunkenness, not in chambering and wantonness, not in strife and envying.

wants.text: And the old man said, Peace be with thee; howsoever let all thy wants lie upon me; only lodge not in the street.

war.text: That these made war with Bera king of Sodom, and with Birsha king of Gomorrah, Shinab king of Admah, and Shemeber king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar.

ward.text: And he put them in ward in the house of the captain of the guard, into the prison, the place where Joseph was bound.

wardrobe.text: So Hilkiah the priest, and Ahikam, and Achbor, and Shaphan, and Asahiah, went unto Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tikvah, the son of Harhas, keeper of the wardrobe; (now she dwelt in Jerusalem in the college;) and they communed with her.

wards.text: So they and their children had the oversight of the gates of the house of the LORD, namely, the house of the tabernacle, by wards.

ware.text: And if the people of the land bring ware or any victuals on the sabbath day to sell, that we would not buy it of them on the sabbath, or on the holy day: and that we would leave the seventh year, and the exaction of every debt.

wares.text: Gather up thy wares out of the land, O inhabitant of the fortress.

warfare.text: And it came to pass in those days, that the Philistines gathered their armies together for warfare, to fight with Israel. And Achish said unto David, Know thou assuredly, that thou shalt go out with me to battle, thou and thy men.

warm.text: And he went up, and lay upon the child, and put his mouth upon his mouth, and his eyes upon his eyes, and his hands upon his hands: and he stretched himself upon the child; and the flesh of the child waxed warm.

warmed.text: If his loins have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;

warmeth.text: Which leaveth her eggs in the earth, and warmeth them in dust,

warming.text: And when she saw Peter warming himself, she looked upon him, and said, And thou also wast with Jesus of Nazareth.

warn.text: And what cause soever shall come to you of your brethren that dwell in their cities, between blood and blood, between law and commandment, statutes and judgments, ye shall even warn them that they trespass not against the LORD, and so wrath come upon you, and upon your brethren: this do, and ye shall not trespass.

warned.text: And the king of Israel sent to the place which the man of God told him and warned him of, and saved himself there, not once nor twice.

warning.text: To whom shall I speak, and give warning, that they may hear? behold, their ear is uncircumcised, and they cannot hearken: behold, the word of the LORD is unto them a reproach; they have no delight in it.

warp.text: Whether it be in the warp, or woof; of linen, or of woollen; whether in a skin, or in any thing made of skin;

warred.text: And they warred against the Midianites, as the LORD commanded Moses; and they slew all the males.

warreth.text: No man that warreth entangleth himself with the affairs of this life; that he may please him who hath chosen him to be a soldier.

warring.text: So Rabshakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah: for he had heard that he was departed from Lachish.

warrior.text: For every battle of the warrior is with confused noise, and garments rolled in blood; but this shall be with burning and fuel of fire.

warriors.text: And when Rehoboam was come to Jerusalem, he assembled all the house of Judah, with the tribe of Benjamin, an hundred and fourscore thousand chosen men, which were warriors, to fight against the house of Israel, to bring the kingdom again to Rehoboam the son of Solomon.

wars.text: Wherefore it is said in the book of the wars of the LORD, What he did in the Red sea, and in the brooks of Arnon,

wash.text: Let a little water, I pray you, be fetched, and wash your feet, and rest yourselves under the tree:

washed.text: And the man brought the men into Joseph's house, and gave them water, and they washed their feet; and he gave their asses provender.

washest.text: The waters wear the stones: thou washest away the things which grow out of the dust of the earth; and thou destroyest the hope of man.

washing.text: And if the priest look, and, behold, the plague be somewhat dark after the washing of it; then he shall rend it out of the garment, or out of the skin, or out of the warp, or out of the woof:

washings.text: Which stood only in meats and drinks, and divers washings, and carnal ordinances, imposed on them until the time of reformation.

washpot.text: Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe: Philistia, triumph thou because of me.

wast.text: And he said, Who told thee that thou wast naked? Hast thou eaten of the tree, whereof I commanded thee that thou shouldest not eat?

waste.text: And I will make your cities waste, and bring your sanctuaries unto desolation, and I will not smell the savour of your sweet odours.

wasted.text: And your children shall wander in the wilderness forty years, and bear your whoredoms, until your carcases be wasted in the wilderness.

wasteness.text: That day is a day of wrath, a day of trouble and distress, a day of wasteness and desolation, a day of darkness and gloominess, a day of clouds and thick darkness,

waster.text: He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster.

wastes.text: And they shall build the old wastes, they shall raise up the former desolations, and they shall repair the waste cities, the desolations of many generations.

wasteth.text: But man dieth, and wasteth away: yea, man giveth up the ghost, and where is he?

wasting.text: Their feet run to evil, and they make haste to shed innocent blood: their thoughts are thoughts of iniquity; wasting and destruction are in their paths.

watch.text: And Mizpah; for he said, The LORD watch between me and thee, when we are absent one from another.

watched.text: For I heard the defaming of many, fear on every side. Report, say they, and we will report it. All my familiars watched for my halting, saying, Peradventure he will be enticed, and we shall prevail against him, and we shall take our revenge on him.

watcher.text: I saw in the visions of my head upon my bed, and, behold, a watcher and an holy one came down from heaven;

watchers.text: Make ye mention to the nations; behold, publish against Jerusalem, that watchers come from a far country, and give out their voice against the cities of Judah.

watches.text: And I said unto them, Let not the gates of Jerusalem be opened until the sun be hot; and while they stand by, let them shut the doors, and bar them: and appoint watches of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, every one in his watch, and every one to be over against his house.

watcheth.text: The wicked watcheth the righteous, and seeketh to slay him.

watchful.text: Be watchful, and strengthen the things which remain, that are ready to die: for I have not found thy works perfect before God.

watching.text: And when he came, lo, Eli sat upon a seat by the wayside watching: for his heart trembled for the ark of God. And when the man came into the city, and told it, all the city cried out.

watchings.text: In stripes, in imprisonments, in tumults, in labours, in watchings, in fastings;

watchman.text: And David sat between the two gates: and the watchman went up to the roof over the gate unto the wall, and lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold a man running alone.

watchmen.text: And the watchmen of Saul in Gibeah of Benjamin looked; and, behold, the multitude melted away, and they went on beating down one another.

watchtower.text: Prepare the table, watch in the watchtower, eat, drink: arise, ye princes, and anoint the shield.

water.text: And a river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from thence it was parted, and became into four heads.

watercourse.text: This same Hezekiah also stopped the upper watercourse of Gihon, and brought it straight down to the west side of the city of David. And Hezekiah prospered in all his works.

watered.text: But there went up a mist from the earth, and watered the whole face of the ground.

wateredst.text: For the land, whither thou goest in to possess it, is not as the land of Egypt, from whence ye came out, where thou sowedst thy seed, and wateredst it with thy foot, as a garden of herbs:

waterest.text: Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it: thou greatly enrichest it with the river of God, which is full of water: thou preparest them corn, when thou hast so provided for it.

watereth.text: He watereth the hills from his chambers: the earth is satisfied with the fruit of thy works.

waterflood.text: Let not the waterflood overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up, and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.

watering.text: And he set the rods which he had pilled before the flocks in the gutters in the watering troughs when the flocks came to drink, that they should conceive when they came to drink.

waterpot.text: The woman then left her waterpot, and went her way into the city, and saith to the men,

waterpots.text: And there were set there six waterpots of stone, after the manner of the purifying of the Jews, containing two or three firkins apiece.

waters.text: And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.

waterspouts.text: Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of thy waterspouts: all thy waves and thy billows are gone over me.

watersprings.text: He turneth rivers into a wilderness, and the watersprings into dry ground;

wave.text: And thou shalt put all in the hands of Aaron, and in the hands of his sons; and shalt wave them for a wave offering before the LORD.

waved.text: And thou shalt sanctify the breast of the wave offering, and the shoulder of the heave offering, which is waved, and which is heaved up, of the ram of the consecration, even of that which is for Aaron, and of that which is for his sons:

wavereth.text: But let him ask in faith, nothing wavering. For he that wavereth is like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and tossed.

wavering.text: Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering; (for he is faithful that promised;)

waves.text: When the waves of death compassed me, the floods of ungodly men made me afraid;

wax.text: And my wrath shall wax hot, and I will kill you with the sword; and your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless.

waxed.text: Therefore Sarah laughed within herself, saying, After I am waxed old shall I have pleasure, my lord being old also?

waxen.text: For we will destroy this place, because the cry of them is waxen great before the face of the LORD; and the LORD hath sent us to destroy it.

waxeth.text: Mine eye is consumed because of grief; it waxeth old because of all mine enemies.

waxing.text: And many of the brethren in the Lord, waxing confident by my bonds, are much more bold to speak the word without fear.

way.text: So he drove out the man; and he placed at the east of the garden of Eden Cherubims, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life.

wayfaring.text: And when he had lifted up his eyes, he saw a wayfaring man in the street of the city: and the old man said, Whither goest thou? and whence comest thou?

waymarks.text: Set thee up waymarks, make thee high heaps: set thine heart toward the highway, even the way which thou wentest: turn again, O virgin of Israel, turn again to these thy cities.

ways.text: And he said, Behold now, my lords, turn in, I pray you, into your servant's house, and tarry all night, and wash your feet, and ye shall rise up early, and go on your ways. And they said, Nay; but we will abide in the street all night.

wayside.text: And when he came, lo, Eli sat upon a seat by the wayside watching: for his heart trembled for the ark of God. And when the man came into the city, and told it, all the city cried out.

weak.text: And see the land, what it is; and the people that dwelleth therein, whether they be strong or weak, few or many;

weaken.text: How art thou fallen from heaven, O Lucifer, son of the morning! how art thou cut down to the ground, which didst weaken the nations!

weakened.text: Then the people of the land weakened the hands of the people of Judah, and troubled them in building,

weakeneth.text: He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.

weaker.text: Now there was long war between the house of Saul and the house of David: but David waxed stronger and stronger, and the house of Saul waxed weaker and weaker.

weakness.text: Because the foolishness of God is wiser than men; and the weakness of God is stronger than men.

wealth.text: And all their wealth, and all their little ones, and their wives took they captive, and spoiled even all that was in the house.

wealthy.text: Thou hast caused men to ride over our heads; we went through fire and through water: but thou broughtest us out into a wealthy place.

weaned.text: And the child grew, and was weaned: and Abraham made a great feast the same day that Isaac was weaned.

weapon.text: Or if he smite him with an hand weapon of wood, wherewith he may die, and he die, he is a murderer: the murderer shall surely be put to death.

weapons.text: Now therefore take, I pray thee, thy weapons, thy quiver and thy bow, and go out to the field, and take me some venison;

wear.text: Thou wilt surely wear away, both thou, and this people that is with thee: for this thing is too heavy for thee; thou art not able to perform it thyself alone.

weareth.text: And ye have respect to him that weareth the gay clothing, and say unto him, Sit thou here in a good place; and say to the poor, Stand thou there, or sit here under my footstool:

wearied.text: And they smote the men that were at the door of the house with blindness, both small and great: so that they wearied themselves to find the door.

wearieth.text: Also by watering he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth his bright cloud:

weariness.text: And further, by these, my son, be admonished: of making many books there is no end; and much study is a weariness of the flesh.

wearing.text: And Ahiah, the son of Ahitub, Ichabod's brother, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eli, the LORD's priest in Shiloh, wearing an ephod. And the people knew not that Jonathan was gone.

wearisome.text: So am I made to possess months of vanity, and wearisome nights are appointed to me.

weary.text: And Rebekah said to Isaac, I am weary of my life because of the daughters of Heth: if Jacob take a wife of the daughters of Heth, such as these which are of the daughters of the land, what good shall my life do me?

weasel.text: These also shall be unclean unto you among the creeping things that creep upon the earth; the weasel, and the mouse, and the tortoise after his kind,

weather.text: Fair weather cometh out of the north: with God is terrible majesty.

weave.text: Moreover they that work in fine flax, and they that weave networks, shall be confounded.

weaver.text: Them hath he filled with wisdom of heart, to work all manner of work, of the engraver, and of the cunning workman, and of the embroiderer, in blue, and in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen, and of the weaver, even of them that do any work, and of those that devise cunning work.

weavest.text: And Delilah said unto Samson, Hitherto thou hast mocked me, and told me lies: tell me wherewith thou mightest be bound. And he said unto her, If thou weavest the seven locks of my head with the web.

web.text: And Delilah said unto Samson, Hitherto thou hast mocked me, and told me lies: tell me wherewith thou mightest be bound. And he said unto her, If thou weavest the seven locks of my head with the web.

webs.text: Their webs shall not become garments, neither shall they cover themselves with their works: their works are works of iniquity, and the act of violence is in their hands.

wedding.text: And sent forth his servants to call them that were bidden to the wedding: and they would not come.

wedge.text: When I saw among the spoils a goodly Babylonish garment, and two hundred shekels of silver, and a wedge of gold of fifty shekels weight, then I coveted them, and took them; and, behold, they are hid in the earth in the midst of my tent, and the silver under it.

wedlock.text: And I will judge thee, as women that break wedlock and shed blood are judged; and I will give thee blood in fury and jealousy.

weeds.text: The waters compassed me about, even to the soul: the depth closed me round about, the weeds were wrapped about my head.

week.text: Fulfil her week, and we will give thee this also for the service which thou shalt serve with me yet seven other years.

weeks.text: And thou shalt observe the feast of weeks, of the firstfruits of wheat harvest, and the feast of ingathering at the year's end.

weep.text: And Sarah died in Kirjatharba; the same is Hebron in the land of Canaan: and Abraham came to mourn for Sarah, and to weep for her.

weepest.text: Then said Elkanah her husband to her, Hannah, why weepest thou? and why eatest thou not? and why is thy heart grieved? am not I better to thee than ten sons?

weepeth.text: And it was told Joab, Behold, the king weepeth and mourneth for Absalom.

weeping.text: And, behold, one of the children of Israel came and brought unto his brethren a Midianitish woman in the sight of Moses, and in the sight of all the congregation of the children of Israel, who were weeping before the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

weigh.text: And David took the crown of their king from off his head, and found it to weigh a talent of gold, and there were precious stones in it; and it was set upon David's head: and he brought also exceeding much spoil out of the city.

weighed.text: And Abraham hearkened unto Ephron; and Abraham weighed to Ephron the silver, which he had named in the audience of the sons of Heth, four hundred shekels of silver, current money with the merchant.

weigheth.text: To make the weight for the winds; and he weigheth the waters by measure.

weighing.text: Each charger of silver weighing an hundred and thirty shekels, each bowl seventy: all the silver vessels weighed two thousand and four hundred shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary:

weight.text: And it came to pass, as the camels had done drinking, that the man took a golden earring of half a shekel weight, and two bracelets for her hands of ten shekels weight of gold;

weightier.text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye pay tithe of mint and anise and cummin, and have omitted the weightier matters of the law, judgment, mercy, and faith: these ought ye to have done, and not to leave the other undone.

weights.text: Just balances, just weights, a just ephah, and a just hin, shall ye have: I am the LORD your God, which brought you out of the land of Egypt.

weighty.text: A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty; but a fool's wrath is heavier than them both.

welfare.text: And he asked them of their welfare, and said, Is your father well, the old man of whom ye spake? Is he yet alive?

well.text: If thou doest well, shalt thou not be accepted? and if thou doest not well, sin lieth at the door. And unto thee shall be his desire, and thou shalt rule over him.

wellbeloved.text: A bundle of myrrh is my well-beloved unto me; he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.

wellfavoured.text: Because of the multitude of the whoredoms of the wellfavoured harlot, the mistress of witchcrafts, that selleth nations through her whoredoms, and families through her witchcrafts.

wellpleasing.text: But I have all, and abound: I am full, having received of Epaphroditus the things which were sent from you, an odour of a sweet smell, a sacrifice acceptable, wellpleasing to God.

wells.text: For all the wells which his father's servants had digged in the days of Abraham his father, the Philistines had stopped them, and filled them with earth.

wellspring.text: Understanding is a wellspring of life unto him that hath it: but the instruction of fools is folly.

wen.text: Blind, or broken, or maimed, or having a wen, or scurvy, or scabbed, ye shall not offer these unto the LORD, nor make an offering by fire of them upon the altar unto the LORD.

wench.text: Now Jonathan and Ahimaaz stayed by Enrogel; for they might not be seen to come into the city: and a wench went and told them; and they went and told king David.

went.text: But there went up a mist from the earth, and watered the whole face of the ground.

wentest.text: Unstable as water, thou shalt not excel; because thou wentest up to thy father's bed; then defiledst thou it: he went up to my couch.

wept.text: And she went, and sat her down over against him a good way off, as it were a bow shot: for she said, Let me not see the death of the child. And she sat over against him, and lift up her voice, and wept.

were.text: And God called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night. And the evening and the morning were the first day.

wert.text: If thou wert pure and upright; surely now he would awake for thee, and make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.

west.text: And he removed from thence unto a mountain on the east of Bethel, and pitched his tent, having Bethel on the west, and Hai on the east: and there he builded an altar unto the LORD, and called upon the name of the LORD.

western.text: And as for the western border, ye shall even have the great sea for a border: this shall be your west border.

westward.text: And the LORD said unto Abram, after that Lot was separated from him, Lift up now thine eyes, and look from the place where thou art northward, and southward, and eastward, and westward:

wet.text: They are wet with the showers of the mountains, and embrace the rock for want of a shelter.

whale.text: Am I a sea, or a whale, that thou settest a watch over me?

whales.text: And God created great whales, and every living creature that moveth, which the waters brought forth abundantly, after their kind, and every winged fowl after his kind: and God saw that it was good.

what.text: And out of the ground the LORD God formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the air; and brought them unto Adam to see what he would call them: and whatsoever Adam called every living creature, that was the name thereof.

whatsoever.text: And out of the ground the LORD God formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the air; and brought them unto Adam to see what he would call them: and whatsoever Adam called every living creature, that was the name thereof.

wheat.text: And Reuben went in the days of wheat harvest, and found mandrakes in the field, and brought them unto his mother Leah. Then Rachel said to Leah, Give me, I pray thee, of thy son's mandrakes.

wheaten.text: And unleavened bread, and cakes unleavened tempered with oil, and wafers unleavened anointed with oil: of wheaten flour shalt thou make them.

wheel.text: And under the borders were four wheels; and the axletrees of the wheels were joined to the base: and the height of a wheel was a cubit and half a cubit.

wheels.text: And took off their chariot wheels, that they drave them heavily: so that the Egyptians said, Let us flee from the face of Israel; for the LORD fighteth for them against the Egyptians.

whelp.text: Judah is a lion's whelp: from the prey, my son, thou art gone up: he stooped down, he couched as a lion, and as an old lion; who shall rouse him up?

whelps.text: For, said Hushai, thou knowest thy father and his men, that they be mighty men, and they be chafed in their minds, as a bear robbed of her whelps in the field: and thy father is a man of war, and will not lodge with the people.

when.text: These are the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that the LORD God made the earth and the heavens,

whence.text: Therefore the LORD God sent him forth from the garden of Eden, to till the ground from whence he was taken.

whensoever.text: And it came to pass, whensoever the stronger cattle did conceive, that Jacob laid the rods before the eyes of the cattle in the gutters, that they might conceive among the rods.

where.text: The name of the first is Pison: that is it which compasseth the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;

whereabout.text: And David said unto Ahimelech the priest, The king hath commanded me a business, and hath said unto me, Let no man know any thing of the business whereabout I send thee, and what I have commanded thee: and I have appointed my servants to such and such a place.

whereas.text: Whereas thou hast searched all my stuff, what hast thou found of all thy household stuff? set it here before my brethren and thy brethren, that they may judge betwixt us both.

whereby.text: And he said, LORD God, whereby shall I know that I shall inherit it?

wherefore.text: He was a mighty hunter before the LORD: wherefore it is said, Even as Nimrod the mighty hunter before the LORD.

wherein.text: And to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the air, and to every thing that creepeth upon the earth, wherein there is life, I have given every green herb for meat: and it was so.

whereinsoever.text: I speak as concerning reproach, as though we had been weak. Howbeit whereinsoever any is bold, (I speak foolishly,) I am bold also.

whereinto.text: And every earthen vessel, whereinto any of them falleth, whatsoever is in it shall be unclean; and ye shall break it.

whereof.text: And he said, Who told thee that thou wast naked? Hast thou eaten of the tree, whereof I commanded thee that thou shouldest not eat?

whereon.text: And, behold, the LORD stood above it, and said, I am the LORD God of Abraham thy father, and the God of Isaac: the land whereon thou liest, to thee will I give it, and to thy seed;

wheresoever.text: And if a leprosy break out abroad in the skin, and the leprosy cover all the skin of him that hath the plague from his head even to his foot, wheresoever the priest looketh;

whereto.text: Yea, whereto might the strength of their hands profit me, in whom old age was perished?

whereunto.text: And if they be married to any of the sons of the other tribes of the children of Israel, then shall their inheritance be taken from the inheritance of our fathers, and shall be put to the inheritance of the tribe whereunto they are received: so shall it be taken from the lot of our inheritance.

whereupon.text: And every thing whereupon any part of their carcase falleth shall be unclean; whether it be oven, or ranges for pots, they shall be broken down: for they are unclean, and shall be unclean unto you.

wherewith.text: And Esau hated Jacob because of the blessing wherewith his father blessed him: and Esau said in his heart, The days of mourning for my father are at hand; then will I slay my brother Jacob.

wherewithal.text: Wherewithal shall a young man cleanse his way? by taking heed thereto according to thy word.

whet.text: If I whet my glittering sword, and mine hand take hold on judgment; I will render vengeance to mine enemies, and will reward them that hate me.

whether.text: I will go down now, and see whether they have done altogether according to the cry of it, which is come unto me; and if not, I will know.

which.text: And God made the firmament, and divided the waters which were under the firmament from the waters which were above the firmament: and it was so.

while.text: While the earth remaineth, seedtime and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.

whiles.text: Whiles they see vanity unto thee, whiles they divine a lie unto thee, to bring thee upon the necks of them that are slain, of the wicked, whose day is come, when their iniquity shall have an end.

whilst.text: And Joash said unto all that stood against him, Will ye plead for Baal? will ye save him? he that will plead for him, let him be put to death whilst it is yet morning: if he be a god, let him plead for himself, because one hath cast down his altar.

whip.text: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool's back.

whips.text: And now whereas my father did lade you with a heavy yoke, I will add to your yoke: my father hath chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.

whirleth.text: The wind goeth toward the south, and turneth about unto the north; it whirleth about continually, and the wind returneth again according to his circuits.

whirlwind.text: And it came to pass, when the LORD would take up Elijah into heaven by a whirlwind, that Elijah went with Elisha from Gilgal.

whirlwinds.text: The burden of the desert of the sea. As whirlwinds in the south pass through; so it cometh from the desert, from a terrible land.

whisper.text: All that hate me whisper together against me: against me do they devise my hurt.

whispered.text: But when David saw that his servants whispered, David perceived that the child was dead: therefore David said unto his servants, Is the child dead? And they said, He is dead.

whisperer.text: A froward man soweth strife: and a whisperer separateth chief friends.

whisperers.text: Being filled with all unrighteousness, fornication, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, debate, deceit, malignity; whisperers,

whisperings.text: For I fear, lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I would, and that I shall be found unto you such as ye would not: lest there be debates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings, swellings, tumults:

whit.text: And thou shalt gather all the spoil of it into the midst of the street thereof, and shalt burn with fire the city, and all the spoil thereof every whit, for the LORD thy God: and it shall be an heap for ever; it shall not be built again.

white.text: And he removed that day the he goats that were ringstraked and spotted, and all the she goats that were speckled and spotted, and every one that had some white in it, and all the brown among the sheep, and gave them into the hand of his sons.

whited.text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye are like unto whited sepulchres, which indeed appear beautiful outward, but are within full of dead men's bones, and of all uncleanness.

whiter.text: Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean: wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
