whither.text: And he said, Hagar, Sarai's maid, whence camest thou? and whither wilt thou go? And she said, I flee from the face of my mistress Sarai.

whithersoever.text: Only be thou strong and very courageous, that thou mayest observe to do according to all the law, which Moses my servant commanded thee: turn not from it to the right hand or to the left, that thou mayest prosper whithersoever thou goest.

who.text: And he said, Who told thee that thou wast naked? Hast thou eaten of the tree, whereof I commanded thee that thou shouldest not eat?

whole.text: But there went up a mist from the earth, and watered the whole face of the ground.

wholesome.text: A wholesome tongue is a tree of life: but perverseness therein is a breach in the spirit.

wholly.text: And the priest of his sons that is anointed in his stead shall offer it: it is a statute for ever unto the LORD; it shall be wholly burnt.

whom.text: And the LORD God planted a garden eastward in Eden; and there he put the man whom he had formed.

whomsoever.text: With whomsoever thou findest thy gods, let him not live: before our brethren discern thou what is thine with me, and take it to thee. For Jacob knew not that Rachel had stolen them.

whore.text: Do not prostitute thy daughter, to cause her to be a whore; lest the land fall to whoredom, and the land become full of wickedness.

whoredom.text: And it came to pass about three months after, that it was told Judah, saying, Tamar thy daughter in law hath played the harlot; and also, behold, she is with child by whoredom. And Judah said, Bring her forth, and let her be burnt.

whoredoms.text: And your children shall wander in the wilderness forty years, and bear your whoredoms, until your carcases be wasted in the wilderness.

whoremonger.text: For this ye know, that no whoremonger, nor unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, hath any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.

whoremongers.text: For whoremongers, for them that defile themselves with mankind, for menstealers, for liars, for perjured persons, and if there be any other thing that is contrary to sound doctrine;

whores.text: They give gifts to all whores: but thou givest thy gifts to all thy lovers, and hirest them, that they may come unto thee on every side for thy whoredom.

whoring.text: Lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, and they go a whoring after their gods, and do sacrifice unto their gods, and one call thee, and thou eat of his sacrifice;

whorish.text: For by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of bread: and the adulteress will hunt for the precious life.

whose.text: And God said, Let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed, and the fruit tree yielding fruit after his kind, whose seed is in itself, upon the earth: and it was so.

whoso.text: Whoso sheddeth man's blood, by man shall his blood be shed: for in the image of God made he man.

whosoever.text: And the LORD said unto him, Therefore whosoever slayeth Cain, vengeance shall be taken on him sevenfold. And the LORD set a mark upon Cain, lest any finding him should kill him.

why.text: And the LORD said unto Cain, Why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance fallen?

wicked.text: But the men of Sodom were wicked and sinners before the LORD exceedingly.

wickedly.text: And said, I pray you, brethren, do not so wickedly.

wickedness.text: And God saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually.

wide.text: But thou shalt open thine hand wide unto him, and shalt surely lend him sufficient for his need, in that which he wanteth.

wideness.text: And between the chambers was the wideness of twenty cubits round about the house on every side.

widow.text: Then said Judah to Tamar his daughter in law, Remain a widow at thy father's house, till Shelah my son be grown: for he said, Lest peradventure he die also, as his brethren did. And Tamar went and dwelt in her father's house.

widowhood.text: And she arose, and went away, and laid by her vail from her, and put on the garments of her widowhood.

widows.text: And my wrath shall wax hot, and I will kill you with the sword; and your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless.

wife.text: Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave unto his wife: and they shall be one flesh.

wild.text: And he will be a wild man; his hand will be against every man, and every man's hand against him; and he shall dwell in the presence of all his brethren.

wilderness.text: And the Horites in their mount Seir, unto Elparan, which is by the wilderness.

wiles.text: For they vex you with their wiles, wherewith they have beguiled you in the matter of Peor, and in the matter of Cozbi, the daughter of a prince of Midian, their sister, which was slain in the day of the plague for Peor's sake.

wilfully.text: For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more sacrifice for sins,

wilily.text: They did work wilily, and went and made as if they had been ambassadors, and took old sacks upon their asses, and wine bottles, old, and rent, and bound up;

willeth.text: So then it is not of him that willeth, nor of him that runneth, but of God that sheweth mercy.

willing.text: And the servant said unto him, Peradventure the woman will not be willing to follow me unto this land: must I needs bring thy son again unto the land from whence thou camest?

willingly.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, that they bring me an offering: of every man that giveth it willingly with his heart ye shall take my offering.

willow.text: He took also of the seed of the land, and planted it in a fruitful field; he placed it by great waters, and set it as a willow tree.

willows.text: And ye shall take you on the first day the boughs of goodly trees, branches of palm trees, and the boughs of thick trees, and willows of the brook; and ye shall rejoice before the LORD your God seven days.

wilt.text: Is not the whole land before thee? separate thyself, I pray thee, from me: if thou wilt take the left hand, then I will go to the right; or if thou depart to the right hand, then I will go to the left.

wimples.text: The changeable suits of apparel, and the mantles, and the wimples, and the crisping pins,

win.text: After these things, and the establishment thereof, Sennacherib king of Assyria came, and entered into Judah, and encamped against the fenced cities, and thought to win them for himself.

wind.text: And God remembered Noah, and every living thing, and all the cattle that was with him in the ark: and God made a wind to pass over the earth, and the waters asswaged;

winding.text: The door for the middle chamber was in the right side of the house: and they went up with winding stairs into the middle chamber, and out of the middle into the third.

window.text: A window shalt thou make to the ark, and in a cubit shalt thou finish it above; and the door of the ark shalt thou set in the side thereof; with lower, second, and third stories shalt thou make it.

windows.text: In the six hundredth year of Noah's life, in the second month, the seventeenth day of the month, the same day were all the fountains of the great deep broken up, and the windows of heaven were opened.

winds.text: To make the weight for the winds; and he weigheth the waters by measure.

windy.text: I would hasten my escape from the windy storm and tempest.

wine.text: And he drank of the wine, and was drunken; and he was uncovered within his tent.

winebibber.text: The Son of man came eating and drinking, and they say, Behold a man gluttonous, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners. But wisdom is justified of her children.

winebibbers.text: Be not among winebibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh:

winefat.text: Wherefore art thou red in thine apparel, and thy garments like him that treadeth in the winefat?

winepress.text: And this your heave offering shall be reckoned unto you, as though it were the corn of the threshingfloor, and as the fulness of the winepress.

winepresses.text: Which make oil within their walls, and tread their winepresses, and suffer thirst.

wines.text: And in this mountain shall the LORD of hosts make unto all people a feast of fat things, a feast of wines on the lees, of fat things full of marrow, of wines on the lees well refined.

wing.text: And five cubits was the one wing of the cherub, and five cubits the other wing of the cherub: from the uttermost part of the one wing unto the uttermost part of the other were ten cubits.

winged.text: And God created great whales, and every living creature that moveth, which the waters brought forth abundantly, after their kind, and every winged fowl after his kind: and God saw that it was good.

wings.text: Ye have seen what I did unto the Egyptians, and how I bare you on eagles' wings, and brought you unto myself.

wink.text: Why doth thine heart carry thee away? and what do thy eyes wink at,

winked.text: And the times of this ignorance God winked at; but now commandeth all men every where to repent:

winketh.text: He winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers;

winneth.text: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he that winneth souls is wise.

winnowed.text: The oxen likewise and the young asses that ear the ground shall eat clean provender, which hath been winnowed with the shovel and with the fan.

winnoweth.text: And now is not Boaz of our kindred, with whose maidens thou wast? Behold, he winnoweth barley to night in the threshingfloor.

winter.text: While the earth remaineth, seedtime and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.

wintered.text: And after three months we departed in a ship of Alexandria, which had wintered in the isle, whose sign was Castor and Pollux.

winterhouse.text: Now the king sat in the winterhouse in the ninth month: and there was a fire on the hearth burning before him.

wipe.text: And I will stretch over Jerusalem the line of Samaria, and the plummet of the house of Ahab: and I will wipe Jerusalem as a man wipeth a dish, wiping it, and turning it upside down.

wiped.text: A wound and dishonour shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away.

wipeth.text: And I will stretch over Jerusalem the line of Samaria, and the plummet of the house of Ahab: and I will wipe Jerusalem as a man wipeth a dish, wiping it, and turning it upside down.

wiping.text: And I will stretch over Jerusalem the line of Samaria, and the plummet of the house of Ahab: and I will wipe Jerusalem as a man wipeth a dish, wiping it, and turning it upside down.

wires.text: And they did beat the gold into thin plates, and cut it into wires, to work it in the blue, and in the purple, and in the scarlet, and in the fine linen, with cunning work.

wisdom.text: And thou shalt speak unto all that are wise hearted, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom, that they may make Aaron's garments to consecrate him, that he may minister unto me in the priest's office.

wise.text: And when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was pleasant to the eyes, and a tree to be desired to make one wise, she took of the fruit thereof, and did eat, and gave also unto her husband with her; and he did eat.

wisely.text: Come on, let us deal wisely with them; lest they multiply, and it come to pass, that, when there falleth out any war, they join also unto our enemies, and fight against us, and so get them up out of the land.

wiser.text: For he was wiser than all men; than Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman, and Chalcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol: and his fame was in all nations round about.

wish.text: Behold, I am according to thy wish in God's stead: I also am formed out of the clay.

wished.text: And it came to pass, when the sun did arise, that God prepared a vehement east wind; and the sun beat upon the head of Jonah, that he fainted, and wished in himself to die, and said, It is better for me to die than to live.

wishing.text: Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.

wist.text: And when the children of Israel saw it, they said one to another, It is manna: for they wist not what it was. And Moses said unto them, This is the bread which the LORD hath given you to eat.

wit.text: And the man wondering at her held his peace, to wit whether the LORD had made his journey prosperous or not.

witch.text: Thou shalt not suffer a witch to live.

witchcraft.text: For rebellion is as the sin of witchcraft, and stubbornness is as iniquity and idolatry. Because thou hast rejected the word of the LORD, he hath also rejected thee from being king.

witchcrafts.text: And it came to pass, when Joram saw Jehu, that he said, Is it peace, Jehu? And he answered, What peace, so long as the whoredoms of thy mother Jezebel and her witchcrafts are so many?

withal.text: And thou shalt make the dishes thereof, and spoons thereof, and covers thereof, and bowls thereof, to cover withal: of pure gold shalt thou make them.

withdraw.text: And it came to pass, while Saul talked unto the priest, that the noise that was in the host of the Philistines went on and increased: and Saul said unto the priest, Withdraw thine hand.

withdrawest.text: Why withdrawest thou thy hand, even thy right hand? pluck it out of thy bosom.

withdraweth.text: He withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous: but with kings are they on the throne; yea, he doth establish them for ever, and they are exalted.

withdrawn.text: Certain men, the children of Belial, are gone out from among you, and have withdrawn the inhabitants of their city, saying, Let us go and serve other gods, which ye have not known;

withdrew.text: And testifiedst against them, that thou mightest bring them again unto thy law: yet they dealt proudly, and hearkened not unto thy commandments, but sinned against thy judgments, (which if a man do, he shall live in them;) and withdrew the shoulder, and hardened their neck, and would not hear.

wither.text: And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, that bringeth forth his fruit in his season; his leaf also shall not wither; and whatsoever he doeth shall prosper.

withered.text: And, behold, seven ears, withered, thin, and blasted with the east wind, sprung up after them:

withereth.text: Whilst it is yet in his greenness, and not cut down, it withereth before any other herb.

withheld.text: And God said unto him in a dream, Yea, I know that thou didst this in the integrity of thy heart; for I also withheld thee from sinning against me: therefore suffered I thee not to touch her.

withheldest.text: Thou gavest also thy good spirit to instruct them, and withheldest not thy manna from their mouth, and gavest them water for their thirst.

withhold.text: Hear us, my lord: thou art a mighty prince among us: in the choice of our sepulchres bury thy dead; none of us shall withhold from thee his sepulchre, but that thou mayest bury thy dead.

withholden.text: Now therefore, my lord, as the LORD liveth, and as thy soul liveth, seeing the LORD hath withholden thee from coming to shed blood, and from avenging thyself with thine own hand, now let thine enemies, and they that seek evil to my lord, be as Nabal.

withholdeth.text: Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up: also he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.

within.text: Make thee an ark of gopher wood; rooms shalt thou make in the ark, and shalt pitch it within and without with pitch.

without.text: And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.

withs.text: And Samson said unto her, If they bind me with seven green withs that were never dried, then shall I be weak, and be as another man.

withstand.text: And the angel of the LORD said unto him, Wherefore hast thou smitten thine ass these three times? behold, I went out to withstand thee, because thy way is perverse before me:

withstood.text: And they withstood Uzziah the king, and said unto him, It appertaineth not unto thee, Uzziah, to burn incense unto the LORD, but to the priests the sons of Aaron, that are consecrated to burn incense: go out of the sanctuary; for thou hast trespassed; neither shall it be for thine honour from the LORD God.

witness.text: And he said, For these seven ewe lambs shalt thou take of my hand, that they may be a witness unto me, that I have digged this well.

witnessed.text: And there came in two men, children of Belial, and sat before him: and the men of Belial witnessed against him, even against Naboth, in the presence of the people, saying, Naboth did blaspheme God and the king. Then they carried him forth out of the city, and stoned him with stones, that he died.

witnesses.text: Whoso killeth any person, the murderer shall be put to death by the mouth of witnesses: but one witness shall not testify against any person to cause him to die.

witnesseth.text: There is another that beareth witness of me; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true.

witnessing.text: Having therefore obtained help of God, I continue unto this day, witnessing both to small and great, saying none other things than those which the prophets and Moses did say should come:

wittingly.text: And Israel stretched out his right hand, and laid it upon Ephraim's head, who was the younger, and his left hand upon Manasseh's head, guiding his hands wittingly; for Manasseh was the firstborn.

witty.text: I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions.

wives.text: And Lamech took unto him two wives: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.

wizard.text: A man also or woman that hath a familiar spirit, or that is a wizard, shall surely be put to death: they shall stone them with stones: their blood shall be upon them.

wizards.text: Regard not them that have familiar spirits, neither seek after wizards, to be defiled by them: I am the LORD your God.

woe.text: Woe to thee, Moab! thou art undone, O people of Chemosh: he hath given his sons that escaped, and his daughters, into captivity unto Sihon king of the Amorites.

woeful.text: As for me, I have not hastened from being a pastor to follow thee: neither have I desired the woeful day; thou knowest: that which came out of my lips was right before thee.

woes.text: One woe is past; and, behold, there come two woes more hereafter.

wolf.text: Benjamin shall ravin as a wolf: in the morning he shall devour the prey, and at night he shall divide the spoil.

wolves.text: Her princes in the midst thereof are like wolves ravening the prey, to shed blood, and to destroy souls, to get dishonest gain.

woman.text: And the rib, which the LORD God had taken from man, made he a woman, and brought her unto the man.

womankind.text: Thou shalt not lie with mankind, as with womankind: it is abomination.

womb.text: And the LORD said unto her, Two nations are in thy womb, and two manner of people shall be separated from thy bowels; and the one people shall be stronger than the other people; and the elder shall serve the younger.

wombs.text: For the LORD had fast closed up all the wombs of the house of Abimelech, because of Sarah Abraham's wife.

women.text: And he brought back all the goods, and also brought again his brother Lot, and his goods, and the women also, and the people.

womenservants.text: And Abimelech took sheep, and oxen, and menservants, and womenservants, and gave them unto Abraham, and restored him Sarah his wife.

won.text: Out of the spoils won in battles did they dedicate to maintain the house of the LORD.

wonder.text: If there arise among you a prophet, or a dreamer of dreams, and giveth thee a sign or a wonder,

wondered.text: And he saw that there was no man, and wondered that there was no intercessor: therefore his arm brought salvation unto him; and his righteousness, it sustained him.

wonderful.text: Then the LORD will make thy plagues wonderful, and the plagues of thy seed, even great plagues, and of long continuance, and sore sicknesses, and of long continuance.

wonderfully.text: Wherefore then do ye harden your hearts, as the Egyptians and Pharaoh hardened their hearts? when he had wrought wonderfully among them, did they not let the people go, and they departed?

wondering.text: And the man wondering at her held his peace, to wit whether the LORD had made his journey prosperous or not.

wonderously.text: So Manoah took a kid with a meat offering, and offered it upon a rock unto the LORD: and the angel did wonderously; and Manoah and his wife looked on.

wonders.text: And I will stretch out my hand, and smite Egypt with all my wonders which I will do in the midst thereof: and after that he will let you go.

wondrous.text: Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him, talk ye of all his wondrous works.

wondrously.text: And ye shall eat in plenty, and be satisfied, and praise the name of the LORD your God, that hath dealt wondrously with you: and my people shall never be ashamed.

wont.text: But if the ox were wont to push with his horn in time past, and it hath been testified to his owner, and he hath not kept him in, but that he hath killed a man or a woman; the ox shall be stoned, and his owner also shall be put to death.

wood.text: Make thee an ark of gopher wood; rooms shalt thou make in the ark, and shalt pitch it within and without with pitch.

woods.text: And I will make with them a covenant of peace, and will cause the evil beasts to cease out of the land: and they shall dwell safely in the wilderness, and sleep in the woods.

woof.text: Whether it be in the warp, or woof; of linen, or of woollen; whether in a skin, or in any thing made of skin;

wool.text: Behold, I will put a fleece of wool in the floor; and if the dew be on the fleece only, and it be dry upon all the earth beside, then shall I know that thou wilt save Israel by mine hand, as thou hast said.

woollen.text: The garment also that the plague of leprosy is in, whether it be a woollen garment, or a linen garment;

word.text: After these things the word of the LORD came unto Abram in a vision, saying, Fear not, Abram: I am thy shield, and thy exceeding great reward.

words.text: And it came to pass, when he saw the earring and bracelets upon his sister's hands, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister, saying, Thus spake the man unto me; that he came unto the man; and, behold, he stood by the camels at the well.

work.text: And on the seventh day God ended his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made.

worker.text: He was a widow's son of the tribe of Naphtali, and his father was a man of Tyre, a worker in brass: and he was filled with wisdom, and understanding, and cunning to work all works in brass. And he came to king Solomon, and wrought all his work.

workers.text: Moreover the workers with familiar spirits, and the wizards, and the images, and the idols, and all the abominations that were spied in the land of Judah and in Jerusalem, did Josiah put away, that he might perform the words of the law which were written in the book that Hilkiah the priest found in the house of the LORD.

worketh.text: Lo, all these things worketh God oftentimes with man,

workfellow.text: Timotheus my workfellow, and Lucius, and Jason, and Sosipater, my kinsmen, salute you.

working.text: Thy tongue deviseth mischiefs; like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.

workman.text: Them hath he filled with wisdom of heart, to work all manner of work, of the engraver, and of the cunning workman, and of the embroiderer, in blue, and in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen, and of the weaver, even of them that do any work, and of those that devise cunning work.

workmanship.text: And I have filled him with the spirit of God, in wisdom, and in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship,

workmen.text: She put her hand to the nail, and her right hand to the workmen's hammer; and with the hammer she smote Sisera, she smote off his head, when she had pierced and stricken through his temples.

works.text: And the king of Egypt said unto them, Wherefore do ye, Moses and Aaron, let the people from their works? get you unto your burdens.

world.text: He raiseth up the poor out of the dust, and lifteth up the beggar from the dunghill, to set them among princes, and to make them inherit the throne of glory: for the pillars of the earth are the LORD's, and he hath set the world upon them.

worldly.text: Teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly, in this present world;

worlds.text: Hath in these last days spoken unto us by his Son, whom he hath appointed heir of all things, by whom also he made the worlds;

worm.text: And they laid it up till the morning, as Moses bade: and it did not stink, neither was there any worm therein.

worms.text: Notwithstanding they hearkened not unto Moses; but some of them left of it until the morning, and it bred worms, and stank: and Moses was wroth with them.

wormwood.text: Lest there should be among you man, or woman, or family, or tribe, whose heart turneth away this day from the LORD our God, to go and serve the gods of these nations; lest there should be among you a root that beareth gall and wormwood;

worse.text: And they said, Stand back. And they said again, This one fellow came in to sojourn, and he will needs be a judge: now will we deal worse with thee, than with them. And they pressed sore upon the man, even Lot, and came near to break the door.

worship.text: And Abraham said unto his young men, Abide ye here with the ass; and I and the lad will go yonder and worship, and come again to you.

worshipped.text: And the man bowed down his head, and worshipped the LORD.

worshipper.text: Now we know that God heareth not sinners: but if any man be a worshipper of God, and doeth his will, him he heareth.

worshippers.text: Now therefore call unto me all the prophets of Baal, all his servants, and all his priests; let none be wanting: for I have a great sacrifice to do to Baal; whosoever shall be wanting, he shall not live. But Jehu did it in subtilty, to the intent that he might destroy the worshippers of Baal.

worshippeth.text: Thou, even thou, art LORD alone; thou hast made heaven, the heaven of heavens, with all their host, the earth, and all things that are therein, the seas, and all that is therein, and thou preservest them all; and the host of heaven worshippeth thee.

worshipping.text: And it came to pass, as he was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons smote him with the sword: and they escaped into the land of Armenia. And Esarhaddon his son reigned in his stead.

worst.text: Wherefore I will bring the worst of the heathen, and they shall possess their houses: I will also make the pomp of the strong to cease; and their holy places shall be defiled.

worth.text: That he may give me the cave of Machpelah, which he hath, which is in the end of his field; for as much money as it is worth he shall give it me for a possession of a buryingplace amongst you.

worthies.text: He shall recount his worthies: they shall stumble in their walk; they shall make haste to the wall thereof, and the defence shall be prepared.

worthily.text: And all the people that were in the gate, and the elders, said, We are witnesses. The LORD make the woman that is come into thine house like Rachel and like Leah, which two did build the house of Israel: and do thou worthily in Ephratah, and be famous in Bethlehem:

worthy.text: I am not worthy of the least of all the mercies, and of all the truth, which thou hast shewed unto thy servant; for with my staff I passed over this Jordan; and now I am become two bands.

wot.text: And Abimelech said, I wot not who hath done this thing: neither didst thou tell me, neither yet heard I of it, but to day.

wotteth.text: But he refused, and said unto his master's wife, Behold, my master wotteth not what is with me in the house, and he hath committed all that he hath to my hand;

would.text: And out of the ground the LORD God formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the air; and brought them unto Adam to see what he would call them: and whatsoever Adam called every living creature, that was the name thereof.

wouldest.text: And she said unto her, Is it a small matter that thou hast taken my husband? and wouldest thou take away my son's mandrakes also? And Rachel said, Therefore he shall lie with thee to night for thy son's mandrakes.

wound.text: Burning for burning, wound for wound, stripe for stripe.

wounded.text: He that is wounded in the stones, or hath his privy member cut off, shall not enter into the congregation of the LORD.

woundedst.text: Thou wentest forth for the salvation of thy people, even for salvation with thine anointed; thou woundedst the head out of the house of the wicked, by discovering the foundation unto the neck. Selah.

woundeth.text: For he maketh sore, and bindeth up: he woundeth, and his hands make whole.

wounding.text: And Lamech said unto his wives, Adah and Zillah, Hear my voice; ye wives of Lamech, hearken unto my speech: for I have slain a man to my wounding, and a young man to my hurt.

wounds.text: And king Joram went back to be healed in Jezreel of the wounds which the Syrians had given him at Ramah, when he fought against Hazael king of Syria. And Ahaziah the son of Jehoram king of Judah went down to see Joram the son of Ahab in Jezreel, because he was sick.

wove.text: And he brake down the houses of the sodomites, that were by the house of the LORD, where the women wove hangings for the grove.

woven.text: And there shall be an hole in the top of it, in the midst thereof: it shall have a binding of woven work round about the hole of it, as it were the hole of an habergeon, that it be not rent.

wrap.text: For the bed is shorter than that a man can stretch himself on it: and the covering narrower than that he can wrap himself in it.

wrapped.text: And she put her widow's garments off from her, and covered her with a vail, and wrapped herself, and sat in an open place, which is by the way to Timnath; for she saw that Shelah was grown, and she was not given unto him to wife.

wrath.text: And it came to pass, when his master heard the words of his wife, which she spake unto him, saying, After this manner did thy servant to me; that his wrath was kindled.

wrathful.text: Pour out thine indignation upon them, and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.

wraths.text: For I fear, lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I would, and that I shall be found unto you such as ye would not: lest there be debates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings, swellings, tumults:

wreath.text: And four hundred pomegranates on the two wreaths; two rows of pomegranates on each wreath, to cover the two pommels of the chapiters which were upon the pillars.

wreathed.text: The yoke of my transgressions is bound by his hand: they are wreathed, and come up upon my neck: he hath made my strength to fall, the LORD hath delivered me into their hands, from whom I am not able to rise up.

wreathen.text: And two chains of pure gold at the ends; of wreathen work shalt thou make them, and fasten the wreathen chains to the ouches.

wreaths.text: And nets of checker work, and wreaths of chain work, for the chapiters which were upon the top of the pillars; seven for the one chapiter, and seven for the other chapiter.

wrest.text: Thou shalt not follow a multitude to do evil; neither shalt thou speak in a cause to decline after many to wrest judgment:

wrestle.text: For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places.

wrestled.text: And Rachel said, With great wrestlings have I wrestled with my sister, and I have prevailed: and she called his name Naphtali.

wrestlings.text: And Rachel said, With great wrestlings have I wrestled with my sister, and I have prevailed: and she called his name Naphtali.

wretched.text: O wretched man that I am! who shall deliver me from the body of this death?

wretchedness.text: And if thou deal thus with me, kill me, I pray thee, out of hand, if I have found favour in thy sight; and let me not see my wretchedness.

wring.text: And the priest shall bring it unto the altar, and wring off his head, and burn it on the altar; and the blood thereof shall be wrung out at the side of the altar:

wringed.text: And it was so: for he rose up early on the morrow, and thrust the fleece together, and wringed the dew out of the fleece, a bowl full of water.

wringing.text: Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife.

wrinkle.text: That he might present it to himself a glorious church, not having spot, or wrinkle, or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.

wrinkles.text: And thou hast filled me with wrinkles, which is a witness against me: and my leanness rising up in me beareth witness to my face.

write.text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Write this for a memorial in a book, and rehearse it in the ears of Joshua: for I will utterly put out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.

writer.text: Out of Ephraim was there a root of them against Amalek; after thee, Benjamin, among thy people; out of Machir came down governors, and out of Zebulun they that handle the pen of the writer.

writest.text: For thou writest bitter things against me, and makest me to possess the iniquities of my youth.

writeth.text: The LORD shall count, when he writeth up the people, that this man was born there. Selah.

writing.text: And the tables were the work of God, and the writing was the writing of God, graven upon the tables.

writings.text: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

written.text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Come up to me into the mount, and be there: and I will give thee tables of stone, and a law, and commandments which I have written; that thou mayest teach them.

wrong.text: And Sarai said unto Abram, My wrong be upon thee: I have given my maid into thy bosom; and when she saw that she had conceived, I was despised in her eyes: the LORD judge between me and thee.

wronged.text: Receive us; we have wronged no man, we have corrupted no man, we have defrauded no man.

wrongeth.text: But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: all they that hate me love death.

wrongfully.text: Behold, I know your thoughts, and the devices which ye wrongfully imagine against me.

wrote.text: And Moses wrote all the words of the LORD, and rose up early in the morning, and builded an altar under the hill, and twelve pillars, according to the twelve tribes of Israel.

wroth.text: But unto Cain and to his offering he had not respect. And Cain was very wroth, and his countenance fell.

wrought.text: And the sons of Jacob came out of the field when they heard it: and the men were grieved, and they were very wroth, because he had wrought folly in Israel in lying with Jacob's daughter; which thing ought not to be done.

wroughtest.text: And her mother in law said unto her, Where hast thou gleaned to day? and where wroughtest thou? blessed be he that did take knowledge of thee. And she shewed her mother in law with whom she had wrought, and said, The man's name with whom I wrought to day is Boaz.

wrung.text: And the priest shall bring it unto the altar, and wring off his head, and burn it on the altar; and the blood thereof shall be wrung out at the side of the altar:

yarn.text: And Solomon had horses brought out of Egypt, and linen yarn: the king's merchants received the linen yarn at a price.

ye.text: Now the serpent was more subtil than any beast of the field which the LORD God had made. And he said unto the woman, Yea, hath God said, Ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?

yea.text: Now the serpent was more subtil than any beast of the field which the LORD God had made. And he said unto the woman, Yea, hath God said, Ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?

year.text: In the six hundredth year of Noah's life, in the second month, the seventeenth day of the month, the same day were all the fountains of the great deep broken up, and the windows of heaven were opened.

yearly.text: And as a yearly hired servant shall he be with him: and the other shall not rule with rigour over him in thy sight.

yearn.text: And Joseph made haste; for his bowels did yearn upon his brother: and he sought where to weep; and he entered into his chamber, and wept there.

yearned.text: Then spake the woman whose the living child was unto the king, for her bowels yearned upon her son, and she said, O my lord, give her the living child, and in no wise slay it. But the other said, Let it be neither mine nor thine, but divide it.

years.text: And God said, Let there be lights in the firmament of the heaven to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days, and years:

yell.text: They shall roar together like lions: they shall yell as lions' whelps.

yelled.text: The young lions roared upon him, and yelled, and they made his land waste: his cities are burned without inhabitant.

yellow.text: Then the priest shall see the plague: and, behold, if it be in sight deeper than the skin; and there be in it a yellow thin hair; then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a dry scall, even a leprosy upon the head or beard.

yes.text: He saith, Yes. And when he was come into the house, Jesus prevented him, saying, What thinkest thou, Simon? of whom do the kings of the earth take custom or tribute? of their own children, or of strangers?

yesterday.text: And the officers of the children of Israel, which Pharaoh's taskmasters had set over them, were beaten, and demanded, Wherefore have ye not fulfilled your task in making brick both yesterday and to day, as heretofore?

yesternight.text: And it came to pass on the morrow, that the firstborn said unto the younger, Behold, I lay yesternight with my father: let us make him drink wine this night also; and go thou in, and lie with him, that we may preserve seed of our father.

yet.text: And the LORD said, My spirit shall not always strive with man, for that he also is flesh: yet his days shall be an hundred and twenty years.

yield.text: When thou tillest the ground, it shall not henceforth yield unto thee her strength; a fugitive and a vagabond shalt thou be in the earth.

yielded.text: And when Jacob had made an end of commanding his sons, he gathered up his feet into the bed, and yielded up the ghost, and was gathered unto his people.

yieldeth.text: And it yieldeth much increase unto the kings whom thou hast set over us because of our sins: also they have dominion over our bodies, and over our cattle, at their pleasure, and we are in great distress.

yielding.text: And God said, Let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed, and the fruit tree yielding fruit after his kind, whose seed is in itself, upon the earth: and it was so.

yoke.text: And by thy sword shalt thou live, and shalt serve thy brother; and it shall come to pass when thou shalt have the dominion, that thou shalt break his yoke from off thy neck.

yoked.text: Be ye not unequally yoked together with unbelievers: for what fellowship hath righteousness with unrighteousness? and what communion hath light with darkness?

yokefellow.text: And I intreat thee also, true yokefellow, help those women which laboured with me in the gospel, with Clement also, and with other my fellowlabourers, whose names are in the book of life.

yokes.text: Thus saith the LORD to me; Make thee bonds and yokes, and put them upon thy neck,

yonder.text: And Abraham said unto his young men, Abide ye here with the ass; and I and the lad will go yonder and worship, and come again to you.

young.text: And Lamech said unto his wives, Adah and Zillah, Hear my voice; ye wives of Lamech, hearken unto my speech: for I have slain a man to my wounding, and a young man to my hurt.

younger.text: And Noah awoke from his wine, and knew what his younger son had done unto him.

youngest.text: And they said, Thy servants are twelve brethren, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and, behold, the youngest is this day with our father, and one is not.

your.text: For God doth know that in the day ye eat thereof, then your eyes shall be opened, and ye shall be as gods, knowing good and evil.

yourselves.text: Let a little water, I pray you, be fetched, and wash your feet, and rest yourselves under the tree:

youth.text: And the LORD smelled a sweet savour; and the LORD said in his heart, I will not again curse the ground any more for man's sake; for the imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth; neither will I again smite any more every thing living, as I have done.

youthful.text: Flee also youthful lusts: but follow righteousness, faith, charity, peace, with them that call on the Lord out of a pure heart.

youths.text: And beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,

youward.text: For our rejoicing is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom, but by the grace of God, we have had our conversation in the world, and more abundantly to you-ward.

zaanaim.text: Now Heber the Kenite, which was of the children of Hobab the father in law of Moses, had severed himself from the Kenites, and pitched his tent unto the plain of Zaanaim, which is by Kedesh.

zaanan.text: Pass ye away, thou inhabitant of Saphir, having thy shame naked: the inhabitant of Zaanan came not forth in the mourning of Bethezel; he shall receive of you his standing.

zaanannim.text: And their coast was from Heleph, from Allon to Zaanannim, and Adami, Nekeb, and Jabneel, unto Lakum; and the outgoings thereof were at Jordan:

zaavan.text: The children of Ezer are these; Bilhan, and Zaavan, and Akan.

zabad.text: And Attai begat Nathan, and Nathan begat Zabad,

zabbai.text: Of the sons also of Bebai; Jehohanan, Hananiah, Zabbai, and Athlai.

zabbud.text: Of the sons also of Bigvai; Uthai, and Zabbud, and with them seventy males.

zabdi.text: But the children of Israel committed a trespass in the accursed thing: for Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took of the accursed thing: and the anger of the LORD was kindled against the children of Israel.

zabdiel.text: Over the first course for the first month was Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.

zabud.text: And Azariah the son of Nathan was over the officers: and Zabud the son of Nathan was principal officer, and the king's friend:

zabulon.text: And leaving Nazareth, he came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is upon the sea coast, in the borders of Zabulon and Nephthalim:

zaccai.text: The children of Zaccai, seven hundred and threescore.

zacchaeus.text: And, behold, there was a man named Zacchaeus, which was the chief among the publicans, and he was rich.

zacchur.text: And the sons of Mishma; Hamuel his son, Zacchur his son, Shimei his son.

zaccur.text: And these were their names: of the tribe of Reuben, Shammua the son of Zaccur.

zachariah.text: And Jeroboam slept with his fathers, even with the kings of Israel; and Zachariah his son reigned in his stead.

zacharias.text: That upon you may come all the righteous blood shed upon the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel unto the blood of Zacharias son of Barachias, whom ye slew between the temple and the altar.

zacher.text: And Gedor, and Ahio, and Zacher.

zadok.text: And Zadok the son of Ahitub, and Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, were the priests; and Seraiah was the scribe;

zaham.text: Which bare him children; Jeush, and Shamariah, and Zaham.

zair.text: So Joram went over to Zair, and all the chariots with him: and he rose by night, and smote the Edomites which compassed him about, and the captains of the chariots: and the people fled into their tents.

zalaph.text: After him repaired Hananiah the son of Shelemiah, and Hanun the sixth son of Zalaph, another piece. After him repaired Meshullam the son of Berechiah over against his chamber.

zalmon.text: And Abimelech gat him up to mount Zalmon, he and all the people that were with him; and Abimelech took an axe in his hand, and cut down a bough from the trees, and took it, and laid it on his shoulder, and said unto the people that were with him, What ye have seen me do, make haste, and do as I have done.

zalmonah.text: And they departed from mount Hor, and pitched in Zalmonah.

zalmunna.text: And he said unto the men of Succoth, Give, I pray you, loaves of bread unto the people that follow me; for they be faint, and I am pursuing after Zebah and Zalmunna, kings of Midian.

zamzummims.text: (That also was accounted a land of giants: giants dwelt therein in old time; and the Ammonites call them Zamzummims;

zanoah.text: And Zanoah, and Engannim, Tappuah, and Enam,

zaphnathpaaneah.text: And Pharaoh called Joseph's name Zaphnathpaaneah; and he gave him to wife Asenath the daughter of Potipherah priest of On. And Joseph went out over all the land of Egypt.

zaphon.text: And in the valley, Betharam, and Bethnimrah, and Succoth, and Zaphon, the rest of the kingdom of Sihon king of Heshbon, Jordan and his border, even unto the edge of the sea of Chinnereth on the other side Jordan eastward.

zara.text: And Judas begat Phares and Zara of Thamar; and Phares begat Esrom; and Esrom begat Aram;

zarah.text: And afterward came out his brother, that had the scarlet thread upon his hand: and his name was called Zarah.

zareah.text: And at Enrimmon, and at Zareah, and at Jarmuth,

zareathites.text: And the families of Kirjathjearim; the Ithrites, and the Puhites, and the Shumathites, and the Mishraites; of them came the Zareathites, and the Eshtaulites.

zared.text: From thence they removed, and pitched in the valley of Zared.

zarephath.text: Arise, get thee to Zarephath, which belongeth to Zidon, and dwell there: behold, I have commanded a widow woman there to sustain thee.

zaretan.text: That the waters which came down from above stood and rose up upon an heap very far from the city Adam, that is beside Zaretan: and those that came down toward the sea of the plain, even the salt sea, failed, and were cut off: and the people passed over right against Jericho.

zarethshahar.text: And Kirjathaim, and Sibmah, and Zarethshahar in the mount of the valley,

zarhites.text: Of Zerah, the family of the Zarhites: of Shaul, the family of the Shaulites.

zartanah.text: Baana the son of Ahilud; to him pertained Taanach and Megiddo, and all Bethshean, which is by Zartanah beneath Jezreel, from Bethshean to Abelmeholah, even unto the place that is beyond Jokneam:

zarthan.text: In the plain of Jordan did the king cast them, in the clay ground between Succoth and Zarthan.

zatthu.text: The chief of the people; Parosh, Pahathmoab, Elam, Zatthu, Bani,

zattu.text: The children of Zattu, nine hundred forty and five.

zavan.text: The sons of Ezer; Bilhan, and Zavan, and Jakan. The sons of Dishan; Uz, and Aran.

zaza.text: And the sons of Jonathan; Peleth, and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.

zeal.text: And the king called the Gibeonites, and said unto them; (now the Gibeonites were not of the children of Israel, but of the remnant of the Amorites; and the children of Israel had sworn unto them: and Saul sought to slay them in his zeal to the children of Israel and Judah.)

zealous.text: Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, hath turned my wrath away from the children of Israel, while he was zealous for my sake among them, that I consumed not the children of Israel in my jealousy.

zealously.text: They zealously affect you, but not well; yea, they would exclude you, that ye might affect them.

zebadiah.text: And Zebadiah, and Arad, and Ader,

zebah.text: And he said unto the men of Succoth, Give, I pray you, loaves of bread unto the people that follow me; for they be faint, and I am pursuing after Zebah and Zalmunna, kings of Midian.

zebaim.text: The children of Shephatiah, the children of Hattil, the children of Pochereth of Zebaim, the children of Ami.

zebedee.text: And going on from thence, he saw other two brethren, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in a ship with Zebedee their father, mending their nets; and he called them.

zebina.text: Of the sons of Nebo; Jeiel, Mattithiah, Zabad, Zebina, Jadau, and Joel, Benaiah.

zeboiim.text: That these made war with Bera king of Sodom, and with Birsha king of Gomorrah, Shinab king of Admah, and Shemeber king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar.

zeboim.text: And the border of the Canaanites was from Sidon, as thou comest to Gerar, unto Gaza; as thou goest, unto Sodom, and Gomorrah, and Admah, and Zeboim, even unto Lasha.

zebudah.text: Jehoiakim was twenty and five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Zebudah, the daughter of Pedaiah of Rumah.

zebul.text: And Gaal the son of Ebed said, Who is Abimelech, and who is Shechem, that we should serve him? is not he the son of Jerubbaal? and Zebul his officer? serve the men of Hamor the father of Shechem: for why should we serve him?

zebulonite.text: And after him Elon, a Zebulonite, judged Israel; and he judged Israel ten years.

zebulun.text: And Leah said, God hath endued me with a good dowry; now will my husband dwell with me, because I have born him six sons: and she called his name Zebulun.

zebulunites.text: These are the families of the Zebulunites according to those that were numbered of them, threescore thousand and five hundred.

zechariah.text: And his brethren by their families, when the genealogy of their generations was reckoned, were the chief, Jeiel, and Zechariah,

zedad.text: From mount Hor ye shall point out your border unto the entrance of Hamath; and the goings forth of the border shall be to Zedad:

zedekiah.text: And Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah made him horns of iron: and he said, Thus saith the LORD, With these shalt thou push the Syrians, until thou have consumed them.

zeeb.text: And they took two princes of the Midianites, Oreb and Zeeb; and they slew Oreb upon the rock Oreb, and Zeeb they slew at the winepress of Zeeb, and pursued Midian, and brought the heads of Oreb and Zeeb to Gideon on the other side Jordan.

zelah.text: And Zelah, Eleph, and Jebusi, which is Jerusalem, Gibeath, and Kirjath; fourteen cities with their villages. This is the inheritance of the children of Benjamin according to their families.

zelek.text: Zelek the Ammonite, Nahari the Beerothite, armourbearer to Joab the son of Zeruiah,

zelophehad.text: And Zelophehad the son of Hepher had no sons, but daughters: and the names of the daughters of Zelophehad were Mahlah, and Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

zelotes.text: Matthew and Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon called Zelotes,

zelzah.text: When thou art departed from me to day, then thou shalt find two men by Rachel's sepulchre in the border of Benjamin at Zelzah; and they will say unto thee, The asses which thou wentest to seek are found: and, lo, thy father hath left the care of the asses, and sorroweth for you, saying, What shall I do for my son?

zemaraim.text: And Betharabah, and Zemaraim, and Bethel,

zemarite.text: And the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite: and afterward were the families of the Canaanites spread abroad.

zemira.text: And the sons of Becher; Zemira, and Joash, and Eliezer, and Elioenai, and Omri, and Jerimoth, and Abiah, and Anathoth, and Alameth. All these are the sons of Becher.

zenas.text: Bring Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing be wanting unto them.

zephaniah.text: And the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the door:

zephath.text: And Judah went with Simeon his brother, and they slew the Canaanites that inhabited Zephath, and utterly destroyed it. And the name of the city was called Hormah.

zephathah.text: Then Asa went out against him, and they set the battle in array in the valley of Zephathah at Mareshah.

zephi.text: The sons of Eliphaz; Teman, and Omar, Zephi, and Gatam, Kenaz, and Timna, and Amalek.

zepho.text: And the sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, and Gatam, and Kenaz.

zephon.text: The children of Gad after their families: of Zephon, the family of the Zephonites: of Haggi, the family of the Haggites: of Shuni, the family of the Shunites:

zephonites.text: The children of Gad after their families: of Zephon, the family of the Zephonites: of Haggi, the family of the Haggites: of Shuni, the family of the Shunites:

zer.text: And the fenced cities are Ziddim, Zer, and Hammath, Rakkath, and Chinnereth,

zerah.text: And these are the sons of Reuel; Nahath, and Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah: these were the sons of Bashemath Esau's wife.

zerahiah.text: And Uzzi begat Zerahiah, and Zerahiah begat Meraioth,

zered.text: Now rise up, said I, and get you over the brook Zered. And we went over the brook Zered.

zereda.text: And Jeroboam the son of Nebat, an Ephrathite of Zereda, Solomon's servant, whose mother's name was Zeruah, a widow woman, even he lifted up his hand against the king.

zeredathah.text: In the plain of Jordan did the king cast them, in the clay ground between Succoth and Zeredathah.

zererath.text: And the three hundred blew the trumpets, and the LORD set every man's sword against his fellow, even throughout all the host: and the host fled to Bethshittah in Zererath, and to the border of Abelmeholah, unto Tabbath.

zeresh.text: Nevertheless Haman refrained himself: and when he came home, he sent and called for his friends, and Zeresh his wife.

zereth.text: And the sons of Helah were, Zereth, and Jezoar, and Ethnan.

zeri.text: Of Jeduthun: the sons of Jeduthun; Gedaliah, and Zeri, and Jeshaiah, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the hands of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied with a harp, to give thanks and to praise the LORD.

zeror.text: Now there was a man of Benjamin, whose name was Kish, the son of Abiel, the son of Zeror, the son of Bechorath, the son of Aphiah, a Benjamite, a mighty man of power.

zeruah.text: And Jeroboam the son of Nebat, an Ephrathite of Zereda, Solomon's servant, whose mother's name was Zeruah, a widow woman, even he lifted up his hand against the king.

zerubbabel.text: And the sons of Pedaiah were, Zerubbabel, and Shimei: and the sons of Zerubbabel; Meshullam, and Hananiah, and Shelomith their sister:

zeruiah.text: Then answered David and said to Ahimelech the Hittite, and to Abishai the son of Zeruiah, brother to Joab, saying, Who will go down with me to Saul to the camp? And Abishai said, I will go down with thee.

zetham.text: The sons of Laadan; the chief was Jehiel, and Zetham, and Joel, three.

zethan.text: The sons also of Jediael; Bilhan: and the sons of Bilhan; Jeush, and Benjamin, and Ehud, and Chenaanah, and Zethan, and Tharshish, and Ahishahar.

zethar.text: On the seventh day, when the heart of the king was merry with wine, he commanded Mehuman, Biztha, Harbona, Bigtha, and Abagtha, Zethar, and Carcas, the seven chamberlains that served in the presence of Ahasuerus the king,

zia.text: And their brethren of the house of their fathers were, Michael, and Meshullam, and Sheba, and Jorai, and Jachan, and Zia, and Heber, seven.

ziba.text: And there was of the house of Saul a servant whose name was Ziba. And when they had called him unto David, the king said unto him, Art thou Ziba? And he said, Thy servant is he.

zibeon.text: Esau took his wives of the daughters of Canaan; Adah the daughter of Elon the Hittite, and Aholibamah the daughter of Anah the daughter of Zibeon the Hivite;

zibia.text: And he begat of Hodesh his wife, Jobab, and Zibia, and Mesha, and Malcham,

zibiah.text: In the seventh year of Jehu Jehoash began to reign; and forty years reigned he in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Zibiah of Beersheba.

zichri.text: And the sons of Izhar; Korah, and Nepheg, and Zichri.

ziddim.text: And the fenced cities are Ziddim, Zer, and Hammath, Rakkath, and Chinnereth,

zidkijah.text: Now those that sealed were, Nehemiah, the Tirshatha, the son of Hachaliah, and Zidkijah,

zidon.text: Zebulun shall dwell at the haven of the sea; and he shall be for an haven of ships; and his border shall be unto Zidon.

zidonians.text: The Zidonians also, and the Amalekites, and the Maonites, did oppress you; and ye cried to me, and I delivered you out of their hand.

zif.text: And it came to pass in the four hundred and eightieth year after the children of Israel were come out of the land of Egypt, in the fourth year of Solomon's reign over Israel, in the month Zif, which is the second month, that he began to build the house of the LORD.

ziha.text: The Nethinims: the children of Ziha, the children of Hasupha, the children of Tabbaoth,

ziklag.text: And Ziklag, and Madmannah, and Sansannah,

zillah.text: And Lamech took unto him two wives: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.

zilpah.text: And Laban gave unto his daughter Leah Zilpah his maid for an handmaid.

zilthai.text: And Elienai, and Zilthai, and Eliel,

zimmah.text: Of Gershom; Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,

zimran.text: And she bare him Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah.

zimri.text: Now the name of the Israelite that was slain, even that was slain with the Midianitish woman, was Zimri, the son of Salu, a prince of a chief house among the Simeonites.

zin.text: So they went up, and searched the land from the wilderness of Zin unto Rehob, as men come to Hamath.

zina.text: And the sons of Shimei were, Jahath, Zina, and Jeush, and Beriah. These four were the sons of Shimei.

zion.text: Nevertheless David took the strong hold of Zion: the same is the city of David.

zior.text: And Humtah, and Kirjatharba, which is Hebron, and Zior; nine cities with their villages:

ziphah.text: And the sons of Jehaleleel; Ziph, and Ziphah, Tiria, and Asareel.

ziphion.text: And the sons of Gad; Ziphion, and Haggi, Shuni, and Ezbon, Eri, and Arodi, and Areli.

ziphites.text: Then came up the Ziphites to Saul to Gibeah, saying, Doth not David hide himself with us in strong holds in the wood, in the hill of Hachilah, which is on the south of Jeshimon?

ziphron.text: And the border shall go on to Ziphron, and the goings out of it shall be at Hazarenan: this shall be your north border.

zippor.text: And Balak the son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.

zipporah.text: And Moses was content to dwell with the man: and he gave Moses Zipporah his daughter.

zithri.text: And the sons of Uzziel; Mishael, and Elzaphan, and Zithri.

ziz.text: To morrow go ye down against them: behold, they come up by the cliff of Ziz; and ye shall find them at the end of the brook, before the wilderness of Jeruel.

ziza.text: And Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah;

zizah.text: And Jahath was the chief, and Zizah the second: but Jeush and Beriah had not many sons; therefore they were in one reckoning, according to their father's house.

zoan.text: And they ascended by the south, and came unto Hebron; where Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the children of Anak, were. (Now Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)

zoar.text: And Lot lifted up his eyes, and beheld all the plain of Jordan, that it was well watered every where, before the LORD destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, even as the garden of the LORD, like the land of Egypt, as thou comest unto Zoar.

zoba.text: And when the children of Ammon saw that they stank before David, the children of Ammon sent and hired the Syrians of Bethrehob, and the Syrians of Zoba, twenty thousand footmen, and of king Maacah a thousand men, and of Ishtob twelve thousand men.

zobah.text: So Saul took the kingdom over Israel, and fought against all his enemies on every side, against Moab, and against the children of Ammon, and against Edom, and against the kings of Zobah, and against the Philistines: and whithersoever he turned himself, he vexed them.

zobebah.text: And Coz begat Anub, and Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel the son of Harum.

zohar.text: And he communed with them, saying, If it be your mind that I should bury my dead out of my sight; hear me, and intreat for me to Ephron the son of Zohar,

zoheleth.text: And Adonijah slew sheep and oxen and fat cattle by the stone of Zoheleth, which is by Enrogel, and called all his brethren the king's sons, and all the men of Judah the king's servants:

zoheth.text: And the sons of Shimon were, Amnon, and Rinnah, Benhanan, and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi were, Zoheth, and Benzoheth.

zophah.text: And the sons of his brother Helem; Zophah, and Imna, and Shelesh, and Amal.

zophai.text: As for Elkanah: the sons of Elkanah; Zophai his son, and Nahath his son,

zophar.text: Now when Job's three friends heard of all this evil that was come upon him, they came every one from his own place; Eliphaz the Temanite, and Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite: for they had made an appointment together to come to mourn with him and to comfort him.

zophim.text: And he brought him into the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, and offered a bullock and a ram on every altar.

zorah.text: And the coast of their inheritance was Zorah, and Eshtaol, and Irshemesh,

zorathites.text: And Reaiah the son of Shobal begat Jahath; and Jahath begat Ahumai, and Lahad. These are the families of the Zorathites.

zoreah.text: And in the valley, Eshtaol, and Zoreah, and Ashnah,

zorites.text: The sons of Salma; Bethlehem, and the Netophathites, Ataroth, the house of Joab, and half of the Manahethites, the Zorites.

zorobabel.text: And after they were brought to Babylon, Jechonias begat Salathiel; and Salathiel begat Zorobabel;

zuar.text: Of Issachar; Nethaneel the son of Zuar.

zuph.text: Now there was a certain man of Ramathaimzophim, of mount Ephraim, and his name was Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephrathite:

zur.text: And the name of the Midianitish woman that was slain was Cozbi, the daughter of Zur; he was head over a people, and of a chief house in Midian.

zuriel.text: And the chief of the house of the father of the families of Merari was Zuriel the son of Abihail: these shall pitch on the side of the tabernacle northward.

zurishaddai.text: Of Simeon; Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.

zuzims.text: And in the fourteenth year came Chedorlaomer, and the kings that were with him, and smote the Rephaims in Ashteroth Karnaim, and the Zuzims in Ham, and the Emims in Shaveh Kiriathaim,
